loans.name: Enesa

texts.en: Enesa F. is divorced and lives with her parents. She is 50 years old and comes from Lohinja, a big village near Gračanica. She is a cook and works in a restaurant. Her parents are very old and have a very low income so Enesa has to help and support them. Beside her regular job, she has her little business organizing weddings and special lunches. Enesa wants to improve her business and she needs special dishes for that. That is the reason that she wants to take a loan from WWI in amount of  600 KM. She hopes that she will be able to offer the best meals to her clients.

loans.use: To buy professional dishes

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Гулсара жительница района  Вахдата .Возраст 31 год,замужем,имеет 1 ребенка.Образование средне-специальное,по специальности продавщица. Гулсара имеет небольшой магазин на рынке.Клиентка торгует  парфюмерией. Закупает оптом товар и реализует его в розницу.На доход от своего бизнеса  она содержит свою семью. На полученный кредит Гулсара хочет увеличить ассортимент магазина.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulsara A. lives in the Vahdat District. She is 31 years old, married, and has one child. She has a technical secondary education specializing in sales. Gulsara has a small store at a market, where she sells toiletries. She buys the goods wholesale and sells retail. The income from her business supports her family. Gulsara will use the loan to expand her store's inventory. The loan will be paid back over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia sells bags of garri (cassava). She started this business in 2007. Before then, she was involved in petty trading, but she was not making enough profits and had to switch over to the garri business. Patricia needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul Kipkemoi K. is a nurse who lives in Roret, Kenya (near Nakuru) with his wife and their four children, who are 12, 10, 8, and 6 years old and in school. He runs a small health clinic, the Roret Medical Clinic, which he opened in 1990. There are no other health facilities in the area. Before he started the clinic, Paul was employed by the local missionary.

The Roret Medical Clinic provides curative services, post-abortion care, family planning services, and pre and post-natal care. Paul is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenya Schillings (1,200 USD) in order to purchase medical equipment, bed linens, and a sterilizer. At present, the clinic does not have running water, so Paul will also use the loan money to install water pipes. He also would like to modernize the clinic and partition off the large rooms to create more space.

In the future, Paul wishes to expand clinic services to include in-patient care.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment, bed linens, sterilizer, and water pipes

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people in Kampong Pou village in Kandal province have formed a village bank loan group and Mrs. Channy C. is the group president. She is a 53 years old widow. Canny is a farmer who owns a piece of land with which she cultivates rice. On her plot of land she faces a problem. The field has infertile soil and produces a poor crop. She decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to strengthen the field to make her crop more productive. 

One member in this group loans is an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to strengthen the field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret K. is currently in the business of selling pits and onions and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Margret is 27 years old and married. Her husband is a watchman. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling pits and onions.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married and has one child. He sells women's clothing at the central market. Vladimir has been in this business for 2 years. He inherited the business from his parents, who are still alive but can not be actively involved in business as they used to be.

Even though Vladimir is new to this business, he has already developed a simple discount policy to retain old customers and attract new ones. Vladimir lives with his wife and daughter in a two-room apartment. He is young and is full of energy to develop this business further, for it is the only income in their family. Vladimir would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase the assortment. He plans to increase sales during the coming spring season, and he needs to get ready for it.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia O. is 47 years old and married to Vicente. They find comfort residing at Calaca-an Misamis Occidental. They are blessed with four children. 

Her husband is retired from the Philippine military and already helps her to manage their small business, a Sari-Sari Store. Letecia has been a good member of Paglaum MPC since 2004. In fact, she manages her business well, and it's a big help for her in meeting the financial needs of her children in school.

She hopes that through the help of Paglaum MPC her business will expand to a mini-grocery store in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase of grocery items

loans.name: Roziyamo

texts.ru: Нзирова Розиямо проживаю в городе Куляб  в возрасте 32-ух лет, замужем имеет 2-их детей.Имеет среднее образования, клиентка занимается животноводством уже более 2-ух лет. Клиент покупает молодой скот, откармливает и перепродаёт.На полученные деньги, клиентка хочет купить несколько молодых овец.Занимаясь этим видом деятельности клиентка помогает содержать семью.
texts.en:
Roziyamo N. lives in the town of Kulob. She is 32 years old, and married with two children. She has a secondary school education, and has raised livestock for more than two years. Roziyamo wants to purchase young animals to fatten for resale. With the money she will receive, Roziyamo wants to buy several lambs. She is able to support her family by doing this sort of work.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small-horned cattle

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo Fredy de 42 años y sus hijos; Carlos de 22, Susana de 20, Antony de 18, Marilyn de 11 y Sandra de 9. Se dedica a la venta  de productos por campaña, siendo un trabajo muy rentable, ya que asegura sus ventas según la demanda de determinados objetos según la temporada, en esta época por ejemplo se viene preparando para la campaña por el día de la madre, donde venderá determinados productos dedicados a este importante día. Su esposo (quien aparece en la foto) se ha venido dedicando al oficio de chofer desde hace 19 años, ya que viene de familia, su padre era dueño de carros con los que trabajaban él y sus hermanos, dedicándose al transporte de pasajeros, comenzando como cobrador de pasajes y pasando luego a ser chofer, actividad que realiza hasta hoy en día, comenzando a las 6y30 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Es por eso, que Clarisa viendo todo el esfuerzo de su esposo, quien ahora está algo enfermo del estómago, quiere apoyarlo, invirtiendo parte del préstamo que solicita para arreglar algunos desperfectos del carro que maneja y sabe que sólo trabajando y apoyándose juntos podrán salir adelante. Este es el primer préstamo que Clarisa tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA, que por falta de tiempo su esposo Fredy ha realizado todos los trámites para el crédito, y ambos se comprometen a pagar puntual todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado, Clarisa comprará productos para la campaña por el día de la madre, y además refaccionarán el carro que maneja su esposo para que pueda brindar un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Clarisa is 43 years old. She lives with her husband who is 42 and their children: Carlos, 22, Susana, 20, Antony, 18, Marilyn, 11, and Sandra, 9. She sells products for campaigns, and she is doing well as she assures her sales in accordance with the demand of certain seasonal objects. For instance, at the moment she is preparing for the campaign for mother's day when she will be selling special products for this important celebration. Her husband (shown in the photo) has been a chauffeur for 19 years, as the rest of his family. He and his brother worked with vehicles owned by his father transporting passengers. He started as a conductor and later he became a chauffeur. He starts work at 6:30 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. Seeing the effort of her husband, who is now suffering from a stomach illness, Clarisa wishes to support him investing part of the loan requested in fixing flaws of the vehicle he drives, and she realizes that only by working and supporting each other can they get ahead. This is Clarisa's first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and due to lack of time her husband, Fredy, has made all the arrangements for the loan, and both are committed to repay punctually. With the money requested, Clarisa will buy products for the campaign for mother's day as well as spare parts for her husband's vehicle so he can provide good service.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for a vehicle and increase stock.

loans.name: Marlin Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Marlin es soltera, de 47 años de edad, trabajadora del MINSA, con 25 años de servicio, 2 hijos: uno trabaja y estudia el 5to año de secundaria, habita en casa de su papá pero estan haciendo los tramites para ponerla a su nombre, esta solicitando su 8vo credito el que utilizara para cambiar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en pesimas condiciones, no recibe apoyo de nadie, pero con su salario el que ha sabido administrar ha podido salir adelande y ha cumplido en tiempo y forma con el pago de las cuotas de sus creditos, pues nunca ha presntado ningun atraso.  Esta satisfecha con la atencion que brinda AFODENIC y no cambiara por otra, pues ya es muy conocida y con tranquilidad plantea sus inquietudes.
texts.en:
Marlin, 47, is single. She has worked for MINSA (Nicaragua Ministry of Health) for 25 years. She has two children. One works and is in the fifth year of secondary studies. She lives in her father’s house, but they are working on the paper work to put it in her name. She is asking for her eighth loan, which will be used to change the roof of her house. The roof is currently in very bad shape. She does not receive help from anyone. But, with her salary, which she has known how to manage, she has been able to get ahead. She has made all of her payments for her loans on time and as agreed upon. She has never been late with any of the loan payments. She is pleased with the attention AFODENIC offers, and she would not change for another. She is well known, and she very calmly raises her concerns.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the roof

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda L., a 56-year-old married mother of three adult-aged children, lives in the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental where she owns and operates a business growing crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and selling crops such as corn, cassava, and bananas. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2005, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and as payment for labor, Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grown. This loan will be her ninth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene K. is a forty-two year-old trader. She is married and has four children who are currently attending school through the help of government compulsory free education. It is her daily dream to provide quality education for her children, to give them better future life. She lives at Adawso, a suburb in the eastern region of Ghana. Within the community, there are diverse business activities and most of them are petty traders. Irene owns and operates grocery shop with items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, soaps, etc.

She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock of different variety, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She hopes to pay the loan in due time because she believes the loan would boost her business growth. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Mmoa’, meaning God’s Help.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Adegoke

texts.en: H. sells plates and knifes in her shop. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. H. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. H. is 38 years old and married, and has 5 children. H. is very happy with the growth of her business. She is hoping for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more plates and knifes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more plates and knifes to sell

loans.name: Mezeil

texts.en:
Mezeil P. is from the village of Calaca-an. She is 26 years old. Mezeil is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mezeil owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. Mezeil is just starting this business.

In 2004, Mezeil joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mezeil has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Mezeil is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Mezeil from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery

loans.name: Ipogolo C Group

texts.en:
Beatry is a member of the Ipogolo C borrower group in Ruaha,Iringa,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 14,08 years.

Beatry started her own business selling food 7 years ago,she works8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Beatry first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the  amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more food commodities like rice,sugar,wheat.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this Loan,Beatry hopes to save money and expand her business.

Venelanda is another member of the same borrower group,she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more  rice,wheat,cooking oil

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 40 años, es una madre muy preocupada por su familia, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 3 hijos; Johan de 19, Lisbeth de 17 y Cristian de 8 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana Carmen abre su bodega para atender a sus clientes, quienes saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse en su barrio y corren a comprar las cosas que necesitan, ella los atiende muy bien y siempre es muy cortés con las personas, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el progreso de su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 12 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Para el futuro anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Carmen con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados implementará mejor su tienda de abarrotes para brindar una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old and a mother who is very concerned about her family. She lives in her own house along with her 3 children, Johan who is 19, Lisbeth of is 17, and Cristian who is 8 years old, who are the motivation for her efforts. At approximately 6 in the morning Carmen opens her store to attend to her clients, who know that this is the first store to open in her neighborhood and run to buy to things they need. She attends to their needs very well and is always very courteous with the people because she knows that the success of her business depends on them. What she likes the most about her work is talking with her clients and learning about things that are happening in her neighborhood. She has worked for 12 years in the business and considers the most difficult part to be having to stay inside her store all day without being able to leave. For the future she longs to be able to grow her business and be able to give her clients better service. This is Carmen's second loan with MFP and hopes to pay it back on schedule, because she does not want to cause problems with other members of her community bank where she is very respected due to the order that she imposes on the group. With the $700 that she is requesting, she could stock her grocery store better to provide more of a variety of products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase commodities

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy K. is an entrepreneur Tanzanian business married woman. She runs a business of selling clothes both new and used at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods from the second hand clothes shops and the Kariakoo city business shopping center in whole sales and retail. Her business is three years old and its income is used to meet the daily family demand. She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Fatama Group

texts.en:
Fatama wants to take out a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver. Fatama wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a shop selling fuel. Zhabida wants to take out a loan for a carpet weaving business. Hormela wants to take out a loan for her husband who works in photography. 

Fatama is the leader of Fatama Group. The four members of this group each want to take out a loan to expand their business. They are requesting a group loan of 30,000 afghanis. They thank AFS and Kiva lenders that provide support all across the world.

loans.use: For business progress

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en: Mary Rose is 40 years old and is married to Jessie. The couple is blessed with two children: Aljay, 15 years old, in high school and Mart Andrew, 10 years old, elementary student. Mary Rose would like to improve their way of living through asking for additional capital from the KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000. Mary Rose is a tricycle operator within their village. Her husband is the one who manages their passengered tricycle. Mary Rose would like to earn a bigger income for their children needs. That’s why she and her husband are striving to work hard for the future welfare of their children. She will be glad if her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: For additional capital for the maintenance of her tricycle business.

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina F. is married to a public utility worker in the municipality and they raise three children who are all enrolled in a public high school.

Edelina is the owner of a small restaurant. Her business is located in Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo where motor-cab drivers and some passengers stop to obtain their food. During weekends, Edelina’s three children assist her in manning the business. She has been operating her small restaurant for almost four years and it proves to be a great help in generating additional income to support her family.

Edelina is currently utilizing her third loan and she is very hopeful that this loan will help in developing her business venture.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her restaurant

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel A. A. de 46 años de edad, reside en  Ciudad Arce junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como vigilante de seguridad privada, y junto a sus dos hijos.
Ella posee una venta de ropa usada la cual la comercializa de manera ambulante por las calles de Ciudad Arce. María solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar más ropa, ya que en esta temporada de fin de año ella logra incrementar sus ventas, María trabaja muy duro y es por esto que es una persona muy respetada y querida por sus vecinos, los cuales dan muy buenas referencias de ella.
texts.en:
María Isabel A. A. is 46 years old. She lives in the city of Arce together with her husband, who works as a private security guard, and their two sons. María sells used clothes. She travels the streets of Arce to sell them. She is asking for a loan so she can buy more clothes since in this year-end season she has increased sales. María works very hard, so she is well-respected and loved by her neighbors, all of whom give her good references.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna G., 58 years old, comes from Morong, in the growing province of Rizal, where there are many enterprises. She is married to Dario G., a farmer.  She is a diligent and careful mother of two children.
Myrna's husband's income is not enough to meet the needs of their family. Therefore, in 2005, Myrna got the idea of joining ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. She was given hope and a way to have access to capital, so she started her printing business. The business went smoothly and brings them good income. She is also involved in the farming business and they help each other in running their family businesses.

Currently on her sixth loan, Myrna proposes the amount of Php 30,000 as additional capital to purchase stock and more supplies for her printing business. Stock includes items such as T-shirts for printing, assorted paints, and silk; the loan will also be use for purchasing fertilizer for their farming business.

Myrna has disciplined herself to use all of the borrowed capital from ASHI-KIVA for her business, in order to gain more profit and to use that profit to support daily expenses.

She has been an ASHI member for four years (4).  ASHI paved the way for the achievement of the dreams of her family, to send her children to school and to finish their studies with a degree. She also hasn't stopped dreaming for her grandchildren, and wants to offer them the best education, such as she provided for her children. The couple feels very happy with the loan that made their lives to be better than before. Myrna wishes all lenders all the best and good luck and will continue to support her family and the expanded business.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for printing business (T-shirts, assorted paints,silk) and also fertilizer for farming business.

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en:
Phoung S., 43, is married and lives with his five children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia in the Mean Chhey District. 

S. and his wife have been involved in growing morning glories for sale since 1998 and are able to earn an income of $9 per day. The family is also assisted by two of his children who are currently working at a restaurant. Each earns an income of $5 each per day to help cover the family expenses. 

S. and his children try to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses. 

As a result, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to purchase seeds to grow more morning glories for his existing customers at the market. This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy morning glory seeds.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um P., 59, is widowed and lives with her two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Phunn is a housewife. The family is supported, mainly, by her two children who are employed in a private company. They earn an income of USD 8 each, per day. P. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get rid with the daily necessary expenses. Therefore, P. is requesting a loan of US $800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work easily. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work.

loans.name: Reyna Anabel

texts.es:
La señora Reyna S. ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con el fin de brindarle a su familia un techo seguro y un lugar en buenas condiciones donde vivir. Ella es madre soltera por lo que realiza un doble trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar y sin la ayuda de otra persona ha iniciado con la labor de construcción de su vivienda en el departamento de Chinandega.
Está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los materiales de construcción como zinc, clavos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra. Ella espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado para llegar a ver su sueño cumplido como lo es el tener un techo digno y una casa en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Reyna has started making improvements to her home in order to provide a good roof over her family’s heads and give them a good place to live. She is a single mother who works twice as hard as she must put food on the table and without anyone else’s help, has started renovating her home in the Chinandega area. She is asking for this loan in order to buy building materials, such as zinc metal sheeting, nails, cement, sand and to pay for labor. She hopes that this loan will be granted so that she can fulfill her dream of having a dignified home in perfect condition.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Gorere

texts.en:
Gorere S. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and onions in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of onions to sell.  Gorere is 44 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build houses for renting.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of onions to sell.

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoeurn L. is a 31-year-old farmer. She plants rice and some vegetable crops which she will harvest and sell to the buyers when the crops come to maturity. She has a partner in her husband who is a vehicle repairman. He also assists her in farming their crops. This couple has been married for many years and they have a school-aged child who is in the secondary school.

Chhoeurn L. has bought some housing tools in order to build a new house, but the construction has not started due to this process requiring other essential accessories. Chhoeurn L. is asking for a loan to buy extra equipment in order to begin building her new house.

loans.use: To buy extra equipment in order to begin building her new house

loans.name: Flora's Group

texts.en: To make a living, Flora U. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Gud, San Isidro, Isabela. Flora has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Flora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Flora is the leader of a 12 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Flora U.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El señor Justo vive en casa familiar con su esposa en la zona alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la reparación de motores de autos, electrodomésticos, etc. También tiene un taxi con el cual trabaja en transporte público.

El crédito que solicita es para conversión de gasolina a gas de su vehiculo, de esta manera conservar esta otra fuente de ingresos.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Kiva a través de Impro. El análisis socio-económico y el carácter social del crédito le permiten acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Justo lives in the family home with his wife in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood of La Paz. He repairs auto engines, home appliances, etc. He also has a taxi with which he provides public transportation services. He is asking for funds to convert his vehicle from gasoline to gas in order to keep this additional source of income. This is his first loan request from Kiva through Impro. The socio-economic analysis and social nature of the loan demonstrate his eligibility for it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For gasoline to gas conversion for his taxi.

loans.name: Viki De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Viki de los Ángeles O. C., es una persona  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de ropa y prendas. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de ropa y Calzado para caballeros, damas y niños, que se vende mucho.

Es  soltera, sin hijos, de ella solo dependen sus padres con los que vive actualmente. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.

Lleva 7 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
La señora Viki de los Ángeles O. C., es una persona emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de ropa y prendas. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de ropa y Calzado para caballeros, damas y niños, que se vende mucho. Es soltera, sin hijos, de ella solo dependen sus padres con los que vive actualmente. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica. Lleva 7 créditos en CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para  invertir en la compra de mercadería como: blusas, pantalones, ropa interior y prendas.

loans.name: Miriam Janett

texts.es:
Mariam de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos de 17, 10 y 3 años de edad. Inicio con su tienda hace 10 años atrás, invirtiendo sus ahorros en arroz, azúcar y enlatados. Sus hijos y ella tuvieron que adaptarse y construir en la parte delantera de su casa un pequeño local para su tienda. 

Por la buena decisión que tomo ella ahora tiene una tienda surtida con muchos productos, con los ingresos de la tienda ha podido sustentar su hogar durante 10 años. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.

El préstamo lo quiere utilizar para los útiles escolares de sus hijos, como cuadernos, libros y lápices ya que empezaron la temporada escolar. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariam, 47, lives in a periurban area in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She has three children who are 17, 10 and 3 years of age, respectively. She opened her store 10 years ago investing her savings in rice, sugar and canned goods. Her children and she had to adapt to having the front part of their small house converted into a store. This good decision that she made led to a well-stocked store that has lots of different products available. Income from the store has supported the home for 10 years. She is open for business from 6 am until 10 pm every day. She will use the loan to buy school supplies for her children like: notebooks, textbooks and pencils because the new school term has begun. In the future, she would like to finish building her house and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, textbooks, pencils.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vy B. is 48 years old and a villager who lives in Roka village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ek Soat, are farmers who own 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice. 

To support her farming business, Mrs. Vy B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. 

Aside from farming, Mrs. Vy B. is sells Khmer cake and sugar palm to earn a small income to support her family. She and her husband have four children, who all are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: José Ignacio

texts.es:
José Ignacio A. N. tiene 47 años de edad. Es casado, y vive con su esposa y 4 hijos, Clara (24), Patricia (13), Daysi (11) y Josué (6), en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. 

José es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

José se dedica al criadero de cuyes y pollos y cultiva hortalizas. Hace las compras en la plaza central de San Pablo y las ventas en su casa, a veces en la feria también.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de hortalizas, y pollos de crías y para construir un pequeño galpón de pollos. Piensa que podría comprar especies nuevas con este crédito, entonces incrementar en cantidad especies menores. Sus metas para los próximos años es incrementar mas su negocio, que sus hijos trabajen cada quien en su negocio y que sigan en los estudios, y que el termine de pagar sus deudas. Enfrenta poco desafíos en su trabajo, la competencia es el mayor.

Le gustan las diversiones del carnaval, fiestas de la parroquia San Pedro y San Pablo (pueblos cercanos de San Miguel), hacer deportes y leer las memorias de las capacitaciones que recibió de la Cooperativa.
texts.en:
José Ignacio A. N. is 47 years old. He's married, and lives with his wife and 4 children, Clara (24), Patricia (13), Daysi (11), and Josué (6), in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar province. José is a member of the Santiagopamba solidarity group, located in San Pablo, half an hour from the town of San Miguel. The group is mostly made up of people who work in agriculture as their source of income. José raises guinea pigs and chickens and grows vegetables. He does his buying from the central plaza of San Pablo and sells from his house, as well as sometimes in the market. He is asking for the loan to buy vegetable seeds and chicks, as well as to build a chicken coop. He thinks he can buy new species with this loan, thus increasing in number some of his smaller species. His goals for the coming years are: to further increase his business, that his children all work in his business and continue with their studies, and to pay his debts. He faces a few challenges in his work, with competition being the greatest. He enjoys carnival attractions, the festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo parishes (towns near San Miguel), playing sports, and reading training materials from his Cooperative.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vegetable seeds, chicks, and to build a small chicken coop

loans.name: Talanesu Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu S., Hawa S. and Hawa K. of the "Talanesu" group. Talanesu is a Temne term meaning "Believe in us". They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small town, near Freetown.

They are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to improve their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, they will make better profits and improve their standard of living.

Kadiatu S. is the leader of this group. She is thirty years of age and was born in a place called Benguma, near Waterloo. She is married to a businessman and they have four children.

Kadiatu sells market food such as onions, pepper, salt, Margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), rice and palm-oil (the country's favorite cooking oil) and has been a businesswoman for four years now. With this loan, she will be able to buy more cooking ingredients like palm-oil, rice, onions and pepper.

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Kadiatu Bah on the left, handing over the loan).

loans.use: To buy more cooking ingredients to sell like palm-oil, rice, fish, onions and pepper

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 69 years old. Rosita is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling different kinds of vegetables in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom C., 49 years old, lives in the capital city of Phnom Penh. She owns a small store inside the local market where she sells a variety of cakes. She generates a profit of approximately US $5 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses with more stability. Mom C. has a life partner in her husband who sells fish sauce around his community. The couple helps each other in order to earn money to support their three children who attend school. Mom C. will be using part of this loan to improve her cake business and the rest to increase the capital of her husband's business.

loans.use: To improve her cake business and increase the capital of her husband's business

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam es madre dedicada de tres hermosos hijos, vive junto con su mama quien la apoyado para poder ayudarse económicamente y moral ya que no cuenta con el padre de sus hijos.
Por varios años se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, pero ahora esta vendiendo tortillas y nacatamales productos que ve mas rápido su dinero aunque mas cansado. Pero para ella el trabajar mas es la sastifacion de ver a sus hijos bien.
Con este préstamo lograra la compra de tres quintales de maíz, carbón, también se afiliara en Avon para comenzar a vender cosmético,  con el objetivo de circular su capital, teniendo mejores ganancias. Ha trabajado con Afodenic diez ciclos siendo una puerta de apoyo para su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a mother who is devoted to her three beautiful children. She lives with her mother who has helped support her economically and morally since she can’t depend on the father of her children. For several years she has sold clothing but now is selling tortillas and nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) because these products sell more quickly and, although more taxing work, she sees her money sooner. For her, though, work entails the satisfaction of seeing her children be well. She will use this loan to buy three quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of corn and some charcoal. She will also affiliate herself with Avon to start selling cosmetics and earn better profits. She has collaborated with Afodenic for 8 cycles these being a source of support for her small business

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three quintales (a weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of corn and some charcoal for her tortilla sales business.  She will also sell Avon cosmetics for better economic results.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 51 años, vive en casa de su hermano en compañía de su 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya son mayores, y  juntos habitan un barrio populoso al norte de la ciudad. Hace más de 14 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca. Dice que empezó en el negocio como jugando, ya pasaron varios años, y en la actualidad  no solo obtiene buenas ganancias por sus ventas, si no también, por captar nuevos clientes y vendedoras para que ofrezcan la marca. Lo que más le gusta de su empleo es ofrecer los variados productos y recomendar a sus compradoras los cosméticos que mejor le quedan; pero afirma que no le gusta caminar mucho en busca de nuevas clientes, pero los incentivos que recibe de la empresa la motivan bastante. Para ella su labor  es tranquila y obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente. Mas adelante tiene planeado aumentar la cantidad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, pues desea mejorar sus ganancias. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete una vez más, como en anteriores oportunidades ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas; pues desea continuar trabajando en busca del progreso; además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en productos de belleza, perfumes, además de accesorios pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir, de esta manera espera ganar más.
texts.en:
María, age 51, lives in her brother's house in the company of her 4 children, of whom 2 are already adults. Together, they live in a densely populated neighborhood in the north of the city. For more than 14 years, she has worked selling a well-known brand of beauty products. She says she began the business just for fun, and then several years passed, and currently she not only obtains good profits from her sales, but also is able to attract new clients and sellers to offer the brand. What she likes most about her job is offering a variety of products and recommending the cosmetics that best suit her customers. She reports that she does not like walking a lot in search of new customers, but the incentives she receives from the company are very motivating for her. She finds the work pleasant, and she obtains a steady income which allows her to live comfortably. In the future, she plans to increase the number of products she offers to her customers, since she would like to increase her earnings. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and once again she promises, as in previous opportunities, to be punctual in making her payments, since she wants to continue working in her quest to get ahead. In addition, she is very grateful to all of those people who made the loan possible. María plans to invest the loan she is requesting in buying a larger quantity of merchandise, including beauty products and perfumes, in addition to accessories, since she has a number of pending orders to fill. In this way, she hopes to earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking more beauty products so she can fill her pending orders

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is 47 years old and married to Haron Bunei. They have been blessed with seven children: Kipkorir (26 years old), Josephine (24), Anette (22), Faith (19), Erick (17), Carolyne (15), and Kipchumba (13).

Mary runs a kiosk where she sells products like sugar, rice, tea leaves, and salt in small quantities. Her business gives her an average profit of KES 1,000 per month, which she uses to help her husband support their family. Mary started this business three years ago and hopes that the business will grow with a loan from KADET LTD.
 
She has borrowed KES 5,000 for her first loan with KADET LTD. She intends to use the money to buy products for resale: KES 3,500 to buy sugar and KES 1,500 to buy tea leaves. Mary will use the profits from the business to expand the business and also to pay school fees for her children. Her hope is to expand her business to eventually sell products wholesale and to be able to employ people in her business. She also hopes to be able to fully meet the needs of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina A., age 60, is from the village of Mandih. Marcelina and her husband have four children. To make a living, Marcelina raises pigs for sale. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

Marcelina joined PMPC this year to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marcelina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Neth's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Neth P., is a 47-year-old married womA. who was selected president of this eighteen-member bank loA. group in Tuol Sophi village, Kandal province. P. earns her living by selling fish A. the local market. Her husband, Mr. Men MeA., 53, sells Khmer natural medicines. They are able to earn a small income to support their famiL.. But their house is old and they want to fix it up so P. would like to ask for a loA. to add her savings to buy lumber. The couple has five children: three are seamstresses in the garment factO. while the others are students in the local school.

loans.use: To add her savings to buy lumber to fix her house.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo A. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 62 years old. Alfredo is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Alfredo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor cab transport services. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Alfredo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 19,700 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the eleventh loan taken out by Alfredo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame KHADY T. est une femme de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL depuis le 25 février 2005

Elle fait un commerce de céréales, de bissap, d'arachides, de niébé et de mil.

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'augmenter ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale tout en renforçant ses épargnes
texts.en:
Ms Khady T., aged 32, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Ndondol since February 25, 2005.

Her activity consists in selling cereals, roselle, groundnuts, black-eyed peas and millet. Her loan will enable her to increase her inventory and her profit.

Her aim is to help with household expenses, while saving some money.

loans.use: To finance her cereals business

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora, con un pequeño negocio la venta de comida en su casa de habitación, el cual lleva varios años elaborando ricas fritanga.
Ha sido una madre esforzada para apoyar  a sus hijos, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre. Pero gracias a su empeño y apoyo de  la institución mediante su crédito ha logrado incrementar las ventas, con un menú variado. 
Es su octavo ciclo lo que su préstamo será para comprar productos en granos básicos, frutas, verduras, carne, pollo, lácteos, tasas, vasos, de plásticos como bolsa para empaque, leña ya que cocina en fuego de leña ya que es de menos gasto aunque se ajita mas. Contenta por hacer posible su nivel de ventas diarias, ya que hay día que no se vende todo pero se equilibra con su capital.
texts.en: Maria is an entrepreneurial woman with a small business of selling prepared food from her home; for several years she has been making tasty fritanga dishes (a type of fried food) Maria has been working very hard to support her children, given that she does not have the support of the father. But thanks to her efforts and the help of the institution that provides her loans, she has been able to increase her sales with a varied menu. This is Maria's eighth loan cycle and the funds will be used to purchase supplies such as staple grains, fruit, vegetables, meat, chicken, dairy products, cups and glasses, plastic wrap for packaging, as well as firewood which Maria uses for cooking since it is the least expensive option. Maria is happy about her daily sales volume, since although there are days when she does not sell the whole stock, it evens out with the help of her working capital.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients such as staple grains, fruit, vegetables, dairy products, meat, and chicken

loans.name: Laritess

texts.en: Laritess H. is from the village of Barangay Mauan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Laritess owns and operates a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Laritess has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Laritess joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laritess has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Laritess is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Laritess from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Blanca Eicidoris

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar encontramos a La señora Blanca Tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  cuatro hijos, uno ya es mayor de edad pero aun viven con ella, los otros de 17, 16 y 13 años estudian en colegio. Su esposo es electricista. Estuvo  en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio pero luego se retiró y volvió al mismo hace ya tres años, le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.

Ella tiene una carreta en la cual vende bocadillos, y comida rápidas entre lo que vende tenemos los corviches, empanadas, maduros fritos entre otros, trabaja todos los días sabados y domingos todo el dia, nos cuenta que esto lo viene realizando por muchos años ya que  es una forma decente de ganarse la vida y además porque es un negocio independiente que además le ha dado tiempo para estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar plátano, maní y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los productos que ella vende. Sus sueños son tener una casa mejor arreglada.
texts.en:
In the parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Communal Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

In this place we find Blanca. She is 46 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has four children: one child is grown but still lives with her. The others are 17, 16, and 13 years old and are going to school. Her husband is an electrician. She has been with the communal bank almost since it started but then she left and came back again three years ago. She likes it because of the resources for going after loans.

She has a stand where she sells bocadillos (similar to sub sandwiches) and fast food, including corviches (deep-fried stuffed pastries made with bananas, fish, and onion), pies, fried plantains, etc. She works every day, Saturdays and Sundays included, all day. She tells us that she has been doing this for years because it is a good way to make a living, besides it is an independent business, and it has given her time to take care of her children's needs.

This loan will be for buying plantains, peanuts, and other ingredients for preparing the products she sells. Her dream is to have a more tidy home.

loans.use: Purchase plantains, peanuts, and more products for making meals.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es: Jesusa tiene 40 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 17 años tomó una decisión muy importante, que fue la de emprender su propio negocio, es así que instaló una tienda que acondicionó dentro de su domicilio. Desde entonces se dedica a su tienda, en ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan en el trabajo atendiendo a sus clientes. Por otro lado, ha logrado implementar a su tienda un centro de llamadas; de esa manera le genera más ingresos económicos. Le agrada ser independiente, por eso trabaja con mucho tesón y siempre busca la forma de que sus ventas sean de ganancias rentables, ante esto tiene planeado ampliar su tienda y suministrarla con variados productos. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en: Jesusa is 40 years old and lives with her two children in a house that she owns.  She made a very important decision more than 17 years ago to undertake her own business.  That is how she came to set up a store in her house.  Since then, she has worked at her store and her children help her occasionally, tending to her customers.  She has also set up a call center in her store and this way, she earns more money.  She is happy to be independent and that is why she works with a lot of determination and always looks for a way for her sales to be profitable.  She plans to expand her store and stock it with various products.  This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support, as she has always proven to be responsible with her payments.  She is also pleased to be part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She is grateful for all those who will fund the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  With the loan requested, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 30 years old and married.  He has two children between the ages 3 and 8 years old. His wife is a teacher. He owns a clean and well-organized animal sales business. He has been in this business for three years and is open from as early as 6am until 6pm in the evening. He employs two people.

Vincent will use the loan to purchase more chickens and rabbits to sell. He would like to continue to expand and will use any profits he makes for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and rabbits to sell.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS UNIDAS” es un grupo que iniciará el onceavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por trece personas, 1 varón y 12 mujeres. Es un grupo muy unido, que le gusta compartir, en la foto aparecen once socias activas, una socia (chaleco café a cuadros)que temporalmente se esta retirando del grupo y no salen en la foto Doña Ines que se encuentra sirviendo la comida y doña Jeannette que se encontraba en el consultorio de salud.

La asociación comunal “AMIGAS UNIDAS” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Lucila, la tesorera la señora  Valeria y como secretario de actas el señor Elias.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción.

En el caso de la señora  Valeria,  la tesorera de la asociación comunal, indica que  actualmente tiene como negocio junto con su esposo, el pintado de cabinas (cabezas) de camiones.   El esposo como empleado de una empresa aprendió a pintar autos ahora ambos trabajan en el pintado de cabinas de camion.  Con los primeros créditos pudo comprar soplete, compresora y oxigeno, elementos necesarios para su trabajo.  El crédito de ahora será invertido en la compra de estas cabinas (se trata de la compra de cabinas de segunda mano, que han quedado dañadas por el tiempo o un accidente), para lograr esta compra la señora viaja a ciudades cercanas de la ciudad de El Alto:  Oruro y Cochabamba.  Las ventas son realizadas en el mismo taller.

La señora Valeria,  es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ha trabajado con Pro Mujer desde hace doce ciclos.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “AMIGAS UNIDAS” (United Friends) communal bank is starting its 11th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 13 members; one man and 12 women.  The group is very unified; they like to share.  Eleven active members appear in the photo.  One of the members (in the brown checked vest) is temporarily dropping out of the group and Inés, who is serving food, and Jeannette, who was at the health clinic, don’t appear in the photo.

The “AMIGAS UNIDAS” communal bank set up its governing board thus:  Lucila is President, Valeria is Treasurer and Elias is Recording Secretary.  The businesses the communal bank members are involved in are varied; they have to do with commerce, services and production.

Valeria, communal bank Treasurer, indicates that the business she currently has together with her husband is painting truck cabins.  When her husband was employed at a firm he learned how to pain autos and now they both work painting truck cabins.  She used the initial loans to buy a soldering iron, compressor and oxygen, all necessary elements for the work.  The current loan will be used to buy the cabins (it’s a matter of buying them second hand, the ones that have been damaged by time or by an accident).  To accomplish the purchase she travels to cities near El Alto:  Oruro and Cochabamba.  Sales take place at her workshop.

Valeria is a 30 year old woman living with her husband and three children.  She has collaborated with Pro Mujer for twelve cycles.  When she is asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes sharing with her fellow members.

loans.use: To buy second hand truck cabins.

loans.name: York Road Traders Group

texts.en:
Please meet members of the “York Road Traders” group from Waterloo, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Aminata is the leader of this group. A native of Waterloo town, Aminata is married to a soldier and they have two children. Aminata has been a businesswoman for many years now and she sells palm-oil and cosmetics. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of palm-oil and cosmetics in large quantity to add to her business.

(Also included in the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. C. handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy palm-oil and cosmetics

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Ty P., 43, resides in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. P. sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a machine to produce coconut milk for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to produce coconut milk for sale

loans.name: Daira Susana

texts.es:
Este es el segundo credikiva de Dayra Susana y està muy contenta por lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo con el anteriormente recibido;  ahora se dispone a volver a invertir, aprovechando que se avecina el dia de las madres, que es una època muy  comercial durante todo el mes. 
Dayra aun recuerda cuando iniciò cuando le traian la mercancia a su casa mediante el sistema de crédito, asì vendia colonias, perfumes, ropa ; ahora compra directamente y las ganacias son superiores, porque sus precios son mas econòmicos y puede escoger lo que ella necesita y en la calidad que desea ofrecer a sus clientes, asi ellos se benefican con precios y ella fideliza a sus compradores. Dayra reconoce que con sus creditos con la FundaciónMario Santo Domingo,  ha ido gradualmente cumpliendo sus metas pero eso si trabajando arduamente con mucha disciplina; por eso ahora con su segundo credikiva, comprará cosméticos, ropa femenina, electrodomésticos menores, accesorios y calzado, que le aumentarán el volumen de  sus ventas y logrará acceso a nuevos clientes; mientras sigue trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida como poco a poco lo ha realizado para sacar adelante a su hijo de 20 años, con el cual quiere cumplir su màxima realizaciòn de verlo exitoso en un futuro no muy lejano. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Dayra ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/215541
texts.en: This is Dayra Susana’s second loan with kiva, and she is happy to have increased her working capital with what she received previously.  She is now preparing to invest once more, to take advantage of mothers’ day, which is close, and which is busy throughout the entire month.  Dayra still recalls, when she started up, how they brought merchandise to her house, under a credit arrangement.  She would sell cologne, perfume, clothing.  Now she buys directly, and her earnings are higher, because her prices are lower, and she can choose what she needs, and the quality she wishes to offer her customers.  They enjoy lower prices, and she gains their loyalty.  Dayra recognizes that, with her loans from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she has gradually been achieving her goals, but through very hard work and strict discipline.  Thus, with her second kiva loan, she will buy cosmetics, women’s clothing, small appliances, accessories, and footwear, which will increase her sales and bring her new customers.  This, as she continues to work to improve their living conditions, as she has been doing slowly to help her 20-year-old son get ahead.  She hopes to see her highest goal achieved, that is, that he will be successful in the not-too-distant future.  If you wish to read Dayra’s story, visit this link:  http://kiva.org/lend/215541

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, women's clothing, small appliances, accessories, and footwear.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a Ugandan male, aged 29 years, who needs a loan to buy sugar to sell in his retail shop. He hails from Kyenjojo district and is a father of two children, ages 5 and 2 years, dreaming of educating his children. Emmanuel has been in business for two years. He started in agriculture where he accumulated his start up capital. He wants to open a wholesale shop in the future despite challenges of high transport costs and fluctuating prices.

loans.use: to buy sugar for retail sale

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
Edmundo es natural de la ciudad de Kimbiri, tiene 47 años de edad y es un hombre trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Fernandina de 46 años y sus tres queridos hijos, juntos  residen en la comunidad de Palestina Baja caserío del distrito de Kimbiri. Edmundo, es un hombre de mucho provecho y se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno en donde cultiva cacao, café y maní. Tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad y es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el agro. Edmundo en tiempos de cosecha busca el apoyo de los jornaleros para que le apoyen en las extracciones de los frutos; siendo sus plantas mas rentables los granos de maní y cacao, debido a que tienen mayor demanda las empresas nacionales acopiadoras de cuyos productos le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo y del que son exportados. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos quienes se encargan de dañar los frutos de las plantas. Más adelante comprará más terrenos para expandir sus sembiros y aumentar su producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo.
Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en: Edmundo is originally from the city of Kimbiri. He is 47 years old and he is a hard working man. He lives in a house which he owns together with his wife, Fernandina, 46 years old, and their three beloved children.  They live together in the community of Palestina Baja in the district of Kimbiri. Edmundo is a man of great pleasure and he works in his business with great care. His work consists of working the land. He is an agriculturist and he has 4 hectares of land where he cultivates cocoa, coffee, and peanuts. He has been in the business for 20 years and he is well acquainted with the arduous work involved in agriculture. During the harvest seasons he seeks the help of farm hands who help him collect the products. His most profitable plants are the peanuts and cocoa because they are in highest demand by the national distributors. They pay very well for each kilogram which is exported. The problem that he sees with his business is that he is unable to combat the insects that harm the products. In the future he will purchase more land to expand his plantations and to increase production. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He has the obligation of making his loan payments on time and he is ready to comply if he wants to access another loan. He is thankful to the organization for granting him this loan. With the loan that he requests he will purchase organic fertilizer to fertilize his fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Jovial Group

texts.fr:
Mme Fatimata  est la représentante du groupe JOVIAL. Elle est marié et mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé à 18ans  et le moins âgé à 9 mois.3de ses enfants vont à l’école et elle prend 3 personnes a sa charge.
 
Mme  vend de la patte d’arachide et du zoom koom (jus de petit mille) depuis 3 ans. Elle s’approvisionne à goursi un village du Burkina faso.ses clients sont ses voisins du quartier.

Elle veut  s'acheter 9 sacs d’arachides et un sac de petit mil.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut s’occuper de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un machine à décortiquer et à écraser pour  ses arachides et prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants  afin de leur assurer un avenir radié.
texts.en:
Madame Fatimata is the representative of the Jovial group. She is married and the mother of four children, the oldest of whom is 18 and the youngest, nine months. Three of her children go to school, and she also supports three other people.

Madame Fatimata has been selling peanut butter and "zoom koom" (a drink made from millet and ginger) for three years. She gets her supplies in Goursi, a village in Burkina Faso, and her clients are her neighbors. She would like to buy nine bags of peanuts and one bag of millet.

With her profits, she would like to take care of her children. Her goals are to buy a machine to shell and grind the peanuts and to pay for her children's schooling, in order to make sure they have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy nine bags of peanuts and one bag of millet

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre casado, con dos hijos y tiene 63 años de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su familia, en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, en uno de los caseríos de este lugar. La comunidad de Luis, se caracteriza por ser una zona de agrícolas y ganaderos. Esta comunidad rural se encuentra a 40 minutos del distrito de Tambogrande.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura. Cuenta con terreno agrícola donde cultiva limón y ají semanalmente. Además Luis tiene un ganado ovino, el cual cría para luego comercializarlo en el mercado de su localidad. Su esposa también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, aves de corral, las cuales comercializa junto a su esposo en el mercado. Existe una buena relación familiar lo que permite que ambos negocios se desarrollen adecuadamente.

Luis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes especiales para su cultivo de limón y ají que le permitirán tener una mejor producción que venderá a mejores precios. Además destinará parte del préstamo en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado y las aves de corral de su esposa. 

Luis es un cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad. Su primer crédito fue Kiva y lo canceló puntualmente. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele este préstamo pues le sería de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Luis is 63 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in his own home together with his family, in a small village, in Tambogrande district, Piura.   Luis' community is noted as being an area where people farm and raise livestock.  This rural community is 40 minutes from Tambogrande district.

Luis is a farmer.  He owns farm land where he grows lemons and chilis weekly.  Luis also has a flock of sheep which he raises and then sells in the market in his village.
