Luis' wife raises animals (poultry) which she sells alongside her husband in the market.  They have a good family relationship which allows both businesses to develop adequately.

Luis is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy special fertilizers for his lemon and chili crops.  This will enable him to grow better crops that he will be able to sell for better prices.  In addition, he will use some of the loan money to buy balanced feed for his flock of sheep and his wife's birds.

Luis is an existing client of our organization.  His first loan was from Kiva and he repaid it on time.  He would be very grateful to receive this loan

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and balanced feed

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia works hard to support her family. Sofia is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sofia is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Sofia is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove,she is saving money, she's helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cookstove.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married with four children, all adults. She has been in farming for over 30 years, producing milk and maize and selling her products in the local market. She is helped by one farm hand.

Beatrice has made a request for 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank for her farm. She says her farming production and income will increase, and that the tank will save her much time in fetching water for the animals.

Beatrice reiterates that Juhudi's financial services are of great help to farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 23 года. Холост. У него высшее образование, он технолог. Муродали арендует помещение, где занимается починкой мобильных телефонов. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения запчастей мобильных телефонов.
texts.en: Murodali lives in the Vose district.  He is 23 years old and single.  He has a higher education; he is a technician.  Murodali leases a space, where he repairs mobile phones.  He has been involved in this type of business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts for mobile phones.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for mobile phones

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Nyamsuren, 42, is an accountant. She lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an accountant at a private food company since 2002. Her husband, Mr. Erdenechuluun, works as a watchman at another company. He wants to change his job and start a taxi business. It is more efficient for their family's lifestyle and will provide adequate monthly earnings. But there is a financial problem about the car payment. It is 2400 USD. Therefore Nyamsuren is taking a loan to aggregate the car payment in order to afford to start a taxi business.

loans.use: To aggregate the car payment in order to afford to start a taxi business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old.  He is married and lives in his own house in Hioma, Uganda.  He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family and his dream is to set up a sustainable income generating activity.  He has a produce business and has been doing it for 3 years. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital and hopes that in the future his business will grow bigger into a food store. 

John intends to use this loan to buy groundnuts, maize and beans to resell.

loans.use: buy groundnuts, maize and beans to resell

loans.name: Estrillita

texts.en:
Estrillita is 59 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. She earns a living through farming. Estrillita grows rice crops to sell. She works hard to support her family and send her children to school.

Estrellita will use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is a 38-year-old married woman. She is married to Mr. Chomreurn who operates a business as a taxi driver. From this business sector, her husband can earn about $4 per day. Touch and her husband have given birth to three children. One of her daughters is now employed as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh city where she can earn an adequate salary per month and the other two children are attending school. 

To upgrade their living conditions, Touch and her husband wish to purchase a motorbike but they lack money so they wish to apply for some funds through HKL, partner with Kiva. Touch and her husband are expecting that this loan will make their family happy and prosperous, and they will be able to send their children to study at higher levels. This is her first loan with HKL.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Clemencia Victoria

texts.es:
Clemencia Victoria tiene 43 años, Es Viuda vive con los hijos de doce y once  años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de  maíz, arroz y fréjol gandúl
Clemencia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol gandúl y comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos agrícolas para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito ha logrado tratar y mantener en buenas condiciones el terreno para poder sembrar y obtener un producto eficaz para venderlo.
Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio para poder producir aún más..

En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música cuando camina.
texts.en:
Clemencia Victoria is 43 years old.  She is a widow who lives with her children, who are 12 and 11, in the Ventanas Canton of the Los Rios Province.  

The members of the San José de los Amarillos Communal Bank meet at Amarillos, which is part of the Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank deals with short-cycle agricultural work, such as the planting of corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Clemencia works in agriculture planting corn and rice.  She buys her products from Comercial Murillo and sells them in the same place.

She is asking for this loan to plant corn, rice, and pigeon peas and to buy supplies, fertilizers, urea, and farming fertilizer for the crops.  With the loan's help she has been able to treat her land and keep it in good condition to be able to plant and yield produce worthy of sale.

She deals with challenges such as plagues, diseases, and weather changes.  Her dream is to grow her business to be able to produce even more.

In her free time she likes to listen to music while going for walks.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice, and pigeon peas and to buy supplies, fertilizers, urea, and farming fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina, 53 years old, is married and has 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Carina has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 20 years. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Carina has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She also earns an income from food vending. Carina hopes to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.ru: Имоилжон женат имеет двоих детей. Вот уже семь лет как он занимается выращиванием лука. Выращивание лука приносит большие доходы и в то же время требует кропотливого труда. Для выращивания лука на обработку земли нужно много минеральных удобрений. Он хочет получить кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов. Он надеется на получение займа.
texts.en: Ismoiljon is married and has two children. He has been growing onions for seven years now. Onion growing gives good profit, but also requires painstaking labor. A lot of mineral fertilizer is needed for growing of onions and processing of land. He wants to take out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and pesticides. He hopes to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Smbul

texts.en: Smbul is from the village of Nahapetavan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is happily married with four sons (seventeen, eighteen, twenty-one and twenty-two years old).  She has a high school education and has been working as a farmer for the past fifteen years.  Smbul supports her relatives living in the city with produce grown on her farm.  She would like to expand her business.  Smbul would like to save some of her future profits to help pay for her eldest son’s wedding.  She is looking for a loan to purchase livestock and seeds.  Smbul projects that this investment will increase the family income by fifteen percent.  She has a positive opinion of microfinance loans and likes the high quality of the service.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia, por la buena atención D. nuestra institución se ha decidido a obtener un nuevo crédito, y porque quiere mantener su negocio estable debido que tiene una granja D. cerdos, actualmente comprara más cerdos pequeños, para crecerlos, el propósito D. ella es venderlos al mercado a buen precio.
Los financiamientos anteriores le ayudaron a aumentar el nivel D. ventas esto le permitió cambiar las condiciones D. vida D. ella y su familia.
texts.en: Because of the good service she’s gotten from our institution, Claudia has decided to get a new loan because she wants to maintain her business stable.  She has a pig farm and wants to buy more piglets to raise so that she can sell them for a good price at market.  Previous loans helped her increase sales which allowed her to change her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa  is a fishmonger at Kwahinkrom. She has done this for five years. She is married to an electrician and has five  dependents. She uses her income to help her husband in providing for their family.  Adjoa will use her loan to purchase bulk fish. Adjoa plan to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: purchase bulk fish.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine  is a petty trader at Besease near Elmina. She is married to a teacher and has four children. She has been in this business for the past six years now. 

Justine uses her income to assist her husband to pay utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bulk rice and food items for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk rice and food items for sale.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev, 36, is a humble villager who has been residing in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She works in farming alongside her husband, who has the same career. This couple is blessed with 3 single children, all of whom are attending school and living under their income. 

Now is the time for Khiev to start to harvest and collect her rice from the rice field, however, presently her threshing machine doesn’t work well because it was broken from last time.  She is seeking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy some spare parts to repair her broken machine. She hopes that she will be able to achieve her goal of having a big farm and to increase her rice production.

loans.use: repair her rice threshing machine

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 61 años edad y es tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urcos pero actualmente vive en la ciudad Gamitana, ella se dedica a la agricultura y cultiva diferentes productos como yuca, maíz, arroz y otras cosas, ella tambien se dedica  a la compra y venta de madera.  Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Isabel en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para invertir en las chacras por lo tanto va comprar semillas y abonos. 

Isabel es integrante del grupo “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” lo conforman 16 socios que viven en el Comunidad de Gamitana en la selva del Perú.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 61, is in a common-law-marriage and has five children.  She was born in the city of Urcos, but she currently lives in the city of Gamitana.

She devotes herself to agriculture and growing different products like yucca, corn, rice, and others.  She also buys and sells wood.  She has been in the business for several years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

At this time Isabel needs a loan to invest in her farm.  She will buy seeds and fertilizers.

Isabel is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” (Gamitana’s New Dawn) communal bank.  It is comprised of 16 members who live in the Gamitana community in the Peruvian jungle.

loans.use: to invest in her farm by purchasing seeds and fertilizers.

location.town: Gamitana - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 42 years old and single with two children aged 12 and 16. She runs a retail shop to earn a living,and she has been in the business for three years. She describes her business environment as busy because she is visited regularly by her customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy loaves of bread, sodas and sugar.

loans.use: To buy loaves of bread, sodas and sugar.

loans.name: Djantoyerela 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Djantoyerela 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kouroubadougou, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec DJENEBA, debout avec une écharpe blanche au cou, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 155.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Djantoyerela 1" are married women averaging 38 years of age and five children each all living in traditional families in Kouroubadougou, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with DJENEBA, standing in the photo and wearing a white scarf around her neck. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing to make use of 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and at the San market to a customer base composed of men and women.

She plans on making an average profit of  155,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm in puts, seeds, and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nelly wants to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is mainly into the sale of corn. She buys in bags and sells in tins called "Olonka" to her customers. Due to the moderate price per tin, her sales are good, but she is not able to buy in large quantity for re-sale. She is seeking a loan of $650.00 from Kiva to enable her to buy more bags.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Carlo

texts.en:
Carlo dedicates himself to the distribution of herbs and spices to markets and stores.

He started his business with the help of his wife and with a settlement he received from a company. In the beginning, he only did wholesale of anise and cumin from his small store, but now he also also sells essences and condiments to markets and stores, both wholesale and retail.

He will invest the loan into the wholesale purchase of spices, to be able to compete as there is a lot of competition.

He is 38 years old and has 3 children; one of them works while the others study. His wife is his business partner; his home is made of concrete and his family is stable.

He is confident that with this loan, his business will grow and the quality of life will improve for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlo se dedica a la distribución de especerías en los mercados y tiendas.

Empezó su negocio con el apoyo de su esposa y con una liquidación que recibió de una Empresa.

Al principio solo vendía anís y comino al por menor en su tiendesita, pero ahora vende este producto junto con esencias y condimentos entregándolo en mercados y tiendas al por mayor y menor.

Va invertir su crédito en la compra de especerías al por mayor para así poder competir ya que la competencia es agresiva. Tiene 38 años y 3 hijos; uno de ellos trabaja y dos estudian. La esposa es su mano derecha en el negocio, su vivienda es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar.

El tiene la confianza que con este crédito su negocio crecerá y su familia mejorara su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To invest in the wholesale purchase of his products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria Buron T. is 37 and runs a little store, the "Tienda Nueva" or "New Store". She has had the store for fifteen years and has grown it into a respectable little neighborhood resource. Maria never went to school and only speaks a little Spanish but she runs the store and also sells in the town center on market day. The family is always figuring out another way to make a few quetzals. She's in her first credit cycle with Friendship Bridge and is a member of the women's group "Puente de Amistad". The loan will be used as working capital to buy more products for the store and to sell in the Sunday market. Maria has great hopes for her five children. All of them have prospered in school and she's hoping they'll have distinguished careers involving good houses and professions, and that maybe they'll have computers. In the past four years she has had some significant back problems, and despite many visits to specialists, she's had no relief. Written by Randy Fay, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Purchase inventory for store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted prescription drugs

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Mrs. Kol S., aged 35, purchases and resells beans, earning around $2.40 per day. Her husband is a carpenter creating furniture, earning about $9.75 per day in revenue. They have four children, two who are students, one who lives in China, and one who is married and lives away from the family.

She is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase an inventory of beans in bulk to take advantage of bulk discounts, lowering costs and the increasing margins of her business.

loans.use: To purchase beans in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Llesica

texts.es:
Llesica belongs to the Teresa Ramos community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 29 years old and the mother of 3 young children. Her husband is a mechanic, but his income doesn't cover all of the family's expenses so Llesica, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100) decided to set up a poultry business. Llesica tends to her business with great care and dedication. She gets up at 5 in the morning to feed her chickens before then making breakfast for her children.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,400 (about US$468), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 50 chickens and bulk supplies (feed, vitamins, etc.) to raise them for market; shhe will invest S/.400 of the loan in the construction of a chicken coop. She will also help her husband by buying some bulk supplies--oil, brake fluid, etc.--that he will use for his business.

Llesica is very please that her chickens are growing and will soon be ready for sale at different wholesale and retail markets in the city of Pucalipa. Thanks to the business, Llesica has high hopes of making a little money so that she can help her young children get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Llesica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Teresa Ramos”, vive en el Jr. 3 de Octubre 539, del distrito de Yarina Cocha del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años y es madre de 3 hijos que son menores de edad. Está casada, su esposo es mecánico, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos de la casa, es así que Llesica, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide poner un galpón de pollos en su misma casa. La señora Llesica atiende su negocio con mucho esmero y dedicación. Se levantan a las 5.00 de la mañana para darles de comer a sus pollitos, y luego prepara el desayuno de sus pequeños hijitos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,400 (US$ 468.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 50 pollos y alimento para mejorar su crianza (1 saco de engorde, ½ saco de inicio, 1 saco de crecimiento, dos frascos de vitaminas de pollo, 5 sobres de vitaminas), también invertirá S/. 400.00 en la construcción de un galpón. Por otro lado, ayudará a su esposo a mejorar su negocio con la compra de 3 baldes de aceite, 1 galón de liquido de freno, 1 galón de hidrolina y 2 paquetes de cera.

Llesica está muy contenta porque los pollitos de su galpón están creciendo y pronto estarán listas para la venta al por mayor y al por menor en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Pucallpa y yarinacocha. Gracias a ello, Llesica tiene mayores ganas de salir adelante en su negocio, al saber que podrá tener un poco de dinero producto de su esfuerzo para apoyar en los estudios a sus menores hijos, quienes necesitan de su total apoyo.

loans.use: Buy chickens and feed for poultry business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Mrs. Charity E. is a 27 year old lady and is married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City and is a professional hairdresser. She is requesting a loan of $275 to buy more weave-on, hair cream, relaxer and attachment. She has been in business since the year 2000 and is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more weave-on & hairdressing materials

loans.name: Marach B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Shalima Nakamya. She owns a drug shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs for sale.

Shalima is 23 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man. Each week, Shalima makes approximately UGX 300000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house. Shalima has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Shalima is joined in her small group by Beatrice N., Isha W. and Ali Z.. Beatrice N. sells new clothes and wants to add to her business. Isha W. is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to expand and become a wholesaler. Ali Z. operates a business of used clothing and wants to increase her stock of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale in her drug shop.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 51 years old, is a 4th year member of the TYM. She currently lived at Hung Nguyen with her husband and 4 children. Her family's income mainly come from growing rice and cattle-breeding. Before joing TYM, they used to borrow money from her relatives and local banks. The interest is so high that they never really have much money left after each payments. After joining TYM and paying interest at a much lower rate (and in longer term) her income has been more consistent. Her family's monthly income is about 200 USD. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 525 USD to buy more cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiên, 51 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chị sống tại Hưng Nguyên cùng chồng và 4 người con. Hoạt động kinh doanh chủ yếu hiện nay của gia đình là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Nguồn vốn chăn nuôi lợn và bò được lấy từ gia đình và vay thêm ở bên ngoài. Trước khi có Quỹ Tình thương, chị Hiên thường phải vay từ những người cho vay tư nhân trong vùng. Lãi suất đi vay cao nên sau khi hoàn trả thường không có lợi nhuận. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ chị được vay vốn với mức lãi hợp lý, lại được chia nhỏ hoàn trả tuần nên kinh tế từng bước đi lên. Cho đến nay thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của gia đình đạt 200USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 525USD mua bò về nuôi

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Yor

texts.en: Mrs. Yor T., a 51-year-old widow, sells groceries and coffee in the Kor Village, Phnom Penh City. She earns around $5 per day and has two children, both of whom are married. Her son is a bricklayer, while another daughter is a fish seller. To sustain her business and expand for the future, T. now asks for a $1,000 loan to improve her grocery and coffee-selling business by increasing her stock.

loans.use: To improve her grocery and coffee selling business by increasing her stock

loans.name: Mashaka

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Mashaka Y.. She is married and has 2 children aged 1 and 6. In 2006 Mashaka established her cosmetics business. Working 6 days a week and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about US$170 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Mashaka has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and now she requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of lipsticks, makeup, and hair extensions. In the future, Mashaka plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of makeup, lipsticks, and hair pieces

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Mr. Walter J. M., his wife (Elsa Medrano) and his daughter own their own home, located in the Tacagua zone of La Paz, Bolivia. Walter works as a salaried chofer for the city public transportation authority, and his wife is a cook employed in a pensión (a moderately priced restaurant) in the city.

The family’s home contains two rooms that have yet to be finished (they have only constructed the walls, floors, and ceiling). The credit that the family needs will be used to finish these two rooms.

This is the first time that Walter has requested a loan and he qualified favorably after a socioeconomic analysis (credit check), therefore Walter qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Walter J. M., su esposa (Elsa Medrano) y su hija tienen domicilio propio, este se encuentra en la zona de Tacagua (ciudad de La Paz). Walter trabaja como chofer asalariado en el transporte publico de la ciudad y su esposa es cocinera empleada en una pensión (restaurante de precios módicos) en la ciudad. La vivienda de la familia posee dos habitaciones que aún no están concluidas (solo se construyeron los muros pisos y techo). El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de las dos habitaciones. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente, por lo que Walter puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: To finish the construction of two rooms in the family home

loans.name: Thi Thao

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thao (ID number: 050045) is 26 years old. She would like to borrow 2,006,000VND (approximately 125USD) to purchase home products such as bowls and cups to sell. Her husband is a carpenter. They like to join this Fund because they can repay on an installment basis. Their family's average daily income is about 100,000VND (approximately 6.50USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thao (MS: 050045), năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND lấy vốn bán hàng bát, chén. Chồng chị làm thợ mộc. Anh chị thích tham gia vì được trả tuần. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 100.000 VND/ngày.

loans.use: Home products retailing

loans.name: Licet

texts.en:
Licet is a 43-year-old mother of four children. She is a citizen of the city of Tingo Maria and her husband comes from Piura. They have had their business streetside in the city of Ayacucho for many years. Licet and her husband sell children's clothing retail and wholesale in the markets of Ayacucho. They sell on credit and collect on a daily basis. They sell the retail clothes in one of the streets of Ayacucho. Licet's husband also travels to various provinces for their business.

Licet is a member of the Generosidad Village Bank. She needs a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles to invest in polo shirts, pants, and sweatshirts.

Licet's dream is to have a stable business, to buy a house in the city of Lima, and that her children might become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in polo shirts, pants and sweatshirts

loans.name: Siddiqan's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqan baji is a wife of M. H. and lives in a city named Pakpattan. Pakpattan is famous for its historical and holy places. She has been living in this city for the last 30 years. She has no children. Siddiqan baji and her husband live with her brother. Her husband neither has a job nor has his own business. Her brother has a grocery shop with experience of 1 year. Siddiqan baji successfuly completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a seond loan to buy groceries for her brother's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Meena baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Siddiqan baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Waziran baji and Mairaj baji each want a loan to buy a rope machine for making cots.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to re-sell

loans.name: Abbosjon

texts.en:
H. Abbosjon is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. For the last 2 years, Abbosjon has provided taxi services using his car. Abbosjon always tries to provide high-quality services, but at the same time, keep prices attractive for his customers. Abbosjon is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable. Abbosjon lives with his parents, and he is the main breadwinner in his large family.

He is ready to work from early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. Because the price of petrol is rising day by day, he is planning to replace the fuel system with one that uses liquefied petroleum gas as fuel, because it is cheaper than petrol. For this reason he requests $650. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing a Kapron liquefied petroleum gas-cylinder for the fuel supply system in taxi

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma owns a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She has already repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania which enabled her to bring her monthly profit up to approximately $125 each month and is hoping that with this third loan request she can further increase her inventory and sales.

Mwajuma is 29 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Fatoumata Thiémokho

texts.fr: Fatoumata Thiémokho Traoré, 50 ans, veuve avec 10 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de CESIRI depuis 1 an et demi. Elle vend des légumes sur une table au marché. Fatoumata veut acheter de l’huile de palme, de la pâte d’arachide, du poisson séché, du yet et autres marchandises diverses pour renforcer son commerce.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Thiémokho Traoré is fifty years old, a widow and is raising 10 children. She has been a member of the CERISI loan group for one and a half years. She sells vegetables from a table at the marketplace. Fatoumata would like to buy palm oil, peanut butter, dried fish and various merchandise to increase her business. She is requesting this loan which would be reimbursed all in one payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, palm oil, dried peanuts and various merchandise

loans.name: Khuom

texts.en:
Khuom P., 32 years old, lives in Battambang Province. She has two children who are both attending school. She makes a living by raising pigs, as well as distilling and selling Khmer wine for $1 per litre. She is running both businesses well with a steady clientele. She is married to Lok Saloeun, 32, who is a rice farmer. To earn additional income and expand her business, P. has requested a loan to buy nine piglets to breed. The remainder of her loan will be used to make more wine. 

Mrs. P.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: To buy nine piglets

loans.name: Ageut- Namugere Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty N. (on the right) is 45 years old, married and the mother of 11 children. Betty and her group members are local brewers in Pallisa. They purchase millet from the farmers, mill the grain, and later ferment it, thereby preparing ajong (a local brew).

The loan is enabling these ladies to boost their businesses by purchasing more millet, the main ingredient for their local brew. Betty in particular dreams of opening up a pub for refined wines, spirits, and beer. Her business enables her to help her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: Purchase millet for brewing alcohol

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna Kajo is currently in the business of selling charcoal. Anna is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a director in the Ministry of Housing. She has three children and they all go to school. She is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes B. tiene 40 años, su estado civil es casada. Tiene 2 hijos. Y todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de María es la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y dio inicio por el deseo de ayudar con los gastos de su casa ya que poseía empleo y necesitaba ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos que Doña María tiene para su negocio son de establecerse en un lugar mejor para sus clientes. El préstamo es solicitado para la compra de más productos nuevos y de mejor calidad. Sus deseos son de mantener su negocio ya que por medio de su negocio ha logrado obtener lo necesario. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 10.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
María Mercedes B. is 40 years old and married, with two children. Both of her children attend school. María sells clothing for women and men, which she has done for seven years. She began selling clothes because she wanted to help out with household expenses and already had a job, but needed additional income for her family. María's plans for her business include moving to a location which is more convenient for her clients. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of additional new and higher-quality products. She would like to keep her business going, seeing it is the means by which she has managed to take care of her needs. The loan amount requested is 10,000 córdobas [about US $500], which María will pay back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama G. est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Nassinkar depuis 6 ans et demi. Son activité est la vente d’huile de palme et de crèmes glaces. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du pain de singe et du sucre  pour  renforcer son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama G. is married and has 3 children to support. She's been a member of the village bank of Nassinkar for six and a half years. Her business consists in selling palm oil and ice cream. She wants to purchase palm oil, "monkey breads" (baobab tree fruits), and sugar to bolster her business and improve the living and health standards of her family. She's applying for a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To retail palm oil and ice cream

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia P., 65, is widowed with eight children. She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and general public, three days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~120 USD).  SPBD loans are Malia’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy seeds and chemicals for her vegetable garden and plantation business.

loans.use: To purchase tools (e.g., shovel, rake), garden spray and insecticide

loans.name: Gasilda

texts.es:
La señora Gasilda  es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo- Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, ella es casada, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el  Barrio José Antonio.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ya 2 años, su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en su tienda de abarrotes en la compra de arroz, azúcar, etc.….

Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, leche, sémola, etc.  La Señora Gasilda nos indica que necesita un monto mayor para invertir en la crianza de trucha en su comunidad de Chiliyapi, negocio en el que piensa ampliar más adelante.
Su mayor deseo es hacer crecer su criadero de truchas y lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es todo su manejo y sobre todo los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gasilda is a member of Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor,” en the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province of Puno. She is 37-years old and is married with two children who have completed secondary school. She lives in the Jose Antonio borough. She has worked for the Manuela Ramos movement for the last 2-years and her first loan was for S/300.00 nuevos soles which was invested into her grocery store to purchase a stock of rise, sugar and etc… With this loan of S/1000.00 nuevos soles, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, grits and etc… Mrs. Gasilda tells us that she will need a larger loan to invest in the rearing of trout in her community of Chiliyapi and she believes her business will grow in leaps and bounds. Her desire is to have a fishery for trout and she is happy with the management of the community bank, especially for the savings she receives through it.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock items like milk, sugar, butter and grits

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora. Mercedes Sánchez, tiene 54 años, habita en el barrio campo bruce en la capital de Managua, madre soltera con tres hijos todos independientes, el mejoramiento de su vivienda y nivel de vida son los planes a corto y largo plazo. Doña Mercedes al ser una madre soltera tiene que asumir todos los gastos de la casa y los personales. Desde muy joven inicio a trabajar lavando y planchando, cuidando niños, vendiendo ambulantemente. Ahora tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de tortilla, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora. Que gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic ha obtenido la oportunidad de adquirir fondos económicos para seguir creciendo, el préstamo será invertido en capital de trabajo, los productos que comprar son: maíz, leña, frijoles, queso y cremas para vender mayores cantidades y obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mercedes Sánchez is 54 years old and lives in the Campo Bruce neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is the single mother of three children, all of whom are now independent. Mercedes' short- and long-term goals are to improve her home and improve her quality of life. Since Mercedes is a single mother, she is responsible for all personal and household spending. When she was quite young she started washing and ironing clothes, caring for children, and selling on the street. She now has her own small tortilla-selling business and is a very enterprising, hard-working woman. Thanks to Afodenic loans, she has been able to acquire funds to continue expanding her business. She will use this loan as working capital, and will buy corn, firewood, beans, cheese and cream so that she can produce and sell more tortillas and thus earn more in profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, beans, firewood, cheese, cream

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion B. is a responsible mother to her four children. She is married to Virgilio and is living in Barangay Murong Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old and her husband is 60 years old. The main occupation in the village is farming. Due to our economic crisis, all of their children were not able to pursue their studies in college, however, they are working hard to earn their daily living.

Visitacion continuously cultivates their farm and manages their small general store at home. She hopes to maintain her business by having enough capital to use in the improvement of her businesses, especially her store that is a great help in providing for their daily needs. Visitacion is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional working capital for the improvement of her store.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer Y. is married and has 4 dependants.  He has received schooling through Senior High School. Ebenezer makes and sells fishing boats at Abotoase, near Hohoe.  He has been in this business for quite some time now. His wife is a trader. Ebenezer uses his income to pay school fees for his children. Ebenezer will use the loan to purchase more wood and other materials for making the fishing boats for resale, to expand his business and gain much profit, to enable him to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ebenezer plans to reinvest and expand his business for more profit.

loans.use: Ebenezer will use the loan to purchase more wood and other materials for making the fishing boats.

loans.name: Akporuma

texts.en: G. is 38 and is married with 6 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions and is very happy with the improvement of her business.  She requests a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Fredisminda

texts.en:
Fredisminda J. is a 47-year-old mother of three children. She helps her husband, Emelito J., till their 5-hectare farm aside from the sari-sari store business that they have to be able to support the growing needs of their family. 

However, she still needs additional capital to manage their business well. She would like to ask for a loan worth Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and chemicals as well as merchandise for her sari-sari store. 

Multi-business. This is what Fredisminda is doing. She learned it from her friends who are also availing CEVI credit services. CEVI provides her loans and education to help her manage and grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Lesther Vidal

texts.es: El joven Lesther Vidal 23 años de edad, soltero, habita en Villa del Carmen del departamento Managua, tiene un hijo de dos años, sus metas es mejorar el nivel de vida para beneficio de su familia, trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen, anteriormente trabajaba en una panadería, ha encontrado como dificulta que el salario no alcanza para realiza mejoras en su vivienda. Con el préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques, piso y otros. Ya que la infraestructura de su casa esta desgastadas y requiere de retoques, que le ofrecerá protección y seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Lesther Vidal is 23 years old,single, and lives in Villa del Carmen, located in the department of Managua. He has a 2 year old son. His goal is to improve his quality of life to benefit his family. He now works in the Villa del Carmen mayor’s office. Before, he worked in a bakery. He has found it difficult because his salary is not sufficient to make improvements for his house. With the Afodenic loan, he will purchase construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, flooring, and others. The infrastructure in his house is worn out and requires retouching, which will offer protection and security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make home improvements

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a member of the Dodoma Road borrower group in kihesa,Iringa,she is 40 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 26,12, and 8 years.

Angelina started her own business selling bites,banana 9 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 850,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Angelina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more wheat,cooking oil for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Angelina hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat,cooking oil,banana

loans.name: Patrice

texts.fr: M. Patrice est né en 1980 dans la commune d’Akpro Missérété et y vit. Patrice n’a pas encore d’enfant. Patrice  est coiffeur de formation. Pour équiper son salon de matériels nécessaire pour la coiffure, Patrice  a besoin de moyens financiers. Alors pour satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle, Patrice  sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Patrice M. was born in 1980 in the village of Akpro Misserete, where he is still a resident. Patrice has no children yet. Patrice is a hair stylist by training. In order to supply his salon with the necessary tools, Patrice is in need of financial support. Patrice requests the financial support of Alide (Kiva Field Partner) so that he will be able to meet the demands of his clientele.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a clipper and a chair with casters.

loans.name: María Armandina

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 43 años que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodega – tienda en su casa desde hace ocho años en la que ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, aceite, azúcar), verduras y bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas); este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos económicos estable que posee su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero en las minas del sur del país.

Hace algunos meses, gracias al esfuerzo compartido con su esposo y al apoyo de Edpyme Alternativa, pudo terminar de construir su casa, pero esta actividad hizo que dejara de atender su establecimiento mientras duraba la construcción, por lo que ahora su negocio se encuentra desabastecido, por este motivo ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que planea reabastecer su negocio.

Los productos que más vende son las bebidas, pero ella, pensando en el futuro de sus hijos que aún estudian, planea ampliar su negocio con la venta y promoción de abarrotes. María sueña con ampliar su negocio para atenderlo junto a su esposo y que este deje de hacer viajes al sur del país por largas temporadas así como para brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior.

Este es el tercer préstamo que está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa y durante el tiempo que ha venido trabajando con nosotros María ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 43 year old mother who lives with her husband and their four children in the sector Cesar Vallejo, located in the city of Chiclayo. For eight years she has had a small grocery store in her house in which she offers her clients essential products (rice, oil, sugar), vegetables, and drinks (soft drinks and beer). This business is the only stable source of economic income that her family possesses, since her husband works occasionally as a miner in the southern part of the country. A few months ago, thanks to the shared effort of her husband and the support of Edpyme Alternativa, she was able to finish building her house. However, the construction forced her to stop attending to her business, and consequently her business now finds itself unstocked. For this reason she is requesting a credit of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, with which she plans to restock her business. The product of which she sells the most are drinks. However, thinking of the future of her children who are still studying, she plans to expand her business with the sale and promotion of groceries. Maria dreams of expanding her business to attend to it alongside her husband, so that he can stop making trips to the south of the country for long periods of time, and also in order to provide her children the opportunity to study a better career path. This is the third loan that she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa, and during the time she has been working with us, Maria has demonstrated herself to be a punctual and responsible client when it comes time to make her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of essential items and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Hands Of Friendship Group

texts.en:
Hands of Friendship is a group of 5 borrowers led by Massa H., who is 34 years old, married, and has two children ages 9 and 14, their educational levels 4th and 8th grade. She is a high school graduate but could not attend university due to lack of financial support. Massa and her family live in the Geebadu Quarter, a large Mandingo (a local tribe in Liberia) community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa County in northern Liberia.

Massa’s business is selling used clothing. She buys used clothes wholesale and sells retail in the Voinjama main market, in the capital of Lofa County in northern Liberia. She has been running this business for 5 years and hopes to expand to a bigger shop.

Massa has been facing some financial constraints over the years with her business; therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more wholesale used clothing to improve her business. She talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. The business is her only means of income. She dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase more wholesale used clothing to improve business

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia is a very religious person who always puts God first in whatever she does. She is 26 years old and resides in the village of Caritan, Tuguegarao City, together with her husband and four children: Novie, 27; Noel, 25; Nardo, 23; and Norma, 21.

As a mother, Gaudencia is hoping to provide the best future for her children. For that reason, she is striving hard to maintain her business and hopes that someday she will be able to extend it to become a more stable business.

Gaudencia has been engaged in a chicken-raising business behind their backyard for two years now. She needs additional capital to purchase more native chickens to raise, and for their supply of feeds and medicines.

For her second loan, she is requesting PHP 5,000 for the maintenance and growth of her poultry raising business. She is hoping that her loan will be approved because it will contribute a lot to the progress of her business as well as to their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise, plus feeds and medicines for her poultry

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mr. Phon P. lives in Krang Roungu village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Aside from this farming activity, he is also an ice-cream seller.

Mr. Phon P. is a widower with three children: one is working in a garment factory, another is working in Thailand, and the youngest one is attending the local school.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Phon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a calf to raise and he hopes to improve their living conditions after he sells the grown animal.

loans.use: To buy a calf to raise

loans.name: Vera Alicia

texts.es: Vera Alicia H. D. E. D. 30 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, todos menores D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. tortillas y pupusas en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, sobre todo con los gastos D. los estudios D. sus pequeños hijos. Vera solícita un préstamo a través del cual podrá comprar maíz, frijoles y arroz, producto con el cual pueD. realizar las pupusas y las tortillas, comida la cual se venD. mucho en El Salvador debido a que forma parte D. la dieta salvadoreña, sobre todo en el caso D. las tortillas la cuales se consumen diariamente.
texts.en:
Vera Alicia is 30 years old, resides in Ahuachapán Department, and lives with her husband and their 3 children who are minors. She sells tortillas, both regular and stuffed, from her house. The business enables her to help her husband with household expenses, especially with the costs of educating their small children. >p> Vera is soliciting a loan to buy corn, beans and rice, products that are necessary to make regular and stuffed tortillas. Such items sell well in El Salvador since they are important in the Salvadoran diet. This is especially true of tortillas, which are consumed daily.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CORN, BEANS, AND RICE TO MAKE REGULAR AND STUFFED TORTILLAS TO SELL

loans.name: Masiaday Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Masiaday' group. Members of the 'Masiaday' group are small-scale businesswomen in the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown. They have come to SMT, a partner of 'Shine on Sierra Leone' in Waterloo to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each to boost their businesses.

The leader of this group is Yeabu K. in the middle. Yeabu was born in a place call Nabina in Gambia, northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately fifty-three years old, a widow with four children. One of her children is in university; two are in secondary school, and one in primary school. 

Yeabu sells cooked rice and 'foofoo' (food made out of ground cassava). She has been a businesswoman for unknown number of years now. With this loan, she will buy ten gallons of palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), five gallons of other oil, three bags of rice, one bag of onions and an unknown number of fish and other cooking ingredients.

loans.use: Buy ten gallons of palm-oil, five gallons of other oil, three bags of rice, etc.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
La señora Sarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años  y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa, a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Sarita, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sarita is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martin. She is 43 years old, has 2 dependent children, and lives with her partner.

Her character and her desire to achieve her dreams motivated her to begin a business selling groceries from her own home. The income from her business helps support her household. Since she began her business she has steadily gained customers, and today she counts on many regulars who come to her shop daily to purchase merchandise, as she carries all the products that homemakers need and she is known for her charming service.

She will use this loan for 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase bags of rice and sugar, crackers, pasta, salt, milk, cases of canned fish, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue providing excellent customer service.

Sarita feels very good for being able to continue her business. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing women like her with opportunities for development in their chosen fields.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her stock

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en: 40-year-old Adelfa farms for a living. She is married and has five children. Her oldest is now 18 years old and goes to school. She works hard so she can send her children to school and provide for her family’s needs. She said that her one-hectare farm is really helpful to her family, which is why she makes sure it is productive. She also sought the help of CEVI, an MFI [micro-finance institution] in the Philippines. She became a member and is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use this loan to fund her farm. She will be able to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Mazakhir

texts.en: Mazakhir K. is a 50 year old man who sells construction materials. He is married and has 2 sons. Mazakhir started his business more that 20 years ago. Since that time his business has been the only source of income for his family. His sons help him and Mazakhir teaches them how to prepare materials for sale to their customers. Most of materials he sells are made of wood but, he also sells bricks. Now he has applied for 1600 AZN in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business via purchasing more materials.

loans.name: Tol

texts.en: Mrs. Tol L., 50, has been selling little fritters from home for an income. She is a married mother blessed with six children. Four of her children are single and two are married, living in their own homes. Another source of family income comes from her husband who sells rattan furniture. He buys furniture in bulk on credit from a handicraft maker and then uses his trailer to sell the furniture door-to-door around the community. Also, Mrs. Tol L. goes to sell rattan with her husband. In the past, Tol L. hired a neighbor's trailer to deliver her rattan to sell. Now, she hopes to reduce this fee, so she has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase a trailer to connect to her horse. She will use this method of transport to pick up her products. (Tol L.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase a trailer.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She is married to B., a welder, and they are blessed with five children, the eldest of whom is 16 and the youngest of whom is 6. All her children are excelling in their school work.
Angela sells mouthwatering Nigerian cooked foods such as rice, beans, egusi soup (melon soup) and drinks. Her customers love her cooked foods and Angela loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.
Angela hopes to expand her business to attract more sales and increase profits. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. In the future, she hopes to have a classic restaurant. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta  A. D. Z. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, el señor Daniel Ramírez quien trabaja como comerciante, y así mismo junto a su hijo D. 16 años D. edad el cual estudia educación básica.  Marta posee un comedor el cual esta ubicado en su propia casa, en donD. se encarga D. elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo venD. diferentes tipos D. bebidas. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar maíz, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, verduras y bebidas por mayor, D. manera que pueda surtir su negocio con todo lo básico y más necesario para mejorar sus ventas. Así mismo ella posee el deseo D. poder comprar un puesto en el mercado D. Santa Tecla, esto ya que en dicho puesto ella cuenta con la seguridad D. poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que hay muchas más personas tanto como clientes del lugar como personas que trabajan ahí. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder crecer más en su negocio y D. esta misma forma poder mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia. Marta demuestra ser una mujer con muchas metas, la cual esta dispuesta a alcanzar sobre todo por el bienestar D. su hijo.
texts.en:
Marta A. D. Z., 42, lives in Santa Tecla, located in La Libertad department. She lives together with her husband Daniel Ramírez, who is a storekeeper, and their son, 16, who is studying. Marta has a restaurant located in her home, where she makes breakfasts and lunches and sells different types of drinks. She is seeking a loan to purchase maize, rice, beans, sugar, vegetables and drinks in larger quantity, to stock her business with all the basic and necessary items to improve her sales. Marta also wants to purchase a stand in the Santa Tecla market, where she will be able to improve her sales, as there are many more potential customers who work around there. Marta does it all this with the desire of growing her business in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family. Marta has demonstrated to be a woman with many goals, most of which are for the well-being of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, drinks and vegetables

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
María Jesús tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Quemazón, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 12 años a la comercialización de animales: ella compra, cría y vende todo tipo de animales, aunque prefiere las aves de corral y carneros, los animales los comercializa con los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Este negocio es una fuente de importante ingreso económico para su familia ya que su esposo trabaja como agricultor y esta actividad no le brinda los recursos suficientes para el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de aves de corral y carneros para comercializarlos, así como en su respectivo alimento balanceado, ya que ella desea ampliar su negocio debido a la gran demanda que se ha presentado en la zona donde vive.

Ella es una mujer entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por el progreso y bienestar de los suyos, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos la oprtunidad de estudiar alguna carrera técnica que les garantice un futuro prometedor. María Jesus ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución Anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Jesús, 37, is married and has two children; she lives with her family in Quemazón, a rural district of Mórrope, Lambayeque province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For over 12 years she has been a small farm animal merchant. She buys raises and then resells all kinds of animals, although she prefers barnyard fowl and sheep; she sells to merchants that visit her area on a regular basis. This business is an important source of family income because her husband’s income from farming is insufficient to support the family. María is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy barnyard fowl and sheep to sell as well as nutritionally balanced animal feed because she aims to expand her business because demand is high where she lives. She is a woman who is totally dedicated to her family’s wellbeing; her greatest wish is to provide her children with the opportunity to study a technical career that will guarantee them a promising future. María Jesus has collaborated with our institution previously and has always been punctual and responsible with her installment payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas forma parte del banco comunal “Sayhua”, tiene 27 años y es soltero. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender accesorios personales como por ejemplo relojes, billeteras, etc. Ya es uno a dos años que trabajan en el negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en el trabajo. Leonidas es un joven responsable y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su papa que está enfermo, él requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio desea comprar más accesorios de personales como por ejemplo relojes, calculadoras, etc. El sueño del socio es tener su propia tienda de venta de accesorios.    

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Leonidas is part of the community bank "Sayhua." He is 27 years old and single. His main economic activity is selling personal accessories, like watches, wallets, etc. He has spent between one and two years working in this business, and he is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Leonidas is a responsible hard-working young man, who constantly looks for opportunities to get ahead in life and to help his sick father. Leonidas needs a loan to increase his working capital. He wants to buy more personal accessories like watches, calculators, etc. His dream is to have his own accessories store. Leonidas is very grateful for the opportunity offered through Kiva, and he promises to complete his loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying personal accessories to sell

loans.name: Dionisio Gabriel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “MILAGROSA VIRGEN DEL CARMEN II”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. DIONISIO,   tiene 70 años de edad es casado y todos sus hijos ya son independientes y viven con sus propias familias, el socio vive con sus esposa y es muy alegre, juntos tienen un restaurante en su casa muy conocido en la ciudad del Cusco ellos vende como plato típicos, Nuestro socio trabaja con el banco comunal desde hace 8 años  y 25 años en el negocio del restaurante campestre; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio, el socio desea mejorar la fachada del local y dentro del mismo.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dionisio is a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” communal bank and lives in Cusco. He is married, 70 years old, and lives with his wife, as all of his children are grown and live with their own families. Dionisio is a very happy man and he and his wife sell local food from a restaurant in their very well-known home. He has has had his restaurant for 25 years and has been working with his communal bank for the last eight. He will use this loan to make improvements to the interior and the exterior of the restaurant. Dionisio greatly values and is grateful for the support he has received in the past, and he is committed to repay this loan in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to the interior and exterior of his business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites T. is from the village of Salay , Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Marites is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felicitas Susana

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 64 años y tiene 1 hija que estudia en la universidad, Felicitas viaja a las ferias D. la región 3 veces por semana en donD. venD. ropa variada y D. las ferias compra quesos que venden en las diferentes tiendas, la ropa lo compra D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades D. la ciudad D. Lima.
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Diamantes y necesita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra D. ropa típica, como mandiles y fustanes.
Felicitas sueña con tener una tienda D. ropa e implementar un Internet.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 64 years old and has 1 daughter who studies at the university. Felicitas travels to the outdoor markets of the region 3 times each week where she sells various types of clothing and buys cheeses that she resells to the different stores. She buys the clothes in the city of Ayacucho and in some cases in the city of Lima. Felicitas is an associate of the Diamonds Communal Bank. She needs a loan that will be invested in the purchase of traditional clothing, like aprons and petticoats. Felicitas dreams of having a clothing store and an Internet site.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy traditional clothing, such as aprons and petticoats.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Memunatu is a 50-year-old businesswoman. She is married to an Arabic teacher, who is also actively participating in the business, and she has one child. She sells foodstuffs at the central main market in Makeni. Memunatu began her business when one of her relatives offered her business capital of 300,000 leones. She started her business on a small scale at her residence. As the business grew, she moved to the central main market where she sells now. Memunatu has been in this business for more than ten years. She understands the environment around her business very well, her business skills are good, and she has been making process in this business.

Memunatu has been receiving loans from ARD for quite some time now. She has a very good credit rating and is determined to continue repaying her loans on time. 

Memunatu needs a loan to pay rent for her store and to buy more stock. She plans to use the proceeds from this loan to educate her child to university and support her pilgrimage to Mecca.

loans.use: To buy additional food stock and pay the rent for her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn E. is from the village of Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 55 years old, a widow, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she buys and sells bananas and coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $63 a month for these activities. She chose to lower her loan from 11,000 PHP to 5,000 PHP because she finds it easier to pay back.

In 2008, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia C. is a widow with five children between the ages of 27-36 years old. Four of her children have their own families while her fifth child helps her mother with her business. Lydia lives in Purok Ipil-Ipil, a part of Barangay Bulanon in Sagay City, Negros Occidental province on the Visayas islands. She earns a living through her fishing operation.

Lydia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for a better life for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lydia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 18th loan cycle she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to purchase fishing materials so that she can continue to save up for the business and her family. Lydia C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Miriam Gladys

texts.es:
Miriam de 40 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), ella tiene un taller de costura y confección. 

Empezó trabajando en un taller de confecciones , cuando aprendió decidió independizarse y ganar su propio dinero, poco a poco con esfuerzo, compro una maquina de coser y telas, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener una mayor producción de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo tela y hilos. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de confección completo y así darle trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 40 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered. She has a sewing and tailoring workshop.

She began working at a sewing factory. Upon learning the necessary skills, she decided to become independent and earn her own money. With a little bit of effort, Miriam bought a sewing machine and fabric. Now she works every day from 8am to 4pm.
