The members of the group “Las Abejitas” (The Little Bees) are represented by Mrs. Nely and consist of 13 member which are dedicated to various business activities such as seamstress, hair care service, groceries in a neighborhood store, public transport of passengers and sale of items such as vegetables, meats, detergents, food, Api, beverages and various cleaning products. The competition in their areas is high, but in spite of that they know how to grow their businesses. This loan is for the growth of their businesses with the purchase of merchandise, supplies and tools to improve their incomes and give their families a better quality of life. As far as their credit worthiness, the associates are in the process of their first cycle with the institution, they are happy to get financial support that will help them generate more income and make them able to proviD. a better life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeanette de los Ángeles C. García tiene la edad de 39 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos el pan de cada día, a pesar de la edad y las enfermedades ella es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable, por lo que decide salir a las calles a ofrecer productos como ropa interior y perfumes, Jeanette no posee niveles académicos por lo que se ve obligada a buscar de cualquier forma el trabajo y se gana la vida de una forma humilde pero honrada. Y es por ese motivo que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa interior y cosméticos. El sueño de ella es que sus hijos tengan la posibilidad de estudiar que ella no tuvo.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a widow with three children aged 14, 7, and 4 years. Apart from her children Zainab has one dependent.

Zainab rents a store at a strategic location in the eastern part of Freetown where ships berth. She sells rice and pillet (pig feed) and has built up her business for about eight years.

As Zainab is the one fending for the family, she is hoping to use the loan to buy more rice and pillet. She intends to use part of the proceeds to run the home and to rent a much bigger shop space.

loans.use: To buy more rice and pillet

loans.name: Neba

texts.en:
J. is married with four children. He lives in Ntabesi-Nkwen, Cameroon. J. and his entire family are living in a house with four rooms. J. has had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill health, facing difficulties to pay his children's school fees and the death of his mother. He does carpentry work as his main profession and he wants to include a grocery store in his business.   

This will be J.'s fifth time to receive a loan from GHAPE. He has been a member since 2003. He has been quite successful in the past with his business due to the location of his workshop and his reasonable prices.  Also with experience, he is now seeing good profits from his business. Part of his profits from this loan will be used to take care of his children, buy necessities for the family and give them good medication whenever they are sick; he will invest the rest of the profits into his business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase items for carpentry and a grocery store

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.en:
Vitoria R. lives in  the village of San Isidro, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She makes a living as the owner and operator of a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells food and products people use daily. Vitoria has been in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Vitoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Mrs. Nan T. is 36 years old, and sells fish and some vegetables to earn a living. Nan T. is married and is blessed with two young children, who are dependent on her income. Her husband is pictured here, who helps her in selling her items. In the past, Nan T. always hired a taxi at a high price for transporting her items to the market. She now wants to own a vehicle to use as transportation and is asking for a Kiva loan to purchase a used motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Enogiomwan

texts.en: Enogiomwan is 45 years old and a mother of four children. She is popularly called Madam Enogie. Her husband is a civil servant. She sells groceries at retail prices. Her customers are mostly neighbors, friends, and local residents. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Madam Enogie is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She started this business eight years ago. She needs a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa Lidia M. P. de 37 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Soyapango. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una venta de jugos y licuados, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 20 años. Este negocio le ha permitido poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar como los estudios de sus hijos y el alimento. Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más frutas y leche para la elaboración del los jugos y licuados, así mismo desea poder comprar dos licuadoras nuevas, debido a que las que posee ya están bastante usadas. Rosa espera poder mejorar las ganancias de su negocio, ya que dentro de sus planes de inicio de año es superarse en su trabajo y así mismo brindarles una mejor vida  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa Lidia M. P., 37 years old, lives in the municipality of Soyapango. Her family is composed of her husband and two sons, ages 9 and 7, that are studying. She has been selling juices and smoothies from her home for the last 20 years. This business has allowed her to be able to offer her husband the help he needed with the household expenses such as the children's education and food.

Rosa asks for a loan with which she can purchase more fruits and milk for the juices and smoothies, as well as purchasing two new blenders, because the ones she owns are quite well worn already. Rosa hopes to increase the business' profit, since one of her new year's resolutions is to excel herself in her job and to offer her children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and two blenders

loans.name: Mrs. Kao Meng Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, of which Mrs. Kao Meng T. is the leader, consists of 13 people and is located in Chamrov village, Takeo province. Mrs. Kao Meng T. is a 24-year-old married woman and mother of a young child.

Mrs. Kao Meng T. and her husband, Mr. Oeun S., are silk weavers. Because her business has been doing quite well, she would like to expand the business. Thus, Mrs. Kao Meng T. decided to seek a loan to buy more silks to support the business. In addition to her silk-weaving operations, Mrs. Kao Meng T. is a farmer. Specifically, she owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional silks

loans.name: Carmelitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Carmelitas, inicia su segundo ciclo con 16 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. emoliente, comidas, mercería, verduras, abarrotes en general, ropa, golosinas, bebidas, leña y transporte.

Como es el caso D. la señora Elsa es viuda, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Elsa venD. emoliente, bebida caliente con propiedades curativas, actividad que realiza todos los días en el mercado 12 D. abril. Elsa necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar y hierbas.

Mientras que Olga es casada, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Olga venD. comida en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, Olga necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,100 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, hierbas, ropa, galletas, gaseosas, verduras.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Carmelitas,” is beginning its second cycle with 16 members. The members all have different businesses like: selling drinks (special Peruvian drinks), food, haberdashery, vegetables, groceries, clothing, sweets, drinks, firewood, and transportation services. In Mrs. Elsa’s case, she is a widow, 40 years old, and has three children. Elsa sells drinks and hot drinks with healing properties. She works in the April 12 market every day. Elsa needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of sugar and herbs. Meanwhile, Olga is married, 34 years old, and has a son. Olga sells food from her home everyday. Olga needs a loan of 900 soles which she will invest in buying rice and sugar. The members each need different loan amounts like: 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles making a total of 10,100 soles of loans for the communal bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, herbs, clothing, cookies, sodas, and vegetables. The members dream of having their own homes, growing their businesses, and for their children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, herbs, clothing, cookies, sodas, and vegetables.

loans.name: Marcelina Undag's Group

texts.en:
Marcelina U. is from the village of Toril. She is 71 years old and the leader of a two member group loan offered by PMPC.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marcelina is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a hog raising and selling business. Marcelina has been in business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Marcelina joined PMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC.  Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and supplies.  This loan will be the 10th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. 
----------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and supplies.

loans.name: Obiagele

texts.en:
Obiagele is married to a businessman and they are blessed with a two-year-old child. Obiagele sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs from her store in Delta State. She has been in this business for a long time. She is making positive progress in her business and this gives her joy.
Obiagele is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She is a good client of Kiva partner, LAPO, and she thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a 24-year-old married woman and is a resident in the west of the capital, Phnom Penh. To earn a living, she works sewing clothes in a garment factory and earns a salary of $80 a month. Mrs. K. has a life partner in her husband who appears in the photo. He owns a workshop where he provides a haircutting service for a profit. The couple has a young child.

Mrs. K. finds it hard commuting to work or to anywhere else because she has no vehicle. She is therefore asking for a loan of $600 to add to her personal savings in order to buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Yamina De La Nube

texts.es:
Yamina P. es socia del banco Comunal Ensueños  ubicado  en la comunidad de la Policía en la ciudad de Azogues,  tiene clima frío y  se caracteriza por sus iglesias y por la belleza que esta ciudad encierra, su centro histórico se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es muy amable y luchadora, como nuestra socias quienes luchan cada día para mejorar sus situaciones familiares.

Yamina  tiene 43 años, se encuentra divorciada hace 13 para ayudar su esposo que obtenga los documentos legales en otro país, con él concibió  una hija que ya tiene  25 años y es abogada  de profesión, ella junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos viven casa de su madre con quien comparten no sólo el techo sino también los gastos del hogar.

Nuestra socia vende ropa y cosméticos por catálogo desde hace tres años y también se da tiempo para cuidar de sus dos nietos y dedicarse a los quehaceres del hogar, nos comenta que cuenta con su clientes fijos y que se inició en ésta actividad gracias a los créditos obtenidos hace tres ciclos en la fundación Espoir por motivación de sus amigas socias del banco comunal, con su nuevo préstamo va adquirir pantalones, camisas, blusas, sacos, interiores,  perfumes, cremas, sombras, rímel y más productos Yanbal para ofrecer  a sus clientes un surtido stock de ropa y cosméticos. 

Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y adquirir nuevas líneas de productos.
texts.en:
Yamina P. is a member of the village bank Comunal Esueños ("Shared Dreams") located in the community of Policía in the city of Azogues, which has a cold climate and is known for its churches and the beauty the city holds. Its historical center is a mix of colonial and modern, its people are both agreeable yet fighters, such as our members who fight every day to better the lives of their families.

Yamina is 43 years old and has been divorced for 13 years to help her husband obtain legal documents in another country. With him she has a daughter who is 25 years old, a lawyer, and who with her husband and two children lives in her mothers house, sharing not only the roof but the household expenses.

Yamina has been selling clothes and makeup by catalog for the past three years and also spends time taking care of her two grandchildren and doing housework. She told us that she has her regular customers and she was able to start this job thanks to loans obtained in three cycles with Espoir foundation with the encouragement of her friends within the village bank. With this new loan she would like to buy pants, shirts, blouses, bags, underwear, perfume, lotions, shades, mascara, and other products to offer her clients a better range of clothes and makeup.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying clothing and makeup for her business

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger Q. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 34 years old. Roger is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Roger owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Roger has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 14,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Roger joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Roger is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Roger from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Deona Ann's Group

texts.en:
Deona Ann M. is from the village of Brgy.Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 31 years old. Deona Ann is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Deona Ann is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Deona Ann owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Deona Ann has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Deona Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Deona Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Deona Ann is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Deona Ann from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a 39-year-old married woman who runs a shop called "Mama Elena" on Jogoo Road in the Mukuru Kwa Njenga slums. In her shop, she sells sugar, soap, rice, maize flour, cereals, and cosmetics. She was formerly operating a salon. She has been earning income from her shop for the past eight years. Linet, who is the mother of four school-going children, strives to provide for the basic needs for her family and to educate her children. She also uses part of her profits, both from her shop and her van, which she uses for commercial transport, to pay her employee and save some money in a borrowing group under Faulu Kenya. She dreams of expanding her shop into a supermarket in the future. For this reason, she plans to add stock so that she can expand the business. She has requested a loan of KES 70,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy sugar, soap, rice, maize flour, cereals, and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, rice, maize flour, cereals, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sergio Manuel

texts.es:
El Sra. SERGIO MANUEL H. A. es trabajador del mercado Roberto Huembés, el se encarga de  Cobrar a todos los Comerciante del Mercado Roberto Huembés su ruta de cobro es diaria ya que pagan el piso que le brinda en el mercado. Es padre de familia, casado con un hijo este se encuentra en edad escolar.
El va utilizar la plata en compra de medicamento para su familiar que tiene enfermo a un familiar y la inversión  es para ese destino
El  Sr. Sergio dijo que gracias a los  prestamos otorgados me han ayudado mucho ya que e podido mejorar mi casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sergio works in the Roberto Huembés and is in charge of collecting fees from those selling in the market. He does this job daily. He is married and has one school aged son. He will use the money from this loan to buy medicine for a sick family member. He tells us that he is grateful for these loans, as they have helped him improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El señor Pedro José, cuenta con un negocio de una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende granos básicos, refrescos, cosméticos y otros productos. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios y con este financiamiento surtirá con más productos su negocio, para poder aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ganancias. Es señor es casado y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos en edad escolar, la pulpería es atendida por su esposa y él se dedica a realizar trabajos propios como en la albañilería, obteniendo otros ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Jose operates a general store from his house. He sells everyday foodstuffs, cold drinks, cosmetics and other products. He started the business with his own funds and he will use this loan to stock more products for the store, products that will allow him to increase his sales and generate a larger income. Sr. Pedro Jose is married and has two children, one of whom is school-aged. His wife tends the store and he works at other jobs, such as construction, to cover the family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan Y., 54, is widowed and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. She is a farmer and grows rice for an income of USD 1.50 per day. Two of her children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 2 each per day to help cover the family's expenses. Sun is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase two cows to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy two cows to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda R. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Brenda is married and has 2 school-aged children. Brenda owns & operates a retail business, selling kitchen supplies & products. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Brenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Brenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jefferson Orlando

texts.en:
Jefferson Orlando A. S. is 18 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. 

Jefferson is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Jefferson also works in agriculture. He does the buying and selling of his products weekly in the nearby town of Matilde Esther. 

Jefferson plans to use the loan to grow cacao. His dream is to build a house over the next few years. 

In his free time, he likes to play sports and he enjoys the annual festivals that his town sponsors.

loans.use: To grow cacao

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech T., who was born in 1962, is a farmer who owns a 1.5 hectare plot of land. She cultivates and sells rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chor Sem, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, but she does not have enough money to improve rice production. Mrs. Pech T. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will hire farming laborers to grow the rice. She is the mother of four children: one is employed in a private company, while the others are studying in school.

Four members make up this group loan and they are villagers from Prey Slaeng village in Takeo province. Mrs. Pech T. is the group leader whom they have all selected. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Amarjargal S. is 34-year-old married woman with one daughter. She has been living with her husband and daughter in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia for 11 years. She and her family live in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband works as a driver in the Umnugobi province while the daughter attends a local secondary school. 

Amarjargal operates a hair salon in her town with several business partners. They share the rent of a rented room to operate their salon. Oyuntsetseg started to work as a hairdresser in 2002 after graduating vocational training as a hairdresser in 2000. Since then, her business has grown steadily over the years and is a popular salon in the area. She was able to expand her business by purchasing a new chair and mirror for her salon in 2005. Over the years, all her equipment and tools have deteriorated due to long usage; therefore, she needs more funds to renew those items. She is a very accurate and optimistic person and is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase necessary tools and equipment for her salon.

loans.use: To purchase necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Young Generation Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Young Generation” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Mamusu B. is the leader of this group. Mamusu is thirty-six years old, married with two children who are attending primary school. Mamusu sells shoes, socks, and vests. With the help of this loan, Mamusu will invest in her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy shoes, socks, vests, etc. wholesale for resale

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Mrs. Suos S. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has four school-aged children. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year in both the rainy and dry seasons. 

Presently, Mrs. Suos S. says that her cow is getting old, and it doesn’t support her field work. Therefore, Mrs. Suos S. is looking for a loan to buy a cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a cow to replace the old one

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of more metal materials for her metal workshop

loans.name: Bilqees Sardar Masih's Group

texts.en:
Bilqees lives in a three-roomed brick house with her family in the area of Railway landy, a railway housing scheme in Khanewal. Khanewal is a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan, and known for its agricultural industry.
Bilqees is a housewife as well as a working woman. To support her family financially, she operates a business selling shawls. She buys them from Multan (famous for its clothes) and sells them to customers in her local area. Her customers include clothes shop owners and people from her neighborhood.
Bilqees' husband is a government employee on a meager income and her only son works in a factory. Her sons left education after 5th grade due to poor financial conditions and the commencement of his factory work.
Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her shawl business. With the loan, she will buy shawls of different kinds (such as simple, colored and embroidered) in large quantities because the winter season is near and demand for shawls will become high. She is hopeful that her business will have a bright future and that investment will do her business a lot of good. Bilqees is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous years, she has maintained good credit behavior and has never missed a meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (the Asasah Passbook) is Bilqees.

loans.use: To buy shawls for resale

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Cleotilde tiene 53 años de edad, es viuda y reside junto a sus tres hijos en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ell cuenta con un buen número de aves de corral como patos y pollos, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Esta actividad es una de las más importantes fuentes de ingreso económico de su familia.

Cleotilde desea ampliar su negocio comprando más aves y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante esta temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Cleotilde is 53 years old, is widowed and lives with her three children in a rural area of Tambogrande, a farming district in Piura region, which is more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque region.

She has a good number of poultry, such as ducks and chickens, which she raises in enclosures at home.  When they have reached a good size, she offers them for sale to the general public and to businessmen who visit the area regularly.  This activity is one of the most important sources of income for the family.

Cleotilde wants to expand her business by buying more birds and balanced feed so she can increase her sales during this Christmas season, when demand for her animals increases.  For this reason she thought it a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new soles.

loans.use: Purchase of animals to expand her animal sales business

loans.name: María Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora. María G. es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza natural, su cultura, su gastronomía que deleita los paladares de propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. María tiene 39 años de edad, es  casada y tiene 8 hijos de 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 9 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija es soltera y se dedica a trabajar, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente, su tercera hija trabaja y ayuda económicamente, sus tres hijos siguientes están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y sus dos ultimas hijas estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora como estibador, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña María se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, esta actividad la realiza desde que tenía 10 años de edad y hace 6 años cuenta con su puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad.
 
Es el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más frutas y verduras y también va a comprar pollos para iniciarse en esta actividad. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y  darles a sus hijos una buena educación para que en el futuro sean unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Guama is a member of the Yanaturo communal bank.  She lives in Yanaturo, a community in the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is known for its natural beauty, its culture and its gastronomy that delights the palates of locals and foreigners alike.  Its people keep its culture and traditions.

María is 39 years old, married and has 8 children who are 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 9 and 7 years old.  Her oldest daughter is single and employed.  The next daughter is married and lives independently.  Her third daughter is employed and helps out economically.  The next three children go to high school in the city and the two youngest go to the local elementary school.  Her husband works as a stevedore.  She does not have a house of her own; she rents.

María is a fruit and vegetable merchant.  She’s been doing this since she was 10 years old and has had her own stand in one of the city’s markets for the last 6 years.

This is the fifth loan she’s negotiated with the communal bank.  Her sister invited her to become part of this group.  She will use the money from her loan to buy more fruit and vegetables.  She will also buy chickens to start out in this activity.  Her dream is to have her own house and to provide her children with good educations so that they will become good professionals in the future.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables and chickens.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 26 years old and married with two children. He works as the supervisor of a tea estate and also as an outgrower (small contract farmer). This enables him to generate enough income to meet his family’s needs.

William and his family live a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. William is requesting a loan to prepare his garden for the next season. In the future, his desire is to complete a permanent house.

loans.use: to prepare garden for next season

loans.name: Lubinda

texts.es:
Lubinda tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el sector Monteverde del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde que era joven. Ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar frutas como mango y limón. Cuando llega el tiempo de cosecha las comercializa con las plantas procesadoras de la zona. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Lubinda siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente ella desea aplicar a su terreno diversos fertilizantes para lograr que las frutas que coseche a futuro se desarrollen de mejor modo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lubinda, age 32, is married with three children. She lives with her husband in the Monteverde sector, Tambogrande district, in the Piura province, in the region of the same name. This region is known as an area where the population works principally in fruit cultivation.

She has worked in agriculture from her youth. She has a small plot of land where she normally plants fruits such as mango and lemon. When harvest time arrives, she sells them to the local processing plants. This business allows her to help her family with their daily living expenses.

Lubinda always works hard in order to be able to get her business ahead. She currently wants to fertilize her land with various fertilizers so that the fruit that she harvests in the future will be better developed. Thus, she has decided to request a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: the purchase of fertilizers for her land.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret M. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Margret has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a boutique. Margret is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to use a computer.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 12.  Emmanuel sells spare parts for cars and owns a spacious shop, which he has had for 1.5 years.  Emmanuel currently employs one person in his store.

Emmanuel will use this loan to purchase more car spare parts to sell.  If he is successful and earns a profit from the loan, he plans to reinvest it back into his business and hopes to keep making it grow.

loans.use: To purchase more car spare parts to sell

loans.name: Darling

texts.es:
La señora Darling del Socorro L. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de especie desde hace 8 años con lo cual ha sacado adelante a sus 6 hijos de 18, 17, 16, 14, 10 y 4 años los cuales estudian y en el tiempo libre trabajan con ella.
Ella invertirá en caramelo, manzanilla, romero, clavo de olor, yerba buena, etc.
texts.en: Mrs. Darling del Socorro L. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who has been a spice merchant for the last 8 years.  This has made it possible for her to support her six children who are 18, 17, 16, 14, 10, and 4 years of age who are in school and work with her in their spare time.  She will use the loan to buy spices like chamomile, rosemary, cloves, spearmint, etc.

loans.use: For spices.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, del Distrito de Morales. Es soltera, tiene 35 años y es madre de 02 niñas, que aún dependen de ella.  Tiene estudios secundarios completos, manifestó haber llevado también estudios superiores orientados al área de corte y confección de prendas de vestirs, pero no pudo terminar.

Lucy se dedica a la venta de kekes,  lleva ya más de 5 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, incursionando en el negocio por iniciativa de un primo, el cuál le prestó un horno en el que empezó a preparar sus primeros productos.  Fueron su esfuerzo y perseverancia los que la llevaron a salir adelante y crecer hasta lo que es ahora. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles, implementó primero su pequeña bodega que fue la que le dio los ingresos suficientes para retomar la idea de hacer una panadería, idea que hasta ahora persigue.

Con este crédito de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, adquirirá una batidora industrial, así como también los ingredientes e insumos que utilizará en la preparación de sus kekes: Harina y azúcar en sacos, huevos en javas, sal y saborizantes en bolsas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la ampliación de un ambiente en su hogar, con el fin de exhibir y vender sus productos.

Lucy, está muy agradecida al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional hacia las mujeres emprendedoras como ella.
texts.en:
Lucy belongs to the communal bank "Las Moralinas" in the Morales district.  She is single, 35 years old, and is the mother of 2 dependent children.  She completed her high school education, and she told us that she also has taken some advanced classes in dressmaking, but she was not able to complete those studies.

Lucy has a business selling bundt cakes.  She has been in this line of work for more than 5 years.  She entered into this business through the initiative of her cousin, who lent her an oven so that she could start making her first products.  Through her efforts and perseverance she was able to get ahead and her business grew into what it is today.  With her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles she was able to set up a small store, and this gave her sufficient income to take up the idea of having a bakery, an idea that she has pursued until now.

With this loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will acquire an industrial mixer as well as ingredients and supplies that she will use in the preparation of her cakes: sacks of flour and sugar, crates of eggs, and bags of salt and flavorings.  In addition, she will invest part of the money in expanding an area of her home where she can exhibit and sell her products. 

Lucy is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for the unconditional support provided to female entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar, crates of eggs, and bags of salt and flavorings.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Mr. Soy S. (in the photo) is 54 years old and his wife, Mrs. Seng Uon,  is 56 years old. They live about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have two sons and one daughter. One is a garment factory worker, one attends school, and the third is a construction worker.

Mr. Soy S. and his wife are rice farmers. In addition, Soy is a traditional musician and Seng cuts grass to sell as cattle feed. 

Soy is asking for a loan of $350 to add to his own money to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to use to get to work.

loans.use: To add to his own money to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Yhofre Teodocio

texts.es: Yhofre tiene 33 años de edad, tiene una  hija de 3 años de edad,  el y su hija viven en la casa de sus padres, en Av Tupac Amaru del distrito de Parcona,casa de material noble de dos pisos. Yhofre se dedica a prestar servicio de carga en  vehiculo propio, el cual adquirio con ahorro  producto de su trabajo como chofer , el adquirio su vehiculo hace 9 meses. Jhofre como  todo joven tiene sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener su propia vivienda y crecer en su negocio.  Con el dinero sera para realizar algunos cambio de su vehiculo.(cambio  y renovacion de asientos y otros)
texts.en:
Yhofre is 33 years old and has a 3-year-old daughter. He and his daughter live in his parents' solid two-story house, on Tupac Amaru Avenue in the Parcona district.

Yhofre hauls cargo in his truck, which he acquired with savings that resulted from his work as a chauffeur. He obtained his vehicle some 9 months ago. Jhofre, like other young people, has dreams and objectives, one of which is to have his own home and, also, to increase his business.

With the money from this loan he will improve his vehicle (changing and renovating the seats and other things).

loans.use: TO CHANGE HIS VEHICLE'S SEATS AND MAKE OTHER REPAIRS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuffs to cook for sale.

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
Maximiliano, tiene 53años de edad, es originario de la comarca Labranza ubicada en Condega municipio de Estelí, de oficio agricultor ,es padre de familia de 7 hijos , solo estudio hasta tercer grado de   primaria. El inicio desde temprana edad, conforme paso el tiempo se estableció en la comarca Las Mesas, en Pueblo Nuevo ahí siembra  hortalizas, gracias a esas cosechas pudo comprar tierra , así comenzó a sembrar granos básicos  y posteriormente café de esta manera ha ido creciendo poco a poco trabajando fuertemente con sus hijos también , hoy en día tienen ganado.  
Solicito el préstamo para mantenimiento de café y siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, compra de insumos, abonos, fertilizantes. Este crédito le ayudara a sacar una buena producción y darle un buen mantenimiento a sus siembras. El planea componer  un pozo, comprar ganado, mejorar la calidad de siembra de café orgánico
texts.en:
Maximiliano is 53 years old and from Labranza, in Condega, Estelí.  He is a farmer and has seven children.  He only studied up to the third year of elementary school.  Maximiliano started farming at an early age.  He went on to set himself up in Las Mesas, in Pueblo Nuevo, where he currently sows his crops.  Thanks to his harvests, he was able to buy land and so started sowing basic grains and then coffee.  His business has gradually grown and he works hard alongside his children.  They now also own livestock.

Maximiliano requested this loan to maintain his coffee crop, to sow basic grains such as corn and beans, and to buy supplies, manure and fertilizers.  This loan will help him to achieve a good production and maintain his crops.  He plans to fix up a well, buy livestock and improve the quality of his crops, with organic coffee.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee crop, to sow basic grains such as corn and beans, and to buy supplies, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: El Cedro Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Veracruz en el municipio de Tezonapa Existe una comunidad llamada el cedro en el cual existe una UDE (grupo de mas de diez personas que tienen una cuenta en el banco y tienen que reunirse semanal o quincenalmente para hacer sus pagos)la cual lleva el mismo nombre en honor a la comunidad que habitan, este grupo esta formado por  11  integrantes

El representante del grupo se llama Emilia tiene la edad de 52 años, estudio solo la primaria, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres y uno hombre de nombres Graciela de 24 años, Vicente de 28 años y Vianey de 21, los cuales ya estan casados, actualmente solo vive con su esposo. Ella nos platica que hace mas de 5 años ella y su familia siembran cafe y lo cosechan, ella su esposo y su hijo se encargan del cuidado de sus siembras de regarlo ponerle abonos y cuando llega el tiempo del cultivo del cafe le dan trabajo a algunas personas de la comunidad, despues de cosechar venden el cafe, nos platica que antes se lo vendian a un señor que tenia un molino pero hace un par de años cerro su molino y ahora lo venden en la comunidad y en algunas otras cercanas. ellos enden el cafe algunas veces en cereza(que es cuando esta maduro) y otras veces en Oro(grano). Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en abonos y fertilizantes para su siembra, tambien nos platico que espera en un futuro seguir trabajando ya que en estos tiempos la situacion economica esta muy dura y solo trabajando se puede salir adelante.(alguna de las personas que salen en la foto son amigos y vecinos que estaba ahi en ese momento y quisieron salir en la foto)



Los otros integrantes se llaman:
Senorina  - venta de antojitos
Camerina  - venta de ropa
Maria Lucrecia - venta de abarrotes
Eva  - venta de abarrotes
Yuridia - club nutricion 
Rosalia - venta de abarrotes
eulalia- venta zapatos
elodia-venta de catalago
dora maria -tienda ropa
genoveva- zapatos
texts.en:
In the State of Veracruz, in the town of Tezonapa, there is a community called El Cedro in which there is an 'UDE' (a group of more than ten people who have an account with the community bank and must meet up every one or two weeks to make their payments).  This group was named in honor of the community in which its members live.  It has eleven members.

The group's representative is called Emilia.  She is 52 years old and has an elementary school level of education.  Emilia is married and has three children (two daughters and one son): 24 year-old Graciela, 28 year-old Vicente and 21 year-old Vianey, who are all married.  Currently, Emilia only lives with her husband.  She tells us that she and her family have been growing and harvesting coffee for more than five years.  Emilia, her husband and her son look after the crops, watering them and applying fertilizers.  When the time comes to harvest the coffee, they provide work to some people in their community.  After harvesting, they sell the coffee.  Emilia tells us that they used to sell their coffee to a gentleman who owned a grinder but he closed down a couple of years ago and now they sell their produce within their own community and in some other nearby communities.  They sometimes sell coffee cherries (which is when the coffee is mature) and sometimes they sell the beans.

Emilia needs this loan to invest in fertilizers for her crops.  She tells us that she hopes to continue working in the future because the financial situation is very hard these days and you can only get ahead in life by working.

Some of the people who appear in this photo are friends and neighbors who were present when the photo was taken and wanted to appear in it.

The other members of the group are: 

Senorina - snack sales
Camerina - clothing sales
Maria Lucrecia - grocery sales
Eva - grocery sales
Yuridia - nutrition club
Rosalia - grocery sales
Eulalia - shoe sales
Elodia -  catalog sales
Dora maria - clothes store
Genoveva - shoe sales

loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Chapeline

texts.fr: Chapeline est née le 03 mars 1972 au Bénin et est mariée à un  agent de la Société Béninoise d’Electricité et d’Eau, du nom de Patrice. Chapeline est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Chapeline  et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Chapeline vend des produits cosmétiques et  des chaussures. Chapeline exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Chapeline s’approvisionne  dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que  Chapeline  sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.
texts.en:
Chapeline was born on March 3, 1972 in Benin and is married to Patrice, an agent for the "Société Béninoise d’Electricité et d’Eau" (water and electric company). Chapeline is the mother of four children, all in school and supported by their parents. Chapeline and her husband live with their children.

Never having gone to school, Chapeline sells cosmetics and shoes. She has been doing this for fifteen years, and it allows her to meet her needs and those of her children.

Chapeline gets her supplies at one of Benin's largest markets. This is the third time that Chapeline has sought a loan through ALIDé. She would like to expand her business and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en: Saturnino, 56 years of age, is married to a vegetable vendor. They were blessed with 4 children. Saturnino has been growing corn for almost 35 years. With his last crop, his net income was 25,000 PHP. He's asking a loan for 30,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm. He hopes that lenders will continue assisting him in the business so that he can further improve it and support his family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yeni Mercedes

texts.es: Yeni Mercedes se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y destace de cerdos. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, con el paso del tiempo ella ha logrado brindarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Inicio con fondos propios pues a pesar de que no tenía mucho capital logro salir adelante. El financiamiento es para la compra de cuajada, cremas, queso, leche entre otros producto productos para ofrecerlos.
texts.en:
Yeni Mercedes sells dairy products and butchers pigs.  She has had this business for over eight years.  With the passage of time she has managed to give her family their daily bread.  

She started with her own funds.  In spite of the fact that she did not have much capital, she managed to get ahead.

The loan is to buy curd, cream, cheese, and milk, among other products to sell.

loans.use: to buy curd, cream, cheese, and milk, among other products to sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Her husband is a fisherman.

Jovita and her husband run a fishing business. They own a fishing boat that her husband uses to catch fish. Jovita helps by selling his catch at the market. She also requested a loan to buy fishing hooks and gears to repair their fishing boat.

In the future, Jovita hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy fishing hooks and gears to repair their fishing boat

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina is 53 years-old and married with seven children.

Edelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional items such as snack foods, soft-drinks etc. to sell in her store.

Edelina has borrowed and paid for four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Edelina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as snack foods, soft-drinks etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gladys Esperanza

texts.es: Gladys Esperanza tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de tres años que tiene este negocio, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con sus clientes que le solicita diferentes pedidos por lo que Gladys tiene que viajar a Managua para obtener productos a precios favorables. Gladys se levanta a las siete de mañana para hacer la visita a sus diferentes clientes, esta es una forma  en la que atrae a sus clientes. El crédito es para la compra de sabanas, perfumes, prendas, ropa en general, manteles, calzados, bolsas y trajes.
texts.en:
Gladys Esperanza has been in the business of selling general merchandise for more than three years. What she enjoys most about her job is the relationship with her customers. They request different items, so she must travel to Managua to obtain these products at favorable prices. Gladys wakes up at 7am in order to visit her various customers. This is also how she attracts new customers.

This loan will be used to buy bed sheets, perfumes, jewelry, clothing, blankets, shoes, bags, and suits.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, perfumes, jewelry, clothing, blankets, shoes, bags, and suits.

loans.name: Amarbaysgalan

texts.en: Amarbaysgalan is 49 years old and lives with her three children and grandchild in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her children work at the government office. Their monthly salary is 225,000 MNT. Amarbaysgalan worked as a measurement controller at the local food factory from 1992 to 1999. When the factory was privatized, she started selling meat at the local market in 2000. She is planning to expand her business by selling other products and foods. She is a diligent woman who says "I plan to do my business in the future. I also want to help my daughter to build her home." She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase meat from country people and sell it to the local market.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Kitonga

texts.en:
Kitonga, 30 years old, is married with three children. Two are in school. He does mixed farming, i.e., rearing sheep, goats, cattle and is also a wheat farmer which he has been doing for the past eight years.


He learned about KADET LTD  through a KADET staff member. He has applied for his first loan which he plans to spend on farming and also to purchase more animals.

He hopes to make profit and use the anticipated profit to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to spend on farming and also buy more animals to rear.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta es socia del  Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 57 años D. edad, está separada y tiene dos hijos independientes, estudió educación secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. comidas (restaurante).

Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,600.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercadería e insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, cubierto, vasos y otros utensilios.  La señora tiene a cargo cocineros y empleados, también tiene pensionistas familiares en su casa los cuales generan otros ingresos. 
Su sueño es poner una cevichería y chicharroneria en su domicilio y ampliar su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la solidaridad, la responsabilidad y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Antonieta is a member of the Bellavista Communal Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province and department.  She is 57 years old, separated, and has two independent children.  She has a high school education.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in her business of selling food (restaurant).

With the new loan of 1,600 soles she will buy merchandise and supplies like rice, sugar, noodles, cutlery, glasses, and other utensils.  She oversees cooks and employees.  She also has family pensioners in her house, and they generate other income.

Her dream is to set up a restaurant that serves seafood and pork crackling in her house.  She also dreams of expanding her business.

What she likes about the communal bank is the solidarity, the responsibility, and the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, and cutlery.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. Pacita has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of used clothing. Pacita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 44 years old and single. To make a living, Nely owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. She’s been engaged in farming corn for over 20 years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP every crop season(every four months) from these activities. She's also engaged in a retail store where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her corn production business. Future loans from KIVA would be invaluable to her as she sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of her business and thus financial security.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her corn production business.

loans.name: Afeped (Missebo 2) Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AFEPED (MISSEBO 2)est formé de deux personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Blandine Léonie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Blandine Léonie est âgée de 59 ans et est une veuve. Blandine Léonie a quatre enfants, mais deux restent encore à sa charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Blandine Léonie vit seule avec ses enfants à charge. Blandine Léonie a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Blandine Léonie prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz) dans une école de son quartier, depuis une trentaine d'année. Parallèlement à cette activité, Blandine Léonie vend des accessoires pour yaourt et bissaps. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Blandine Léonie désire élargir son activité. Pour ce faire, Blandine Léonie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AFEPED (MISSEBO 2), un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The group AFEPED (MISSEBO 2) is composed of two persons who live in the same district. The group's representative, named Blandine Léonie, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their business. Blandine Léonie is 59 years old and a widow. She has four children. Two of the children still remain in her care, and certain ones are in school. She lives alone with the children she supports. Blandine Léonie has attended middle school. To cope with her needs and those of her children, she has been making and selling food (rice) at a school in her area for about thirty years. Along with this work, she sells supplies for making yoghurt and bissaps (for example, beverages made from hibiscus flowers). Concerned about bolstering her business further and responding better to the requirements of her customers, she would like to expand. To do so, she and the other member of the group AFEPED (MISSEBO 2) are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan has indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy sauce condiments, rice and supplies for making yoghurt and refreshments

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, nuevamente solicita un préstamo para la reparación de la bicicleta, en la cual se traslada a la venta de pan, además que tendrá una parte en efectivo para la compra de pan dulce y francés.
Para Juan ha sido un avance en su trabajo, ya que con este apoyo mantiene dinero disponible para la compra de pan, esto le ayuda para generar más ventas y tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan to repair his bicycle, which he uses when he is selling bread. In addition, he will use part of the loan to buy sweet bread and French bread.

In order for Juan to advance in his job, he needs to have available funds to buy bread. This will help him generate more sales and have more income.

loans.use: to pay for bicycle repairs and to buy bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for general maintenance for his motortaxi.

loans.name: Renacimiento Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Renacimiento” está conformado por 16 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de abarrotes en almacenes, panaderías, venta de ropa usada, preparación de comida rápida entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Ana integrante del grupo del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra arriba de una silla, por lo que sobresale, ella viste un chaleco oscuro y una polera floreada, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro hasta el hombro, además saluda con la mano izquierda.
Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de librería en un bazar, desde hace 7 años. Su local lo tiene ubicado en el patio de su casa.
Comenta que su negocio lo inició con muy poca mercadería y en la actualidad su negocio se ha expandido y lo tiene bien abastecido por lo que  le ha ido muy bien. Además su local está ubicado cerca de dos colegios por lo que para las temporadas más altas, a partir de marzo, esto le favorece, a pesar de la competencia en el sector.
Su mercadería la compra a los proveedores que van directamente a su local, ya que es más conveniente económicamente. 
Con el crédito comprará insumos para surtir su bazar.
Sus metas son seguir creciendo y ampliar la infraestructura de su local. Además comenta que quiere iniciar otro negocio, ya que Ana también realiza el oficio de peluquería por lo que le gustaría construir otro local y habilitarlo como salón de belleza. Para concretar éste proyecto se dio un plazo de 6 meses.
Ana vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijas, quienes estudian en la universidad.
Sus sueños son prosperar en su negocio, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y el grupo del cual forma parte, ya que les ha servido para conocerse. Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han servido para administrar de mejor manera los ingresos y gastos del negocio. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Renacimiento” . It consists of 16 entrepreneurs who each work in different business sectors such as: grocery stores; bakeries; used clothes sales; fast food production and other businesses. They are all belong to the town of Chillán.

Ana is a member of the communal bank and in the photo can be seen standing on a chair which is why she stands out. She is wearing a dark jacket and a floral shirt. Her hair is shoulder length and dark brown and is waving with her left hand. She has been selling stationary in a bazaar for the last 7 years. Her business is located in her backyard patio. She says that she started her business with very few items and currently her business has expanded and is well stocked which why she is doing well. In addition her bazaar is close to 2 schools which during the high seasons, from March onwards, gives her the edge despite having compettiion in the area. 

She buys her merchandise from suppliers who visit her locale as it works out cheaper. She will buy items for her bazaar with the loan.

Her goals are to continue growing and expanding the infrastructure of her locale. In addition she says that she wants to start another business as Ana is also a hairdresser and would like to build another room and fit it out as a beauty salon. She has given herself a timeframe of 6 months to realize this project. 

Ana lives with her mother and 2 daughters who study at the university. Her dreams are for her business to prosper to give her and her family a better quality of life.

She is very happy and grateful for the support given her by the Fondo Esperanza as it has allowed her to invest in her business. In addition, she also feels very comfortable at the meetings and with the group she is a part of as they have helped them know one another. With regards the training, these have helped her better administer her business income and expenses.

Chillán is a community in the centre of southern Chile. The name means "Chair of the Sun" in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuches. Chillán is known as the "Cradle of the Nation" or "Land of Artists" due to the fact that the town has produced several leading figures in the history of Chile such as the concert pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy items to stock her stationary store.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sum appears in the photo with her one daughter in front of her thatched house in the Prey Chor district. She has a common-law relationship with her husband who works as a rice farmer as well as a sugar-palm tree climber. After her husband gets palm juice from the top of the tree, he brings it to his wife at home. Then Mrs. Sum starts burning palm juice until palm sugar is made. 

Mrs. Sum typically yields a profit of $2.50 per day from this business. Mrs. Sum has a lot of customers who come to buy her palm sugar, and she wants to improve this business by increasing her volume.

In order to achieve her goal, she is asking for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 from HKL and Kiva to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to travel far distances to collect as much palm juice as he can. Mrs. Sum hopes that she will be able to lift her family out of poverty as she and her husband strive to work.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to travel far distances to collect as much palm juice as he can.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick makes mainly tea and doughnuts in his cafeteria. He has been running the business for nine years and has employed two people.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and learned how to manage his finances.  He hopes to expand his business and start outside catering services.
Erick needs a loan of 30, 000 Kenya shillings to buy plastic chairs for his cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs for his cafeteria

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 44 years old, a single mother of two children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 10,500 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd  of Kes   47,748 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Lucy will use the loan to buy a piece of land for farming. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land to build rental houses on.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa sells shea butter, pomade, and powder. She has done this for 20 years. Hawa lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and her eight dependents at Kwahinkrom, near Elmiina. She uses her income to assist her husband with the general needs of their family. Hawa will use her loan to purchase more shea butter, pomade, and powder to sell. With the new profit she makes, she plans to expand her business

loans.use: purchase more shea butter, pomade, and powder to sell.

loans.name: Noé Alcides

texts.es: Noé Alcides, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica a la agricultura, él realiza todo el trabajo desde la siembra, el cuidado y la obtención del maíz y maicillo,además a la crianza de ganado bovino, estos son trabajos bastantes fuertes, pero él lo realiza con el deseo de darle lo mejor a su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposa y dos hijos. Noé solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de alimentos para su ganado, así mismo para comprar semilla de maíz y maicillo para aumentar sus cosechas.  Con todo esto él espera mejorar su economía familiar y así contar con todo lo necesario para vivir mejor. Noé es una persona que se dedica de lleno a su esposa e hijos, razón por la que solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Compra de maicillo para sembrar

loans.name: Nimwenga

texts.en:
Nimwenga appreciates the previous loan that helped her to  expand her business. 

Nimwenga has  operated a poultry selling business for 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mary dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

She wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy  chicks for her business.

loans.name: Mariama Bobo's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré depuis le 14 Décembre 2012,il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles vivent dans le même village et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Mariama, (assise à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée d’une cinquantaine d’années et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles et 01 garçon. Elle est vendeuse de sucre, de d’huile, de colas et de savon qu’elle achète au marché central régional pour le revendre en détail dans son village.

 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter 1 sac de sucre à 23000f, 20 kg de colas à 15000f, 20litre d’huile raffiné à 17500f et 01 carton de savon à 5500f.

En plus d’augmenter son épargne, les bénéfices lui permettront de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et d'assister son mari dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Inaugurated on December 14, 2012, the women of this "banc villageois" enjoy a good connection among the members of the group. They all live in the same village and enjoy relations of solidarity and cooperation. Their principal business activity is small-scale commerce.  

Madame Mariama, (seated on the far right), is the featured borrower of this group. She is married, around 50 years old, and the mother of three children, two girls and one boy. She sells sugar, oil, kola nuts, and soap that she buys in Kolda to sell retail in her village. 

With her new loan she wants to buy one sack of sugar at 23,000 francs, 20 kg of kola nuts for 15,000 francs, 20 liters of oil at 17,500 francs, and one case of soap at 5500 francs. 

Besides growing her savings, the profit will permit her to settle some financial issues.

loans.use: to buy one sack of sugar at 23,000 francs, 20 kg of kola nuts for 15,000 francs, 20 liters of oil at 17,500 francs, and one case of soap at 5500 francs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca , hails  from the town of Dulag.  She is 42-year-old married woman and has eight children, whom six of them are still attending school. She raises and sold hogs to earn for a living.
Aside from hog raising,  she also engages in tuba (coconut) wine vending business.
Her husband is a farmer.

She needs funds to support her existing project. She has requested a loan to buy additional pig, feed and more stocks of tuba(coconut) wine .  These will be essential in the improvement of her livelihood. She could able to sold high quality hogs her earnings will goes up.
 
Rebecca is hoping that someday, her livelihood will become productive and to continue finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional pig, feed and more stocks of tuba(coconut) wine

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.en:
Bertha was born in Tamaulipas state and she has been living for more than ten years in Monterrey. She came to the city with her family, looking for better work opportunities. She is married and has a daughter of 10 years old. Her husband Pedro is employee in a factory and earns a salary that is not enough to cover all the home necessities. At the moment she works as employee in a manufacturing factory and at the same time she has the opportunity to sell beauty products to her fellow workers and her neighbors. This activity does not require her too much time investment, and she can care for her daughter who always goes with her when she visits to her clients. To Bertha her small daughter is the most important thing in life, for that reason she wants to give her a good education and a better quality of life.

She is requesting for a loan of $375 USD to purchase wholesale merchandise, because she has the opportunity to increase her sales in this Christmas season. Bertha and her family thank your generosity and your affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Bertha nació en el estado de Tamaulipas pero tiene más de diez años de vivir en Monterrey, ella vino a esta ciudad, junto con su familia, en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Es casada y tiene una niña de 10 años de nombre Perla, su esposo Pedro es empleado de una fábrica y gana un salario que no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades del hogar. Actualmente ella trabaja como empleada en una fabrica y al mismo tiempo se da la oportunidad de vender productos de belleza con su compañeras de trabajo y sus vecinos, ella comenta que esta actividad no le implica ninguna inversión de tiempo, de esta manera puede atender su casa y no descuidar a su hija que siempre la acompaña cuando realiza las visitas a sus clientes. Para Bertha su pequeña hija es lo más importante en la vida, por lo que desea darle una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Solicita un crédito de $375 USD para compra mercancía de mayoreo y así incrementar sus ventas en esta temporada navideña. Bertha y su familia agradecen tu generosidad y tu cariño.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Xuyên

texts.en:
Xuyên and her husband Khanh have 2 children. The eldest is 20 and works as a day laborer. Their income is just $10/person/month. Their hopes lie with their youngest, now in college.

They want to borrow $75 to increase the volume of their shop a little bit.

loans.use: Small shop selling coffee &  supplies for school children.

loans.name: Maria Elena Socorro

texts.en:
Maria Elena is a woman with great aspirations of succeeding. She is married and has a 4-year-old and 2-year-old child. Three years ago her husband was unemployed, and finding another job was difficult. Thus, together they decided to start their own business and equipped a blacksmith’s workshop. They started with very little equipment and thankfully with her husband’s experience they were able to perform quality work and obtain great results with their customers. Maria also learned this trade and collaborates with her husband in the workshop. Together they have grown their business.

Right now Maria asks for a loan of 475 dollars, which she will use in the purchase of materials, like files, rods, plates, etc., to increase production and continue growing.
