She intends to pay back her loan within 4-8 months. In your hands rests the well being of this family and the growth of their business. Please support them.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena es una mujer con grandes deseos de salir adelante, ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años y una preciosa hija de 2. Hace tres años, su esposo quedó desempleado y no le fue fácil encontrar otro trabajo, así que juntos decidieron iniciar su propio negocio, acondicionaron un taller de herrería a un costado de su casa, iniciaron con poco equipo y gracias a la experiencia que tiene su esposo en esta labor han podido hacer trabajos de muy buena calidad y han obtenido buenos resultados con sus clientes. Maria también ha aprendido este oficio y colabora con su esposo en el taller, juntos han logrado hacerlo crecer,

Ahora Maria solicita un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de materiales como lijas, varilla, láminas, etc., para incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia y el crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te están esperando, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
About three years ago, Lourdes decided to open up a small convenience store with the hope of contributing to and improving her household's income. After a lot of effort and countless hours of work, she began offering other services to meet the demands of her clientele. Inside her shop she set up a small number of computers to provide Internet service, and she also has a photocopier and pay phones so her clients can communicate from her shop to any part of the world. Due to the fact that there is insufficient space and there is a large amount of affluence in her neighborhood, Lourdes wishes to increase the number of computers and the size of her shop to make it more serviceable for her customers. For this reason, she's requesting a loan of $275, which she plans to repay within six months. Her objective is to increase her income and provide a better education and quality of life to her children. She and her family await your quick response.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hace aproximadamente 3 años Lourdes decidió abrir una pequeña tienda de venta de abarrotes, con el deseo de contribuir y mejorar el ingreso económico de su hogar. Después de mucho esfuerzo y horas interminables de trabajo fueron ofreciendo también otros servicios atendiendo la demanda de su exigente clientela. Dentro de las instalaciones de la tienda ha acondicionado un número pequeño de computadoras para ofrecer el servicio de internet, además de una fotocopiadora y teléfonos monederos para que los clientes hagan uso de estas herramientas y puedan comunicarse desde ese lugar a cualquier parte del mundo. Debido a que no existe espacio suficiente y hay mayor cantidad de afluencia pública a su local, Lourdes, desea ampliar el número de computadoras y el espacio para brindarles mayor comodidad a sus clientes.Por esta razón solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en 6 meses, y el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos, mejorar la educación y calidad de vida de sus hijos. Lourdes y su familia esperan tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: Lourdes wants to increase the size of her convenience store and add more computers to provide more services and comfort to her demanding customers.

loans.name: Chandra Bedi

texts.en: Mrs. Chandra Bedi M. is a 40 year old woman and she lives in Thecho. She lives in a single family with her husband, a daughter and a son. Her husband Mr. Asta M. works as a laborer in housing construction. The income of her family is so low their life is very miserable. They hardly can fulfill their needs. She can't provide good education to her children. Mrs. M. is a farmer. She has her own land. She grows different vegetables like cauliflower and green vegetables. She sells vegetables in a local market in the morning and in the evening every day. Now she seeks a loan of Rs10,000.00  to buy fertilizers and seeds for her work.

loans.use: Chandra would like to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter D. is a trader who deals in foam mattresses from Ash Foam Ghana limited. He sells ash foam products to institutions and individuals. He is a hardworking man. He is married with one child. The wife is also a trader.
One major challenge that Walter  faces is that prices of the mattresses have been going up.  He is therefore asking for a loan of US $ 1,200 dollars to buy the mattresses in bulk from the factory so that he can also meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy the mattresses in bulk from the factory.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah, the Group Leader, is married with eight children.She has a poultry business. She also sells chicken feed. She wants to use the extra profits to build a house and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To begin another business in order to support the family.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Lourdes is 49 years old and married. She lives in Iietapa of the Hialeth neighborhood of Managua. Her husband is an electrical engineer and he works in a state business. Mrs. Maria Lourdes dedicates herself to the sale of clothes, shoes and electrical appliances. Due to the little income of this pair, Maria Lourdes saw the necessity to sell food on the weekend, she sells beef soup, small businesses have helped her to succeed and to have a comfortable life with her family. The school time is about to begin and she will use the loan to purchase tools and school uniforms to distribute to her clients and neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Lourdes tiene 49 años de edad, es casada. Habita en la Iietapa del barrio Hialeah de Managua. Su esposo es Ingeniero Electronico y trabaja en una empresa estatal. Doña Maria Lourdes se deica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, electrodomesticos. Debido a los pocos ingresos por parte de esta pareja, Maria Lourdes se vió en la necesidad de vender comida los fines de semanas, ella vende sopa de res y Baho, estos pequeños negocios le han ayudado a salir adelante y llevar una vida cómoda junto a su familia. La época escolar está por empezar y ocupará el préstamo en la compra e útiles y uniformes escolares para distriburilos entre sus clientes y vecinos del barrio donde habita.

loans.use: The purchase of tools and school uniforms.

loans.name: Khair Mohammad

texts.en: Khair Mohammad lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and his wife is a teacher. He is supporting all of his family. Has a metal shop and this is the second years that he has been involved in this business. He wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his materials to attract more clients and make a good income to help his family. He is happy that he can improve his business.

loans.use: To complete his materials

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 41 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 25, 20 and 19 years old. Asha is a timber seller, and she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more timber for her business.

loans.use: To buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Deissi Alejendrin

texts.en:
Deissi Alejendrin R. G. has a business selling cosmetics in the town of Salpo, high in the Sierras of the Region of La Libertad. She sells her products in Salpo and also often travels to Trujillo where she has a few loyal customers. She buys and sells Esiak products, a popular brand in Peru.

Deissi is 37 years old, single, and has 2 children. Her business has given her the ability to provide for her children and improve her self confidence. She now has ideas to start other businesses.

A member of the community bank Virgen de Las Mercedes, Deissi is requesting a loan of s/2200 to repay over 6 months and will restock many of the popular cosmetics her clients enjoy.

loans.use: To restock many of the popular cosmetics her clients enjoy.

loans.name: Chanthy Chea Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy C. is the leader of a five-person business group in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a mat maker in the village. Her business has improved, but her family's living conditions have not improved, so Mrs. Chanthy C. wants to start a pig breeding business. Thus, Mrs. Chanthy C. is asking for a loan to buy pigs to raise.

Her husband, Mr. Sopheourn Reang, is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Chanthy C. is 46 years old and is the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while four others are studying at local school. The one remaining is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en: Nizami was born in 1955. He is married, has 4 children, and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin region, and is settled in the Absheron region. 15 years ago, he started this business. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy meat to expand his butchery business.

loans.use: to buy meat for re-sale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina breeds cattle and later on sells the milk to a company called PIL Andina.

She lives in the community of Chahuira Chico, in the sector of Achacachi, in the province of Omasuyos (3 hours and a half away from La Paz).

She lives together with her husband, who is a teacher and their three children (ages 12, 18 and 20).

This is the first loan Isabel requests to Impro; she will use it to buy more cattle. The loan evaluation that was realized, qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabina se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, produce leche que es vendida a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).

Su vivienda esta ubicada en la comunidad Chahuira Chico, sector Achacachi de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz (a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz.)

Vive junto a su esposo (de profesión maestro rural) y sus 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 12 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito será destinado para la compra de ganado vacuno Es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy cattle and produce more milk

loans.name: Chika

texts.en:
Chika I. is 35 years old and single and he lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He is a commercial motorcyclist. He has been in this business since 2003. He is a LAPO client.

Chika I. needs the loan amount of US$ 600 to buy another motorcycle, which he will use to convey goods and his customers from one location to another. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for commercial purposes

loans.name: Enma Rita

texts.en:
Emma in Ayacucho, Perú with her two children aged seven and 12. She has been selling groceries for 10 years. It is very important to her that her children receive a good education and learn to save money just like she is doing with the help of FINCA Perú.

With this loan of 2,550 soles (US$875) she will invest in more products for her store such as sugar, refreshments and candies. She hopes, with the income from her grocery store, to ensure her children continue their education.

loans.use: To invest in more products for her store such as sugar, refreshments and candies.

loans.name: Eli

texts.fr: Eli A. est propriétaire et gérante d’un bar-restaurant à Kpalimé au Togo  Agée de 32 ans, Eli est très réputée pour être spécialisée en cuisine. Avec cette chance de Kiva et ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, elle désire faire davantage de stock de tubercules, de mais pour les plats de fufu et de la pâte, des plats très appréciés par la clientèle. Elle apprécie cette opportunité qui lui permettra de participer plus à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager
texts.en:
Eli A. is the owner and manager of a bar-restaurant in Kpalimé in Togo. Eli has a very good reputation as a cook. With this Kiva opportunity and this third loan from FECECAV, she wishes to make a larger stock of coco yams, corn to make fufu dishes and paté, dishes that are well liked by her customers. She appreciates this opportunity that will enable her to take a larger financial responsibility in providing for her family's needs, thanks to the profit she will earn.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coco yams, and bags of corn to prepare dishes

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 64 años, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales ya no viven con él, ahora está viviendo sólo con su esposa. Desde su juventud se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando hectáreas tras hectárea de papas, pero desde que vio que a su hija le va bien en la  crianza de cuyes decidió incursionar en este rubro. Entonces su hija le regaló algunos, él con mucha emoción construyó jaulas, ahora sus vecinos saben que el criá cuyes y le hacen pedidos. Y cuando su hija viaja él aprovecha en enviarle para que los pueda vender; y del mismo modo le ayuda a su hija en el cultivo de su chacra. Sembrar le es dificultoso, por ello es que ahora siembra solo para su consumo personal, la crianza de cuyes le parece más rentable. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ha sido puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita va comprar cebada para sembrar, esto sirve para la alimentación diaria de sus roedores, otra parte usará para la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra de papa.
texts.en:
Concepción is a 64-year-old married father of 4 children, who no longer live with him. Only he and his wife live at home. Ever since he was young, he has worked in agriculture, growing hectare upon hectare of potatoes. However, ever since he noticed that his daughter was prosperous in raising guinea pigs, he decided to enter this field. His daughter then gave him some of her guinea pigs, and he enthusiastically built cages for them. Now that his neighbors know that he is raising guinea pigs, they order some from him. When his daughter travels, he takes advantage of it, sending her however many guinea pigs she can sell. He also helps his daughter to cultivate her farm. Growing crops is difficult, which is why he only does it for personal consumption. Raising guinea pigs, on the other hand, is more lucrative. This is his second loan with MFP. He has made his payments punctually. With this loan, he will purchase barley for planting, which serves as food for the rodents. He will also purchase fertilizer for his potato farm with the other part of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and plant barley for guinea pig food

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua.  Norma is 40 years old and single; she lives at home with her parents. Norma has a workshop in her house where she sews clothing. She makes custom-fitted dresses and suits. She also participates in another business with other people; they embroider handbags and blouses to export to other countries.  Norma needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy a variety of fabrics.  Norma dreams of directly exporting her work and of going on a Caribbean vacation.

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Norma es socia D. Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. 
Norma es soltera, tiene 40 años y vive en casa de sus padres, Norma tiene un taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir, que esta ubicado en su casa, confecciona vestidos, ternos a medida. Además junto a otras personas se dedican a la elaboración de tejidos bordados, como carteras, blusas que exportan a diferentes países. 
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas variadas. 
Norma sueña con exportar directamente sus productos e ir de vacaciones al caribe.

loans.use: Buy a variety of fabrics

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Mận, 26 tuổi, ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. Gia đình chị có một con nhỏ 5 tuổi. Hiện tại thu nhập của  gia đình phụ thuộc vào công việc chăn nuôi, buôn bán hàng tạp hoá và tiền công làm nghề cắt tóc của chồng với thu nhập  2.000.000/ tháng. Chị mới tham gia vào Quỹ từ tháng 12 năm 2008, chị mong muốn được vay vốn với mức là 5.000.000 để đầu tư vào buôn bán  nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Trần Thị Mận is 26 years old. She lives in Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá with her family. She has a 5 years old child. Her family income of 2.000.000 VND a month comes from various sources: raising poultry, selling grocery, her husband is a hair stylist. She is recently became a TYM fund member in December 2008. She wishes to get a loan of 5.000.000 VND to invest in her grocery store in order to increase her income

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandis for grocery store

loans.name: Dilgam

texts.en: Dilgam A. is a 23-year-old, single man who lives with his parents. Dilgam sells cosmetic and bath goods as shampoo, hair color, soap, perfume, washing powder. He proudly states that he has been in this line of business for 3 years. Dilgam purchases his goods from the neighboring city. The income he is able to generate from his business allows him to support his family (he is the sole breadwinner in his family). Now, Dilgam is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD over a 15-month term, the proceeds of which will be used to expand his inventory of goods (i.e., he plans to purchase additional goods). Dilgam is a very hard-working man. Beside his main business Dilgam also works as teacher in the local school. Dilgam thanks everyone for their support, and he promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Naseem Jahangir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a 29-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is J. A. and he is a wood seller by profession. He has been selling wood for the past 8 years. Her husband chose this business because there’s no gas in the area. Naseem baji is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s wood-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Haleema begum baji and Sajida baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy a motorbike to rent out.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to sell

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en:
G. Kurbon is married. His wife is a homemaker and they have a two-year-old child. 

He has always been a hard worker. He started working at an early age, helping his mother with her clothing business, and contributing his earnings to them from the time that he was 15 years old. When Kurbon married, his expenses increased and he had to strike out on his own to build a business that would support his own family. With the help of his father, he started his own clothing-sales business and his wife helped him in her spare time. His business has grown little by little but he wants to continue to grow in order to better quality of life. 

Kurbon is asking for a $800 USD loan to buy merchandise for his business so that he can continue to expand it. He is offering to repay the loan in 12 months. He and his family are very grateful for the support you are providing to help them get ahead. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Bekaa with her husband and their six children. Samira has owned a chicken's snack shop for four years. Samira requested a loan of $1500 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase soft drinks and other merchandise for her snack shop. This is her third cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her snack shop and her financiA. situation. Her clients can be anyone from her region. She decided on doing this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and other merchandise for a snack shop

loans.name: Siliua

texts.en:
Siliua K. F., 39, is married with five children. She has four years of experience in her elei design business (a style of cloth printing which is unique to Samoa and is used in much of Samoan clothing). She sells to the village community and to the general public two days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (approximately $80).

Siliua has six previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase elei board, colour paints, material and a sewing machine

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es madre soltera, en su casa sólo vive con su pequeño de 3 años, quien es su mayor tesoro y por quien se esfuerza trabajando. Desde que tuvo su pequeño hijo, se dedicó a múltiples actividades, ya que su pareja la abandonó cuando quedó embarazada, pero a pesar de las circunstancias sigue trabajando para ofrecer a su hijo las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Frente a esta necesidad se inició en el negocio de la venta de productos medicinales, ya que obtiene buenos ingresos por su alto costo de venta y la gran demanda que hay de estos productos debido a su efectividad, lo cual la favorece. Sin embargo, Carmen tiene otros ingresos mediante su servicio como cocinera, los fines de semana se instala en la puerta de su casa para ofrecer deliciosos platillos a sus vecinos y visitantes, quienes la están motivando en instalar un restaurante en su casa, y con mucho esfuerzo y ahorros de sus dos actividades podrá realizarlo en algunos meses. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, junto a las personas que conforman su banco comunal, se ordenan para no tener inconvenientes en la administración del dinero. Los 1200 soles que solicita están destinados en la compra de estas medicinas al por mayor, ya que así tiene la posibilidad de tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a single mother and lives with her little 3-year-old, who is her greatest treasure and for whom she works very hard. Since having her young son, she has worked multiple jobs as her partner left her during her pregnancy. In spite of her circumstances she has continued working in order to provide her son with the necessary conditions he needs to grow. Out of necessity she began the business of selling medicine. Their prices and the high demand for them due to their effectiveness have helped her make solid earnings. Nonetheless, Carmen earns other income working as a cook; on the weekends she sets up shop in the doorway of her house to offer delicious meals to her neighbors and visitors, who have been encouraging her to establish a restaurant in her house. With much effort and savings from her two jobs she will be able to accomplish this in a few months. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP, along with the other members of her loan group who have ordered themselves to avoid inconveniences in distributing loan money. The 1200-sole loan will be used to buy medicines wholesale, so that Carmen can maximize her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicines in order to increase merchandise

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has sold breakfast food in the Kola neighborhood of Morogoro for four years. She belongs to the Mzabibu loan group (group code 2015/07). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $125. Every day, she works at her business for four hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more breakfast food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatuma is 40 years old. She is separated from her husband and has four children, ages 20, 15, 12, and 10.

loans.use: To buy more breakfast food items to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres progresando
Gladys  es conviviente, tiene 47 años tiene  3 hijos de 20, 18 y 15 años él ultimo esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Gladis empezó su negocio con un pequeño capital y luego con finca aumento su capital, ella trabaja en una cafetería en un colegio vende Sándwich de 7am hasta  3 de la  tarde, después se va a trabajar a un mercado allí tiene un puesto de bazar  y zapatería, gracias a Finca a podido  lograr muchas cosas  
Desde que Gladys esta en Finca se siente muy respaldada por el apoyo que le brinda a través de los prestamos por que ha crecido en el negocio.  
Gladys  necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles para surtir su bazar, librería-mercería zapatería.
El sueño de Gladis es tener unos carros para dar  servicio de taxi
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Progresando.” She lives with her partner, is 47 years old, and has three children ages: 20, 18, and 15. Her youngest is a student in the state school. Gladys started her business with a just a little bit of capital and increased the amount with Finca's help. She works in a high school cafeteria selling sandwiches from 7:00 am until three in the afternoon. She then works in a market where she has a variety and shoe store. She has been able to achieve much with Finca’s support. Since Gladys has been with Finca, she has felt supported by the loans they give her and has grown her business. She needs a loan of 1,400 soles to stock her combination variety-book-shoe store. Gladys dreams of having some cars to start a taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: surtir su bazar, librería-mercería zapatería

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es: Ana Josefa F. reside en Cuscatancingo ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive solamente con una nieta. Ana posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa donde vende productos básicos de consumo, Ana solicita este crédito por que le hace falta muchos productos para su tienda ya que posee un poco inventario, con este crédito Ana pretende surtir su negocio así lograra aumentar sus ventas por que todos sus clientes encontraran lo buscan en la tienda de Ana, cabe mencionar que Ana ya ha obtenido cuatro créditos anteriormente de los cuales todo han sido cancelados siendo fue muy responsable en todas sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Ana Josefa F. lives in Cuscatancingo, which is in the department San Salvador. She lives alone except for a granddaughter. Ana runs a small store out of her house, selling basic necessities. Ana is requesting this loan because many products are missing from her store since she has a small inventory. With this loan Ana hopes to stock her store, which will win her increased sales since all her customers will find what they are looking for in her store. It is worth mentioning that Ana has already had four loans prior to this, all of which have been payed off very responsibly in all their installments.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her store

loans.name: Bingwa Njiapanda Group

texts.en:
Dorisi is a member of the Bingwa-Njiapanda borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 35-year-old woman, single, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are ages 14 and 8. She also cares for 3 other dependents. 

Dorisi started her own restaurant business selling food 2 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Dorisi’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities like wheat and rice. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Dorisi hopes to save money, get more food for her family, and expand her business. 

Anjelina, another member of the Bingwa-Njiapanda borrower group, has also requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and wheat

loans.name: Delina

texts.en:
Delina is 24 years old and has two young children. She is a single parent. She has a business selling cooked foods from her home in the evenings.

Delina has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Dalinas II”. She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in candies for sale.

Since she began receiving loans from Manuela Ramos, Delina has worked independently. She has expanded her business ventures quite a bit since her first loan. Delina plans to invest this loan of 1,000 soles in her little restaurant business: she will purchase basic food items such as sugar, oil and rice.

As a single parent Delina must work very hard to support her two children. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for making it easy for her to get a loan. Delina’s goal is to eventually have a large, well-stocked general store. She also wants to ensure that her children get a good education.

loans.use: To purchase basic food items for her restaurant

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto Velazque, es casado, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad estudiando la primaria, labora en la Alcaldia municipal de Nueva Guinea como responsable territorial desde hace 6 años, vive en la zona # 7 de este municipio, esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su segundo crèdito para realizar mejora de vivienda poniendole la ceramica a su casa de habitaciòn y de esta menera tener mejor calidad de vida de su familia, fue recomendado por un excelente cliente de AFODENIC con sus ingreso puede asumir sus cuotas mensueles, en tiempo y forma, espera ser beneficado con el fondo KIVA para poder finalizar la mejora de su vivienda de esta manera, poder brindarle mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.

loans.use: Poner la ceramica a su casa

loans.name: Rosario Emperatriz

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza con mucha alegría, ya que le proporciona los ingresos necesarios para brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Ella incursionó en este negocio porque es una actividad que le permite tener libertad en cuanto a su tiempo, ya que puede disponer de él según le convenga y tener momentos con su familia. Rosario se toma muy enserio su trabajo, ya que sabe que si le pone mucho empeño logrará salir adelante y logrará cumplir sus sueños. Ella quiere para el futuro tener un local en su propia casa donde pueda implementar un bazar, para ofrecer otros artículos aparte de sus cosméticos.
Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, ella es muy puntual en todos sus pagos, al igual que el resto de su grupo, con el cual se lleva muy bien. Con el dinero solicitado comprará productos cosméticos en oferta para venderlos a su precio real y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosario is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and children in her own house. For the past 15 years she has dedicated herself to the sale of beauty products, which she does with much joy given that it provides her the necessary income to give her family a good quality of life. She got into this business because it provides freedom with her time, given that she can use it in a way that is convenient to her and that allows her to spend time with her family. Rosario takes her work seriously because she knows that if she works hard she will be able to get ahead in life and accomplish her dreams. In the future she would like to set up a bazaar like locale in her own house, so that she can offer other products besides her cosmetics. This is her sixth loan with MFP; she is very punctual in all her payments, as is the rest of her group, with whom she gets along with well. With the money that she is requesting she will purchase cosmetics products on sale, to sell them at the real market price and obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise (cosmetics products).

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia V. is from the village of Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Lydia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a mini grocery store which her daily customers are her neighbors. She has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2006, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Lydia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
Harriet K. is 42 years old and married with seven children, all still in school. She helps take care of two orphans. She is a friendly, determined and hardworking lady who has had a business selling firewood in Buramba for eight years. Before this business, Harriet was selling matooke (steamed green plantain). She changed because of limited competition in this current business. 

She sells mostly to schools and homes. She had many customers because of her friendly nature and because the use of loans helps her to have stock all the time. She hopes to open up another store in the main town so that she could make more sales. Harriet needs a loan to help buy more firewood for resale.

loans.use: Buying more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Gen Tic Women’S Group Atim Joyce

texts.en:
A. Joyce is twenty-three years old, married, and blessed with four children of whom two are going to school. She is also caring for five dependents, all schooling, too.

Joyce runs a stationery business and she has been doing this business for over five months. She is requesting the loan to purchase stationery items such as books, pens, files, papers, etc., to sell. She wants to improve upon her business at least for more profits.

Joyce is a hardworking business lady and her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase stationery items such as books, pens, files, papers, etc.

loans.name: Agatuna

texts.en: Agatuna D. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Agatuna owns and operates a business planting and harvesting cassava for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Agatuna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Agatuna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Nkodo 2 Nakalema Loyce Group

texts.en:
N. Loyce is thirty-five years old and her loan group representative. She is married and has eight children who are all in school. 

Loyce has been selling goats for three years. She is using her loan to purchase goats from remote villages and bring them to Ntungamo town to sell. Because she has less capital, she is topping-up to purchase at least ten goats. She is a very creative businesswoman whose dream is to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase goats to sell

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana A. is married and has five dependents. She has received junior high education. Joana sells cement and other building materials and bags of  mineral water and so on at Teterem near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2005. Her husband is a trader. Joana uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Joana will use the loan to purchase more building materials including cement for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joana plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials including cement for sale

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús R. A. de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a esposo y tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual es de mucha ayuda para su familia, esto debido a que el sueldo de su esposo no da abasto con todos los gastos del hogar. Teresa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con la capacidad de poder comprar granos básicos, verduras, pan. Golosinas y otros productos más los cuales son muy solicitados en el negocio. Ella alberga la esperanza de que este sea un año diferente en el cual pueda mejorar sus ganancias y de esta manera poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús R. A., 43, lives in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and their three young children, all of whom are in school. Teresa has a food store, which helps the family, as her husband’s income is not enough to cover all the household expenses. Teresa is seeking a loan to buy grains, vegetables, bread, candy, and other products, which are popular in the store. She hopes that this year she can increase her earnings and be able to offer everything necessary to her children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains, vegetables, bread, and candy for store.

loans.name: Ceila

texts.en:
Mrs. Ceila S. is from Miligan, Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 30 years old and married with four children. She operates a hog-raising business to generate income that can satisfy their daily needs. She has been engaged in this business for almost three years, earning approximately $125 a month.

Ceila joined PMPC to gain access to financial support to improve her living situation and her ability to be engaged in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase a new breeder hog. Now she is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use this money to expand her business and to own a barber shop as well.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for hog raising and to start a barbershop business

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 66 años de edad es separada y tiene 3 hijos ya independizados. Vive junto a un nieto de 12 años en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Irene ha trabajado durante mas de 25 años vendiendo verduras y abarrotes en el mercado de la ciudad de Cayaltí. Actualmente ha dejado encargado su negocio a una de sus hijas ya que, debido a su avanzada edad, ya no puede distinguir las monedas. Aún así todas las mañanas se dirige al mercado a ayudar a su hija en la venta y atención del establecimiento. Este negocio le provee los ingresos suficientes para mantenerse.

Las lluvias que se han presentado en la zona han hecho que las paredes de su casa queden debilitadas, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la adquisición de material para reforzar sus paredes.

Irene es una mujer reponsable, trabajadora y activa. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una buena persona que siempre esta dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Irene is 66 years old. She is separated and has three adult children. She lives with her 12-year old grandson in the district of Cayaltí, which is about an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Irene has worked for more than 25 years selling vegetables and groceries in the market in the city of Cayaltí. She has left one of her daughters in charge of her business because due to her old age she cannot distinguish which coins are coins. Despite this, every morning she goes to the market to help her daughter care for the business. This business provides her with the income necessary to maintain herself. The heavy rains that have fallen in the region have made the walls of her house unstable, so she has applied for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 nuevos soles, which she will use for material to reinforce her walls. Irene is a responsible, hard-working, and active. Her neighbors and friends hold her in high esteem and consider her to be a good person who is always available to help when it is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to rebuild walls of a home

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 61 and has a shop for repairs and vulcanizing. This is the only way she can provide for the needs of her family and send her children to school. She is the mother of five children. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to have additional capital to run her business. This loan will help her a lot in sustaining her family.

loans.use: Repair supplies

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom T. is 40 years old, married, and lives in the village of Moeang Prachen in Takeo province. Her husband is on the right in the picture. She and her husband are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although they try to work hard with their farming, they still earn too little to support their family adequately. 

Thus, Mrs. Sreymom T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. This couple has four children, who all are students, and they also support their parents' business.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka E. is currently in the business of selling local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell.  Maka is 36 years old. Her husband is a teacher. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CATALINA ES UNA CLIENTE QUE YA TRABAJO  DOS SECUENCIAS CON LA INSITUTCION EN LOS DOS ANTERIORES CREDITO DEMOSTRO RESPONSABILIDAD YA QUE NO TUBO NINGUN PROBLEMA CON EL PAGO DE SUS CUOTAS, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA DE BEBE, PAÑALES Y COLGADORES, SU PUESTO ESTA UBICADO EN LA  ZONA 16 DE JULIO LA FERIA MAS POPULOSA DEL ALTO DONDE ENCUENTRAS TODO TIPO DE MERCADERIA , ELLA VENDE TODOS LOS DIAS SU PUESTO ES MAS LLENO LOS DIAS JUEVES Y DOMINGO QUE ES LA FERIA DE LA 16 DE JULIO, ESOS DIAS LA VENTA ES MAYOR,  TAMBIEN VENDE ROPA PARA NIÑOS, LA SEÑORA TIENE DOS NIÑOS PEQUEÑOS QUE ESTAN EN COLEGIO, SU ESPOSO SE LLAMA MILTON  Y SE DEDICA A LA SUPERVISION EN LA EMPRESA SUMA PACHA, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA DE BEBE Y NIÑOS POR MAYOR, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Catalina is a client who has already participated in two loan cylces with Kiva field partner Emprender. With the prior two loans, she demonstrated responsibility by never having a problem making loan payments. Catalina sells baby apparel, diapers and clothing hangers. Her stall is located in the 16 de Julio street market, the most populous of all, where you can find any and all types of merchandise for sale. She is open every day. Her shop is busiest Thursdays and Sundays, the days when the market is busiest. She also sells childern's clothing. Catalina has two young children who are in school. Her husband Milton is a supervisor for the Suma Pacha Company. The loan will be largely invested in the purchase of clothing for infants and children. Catlin is very grateful to Kiva and partner Emprender for the confidence she has received by being granted this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie B. is from the village of Bongbongon, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Elsie is single. To make a living, Elsie operates a family member's business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina A. is from the village of Lullutan. She is 48 years old. Cristina is the leader of a 6-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cristina A. Group.

Cristina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Cristina's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy S. is from the village of Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old, married and has 6 children. To make a living, Nancy owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Nancy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nancy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhin Kranh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who live in Chheu Teal village in Takeo province selected Mrs. Sokhin K. as village bank president. They all will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living.

Mrs. Sokhin K. works at home as a weaver to earn money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. She is seeking a loan to buy more silk.

Her husband, Mr. Gnoem Gnel, is a laborer. She is a mother of three children who are all enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase perfumes, creams, lotions, shampoos

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn C., 53, is married and resides with his three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment industry. He grows mango trees for an income of USD 3 per day. His wife produces meatballs, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more meat to produce more meatballs for sale. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s wife appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Tobuy more meat to produce meatballs to sell

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: S., 36, is a villager living in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is applying for a loan to increase her stock of grocery items to sell, and the remaining cash from the loan she will mend her old house. S. currently sells some products to neighbors in the village and she generates a daily income of $2.50. S. is married to Mr. Ya, 48, who helps support the family by driving a motor taxi. The couple lives with two teenage children who attend school. They hope the loan will help them attain a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To increase her stock of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es: Wilberto tiene 45 años de edad, al igual que su esposa Agustina, juntos lograron tener su propia casa a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, además tienen dos hijas que están al cuidado de ellos. Hace más de 6 años, que se dedica en la venta de ropa, negocio en el que su esposa la ayuda. Su forma de trabajo consiste en viajar a provincias para adquirir prendas novedosas y de buena calidad, de esa manera logra vender su mercadería. Con el tiempo han logrado la confianza del cliente y ahora son muy conocidos, no solo por la variedad de prendas que ofrece sino por  los precios cómodos en que pueden adquirir. En un futuro quieren tener un gran puesto en algún mercado muy concurrido donde pueda ofrecer su mercadería y así llevar mejores ingresos a su hogar. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere viajar a provincias para adquirir mayor cantidad de prendas y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Wilberto and his wife, Agustina, both 45, succeeded in owning their own house after much effort and sacrifice. They have two daughters, both still in their care. With his wife's help, Wilberto has operated a business selling clothing for 6 years. He travels around looking for original clothing items, of good quality, to stock his business and resell. Over time, he has managed to gain the trust of his customers and he is now well known both for the affordable cost of his clothing and for the variety of items he can sell. In the future, he wants to have a large stall at some well-trafficked market where he can sell his merchandise and, in turn, improve his family's income. This is Wilberto's first MFP loan and he is committed to repaying it on time. He will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of clothing for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Keak's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Keak P., age 42, was selected as village bank president by the members of this village loan. They are all located in Ta Nu village, Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.
     
Mrs. Keak P. is a grocery seller in the local village, while her husband, Mr. Sboang Rithy, 42, works as a police officer. With both of their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support the family. In order to increase their income to improve the family's living, and in order to expand the grocery business, Mrs. Keak P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. This couple has five children: three are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the other two are 5 and 1 and are not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cotton and cloth

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married with two grown children. He is a businessman from Uzhgorod selling used clothing. He owns two kiosks at one of the local markets called ‘RIO’ and has a loyal clientele. His merchandise is always varied and in demand. He makes about 5,000 Grivnyas net profit a month.    

Igor has been running his used-clothing sales business for 12 years  He is requesting a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to increase his turnover capital. He has gained an impeccable reputation among his fellow market vendors as a financially reliable and prudent entrepreneur, and plans to continue expanding his trade and improving his living standard in the process.

loans.use: to increase his capital

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela A. is a married woman who lives in Luyong Baybay, Brgy. Tacup, San Remegio, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fishing and fish vending. Her husband, Felix A., who is 53 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are aged between 23 and 28.
Estela joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Estela has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 11,200 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing 14,500 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase a fishing net so that she is able to continue to save up for the future education of her granddaughter and for house repair.
Estela A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Taraiya Ole

texts.en:
Taraiya has practiced farming in Naivasha town since the year 2005 and receives good returns from his agricultural activity.  He is 38 years old, married to Margaret Nchoi, and they have three  children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 25,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the cash from this loan to buy pesticides and weed control, to spray on his farm.

In future, Taraiya hopes to own his own farming equipment instead of having to hire it every time he wants to plant or harvest.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and weed control

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Сайидмуродова Саида проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж имеет хлебопекарню, где печет хлеб (лепешка). Сама Саида занимается торговлей на рынке "Дехкон". Она арендует торговую точку, где продает национальный хлеб (лепешка). Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Saida S. lives in Tursunzoda. She is 45 years old, married with two children. Her husband owns a bakery where he bakes traditional "Lepyoshka" bread. Saida rents out a trading spot at the local "Dakhkon" market where she has sold "Lepyoshkas" for over 10 years. She is applying for a loan to increase sales.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Mrs. Chann S., age 42, is a widowed village woman. Her husband died many years ago, leaving her with one child. She currently lives with her niece who works as a laborer.  Mrs. Chann S. currently generates an income of approximately $2.5 per day by selling Khmer cake. Besides this business, Mrs. Chann S. is a farmer. She has owned and operated her farm to cultivate a rice crop at least twice a year, by following both rainy and dry seasons. Growing crops is an annual action in which she has had great success. This rice harvesting season, Mrs. Chann S. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice

loans.name: Segundo Alfonso

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Los Andes.

En este lugar encontramos a don Segundo el tiene 32 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 6 años de edad que estudian en colegio y en escuela. El es nacido en la ciudad de Riobamba pero hace varios años se vino a vivir a esta linda ciudad. Su esposa es comerciante.
 
Se dedica al comercio, vende frutas más que todo frutas de la sierra como: manzanas, uvas, peras, duraznos, entre otras ricas frutas de esta parte del país. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 am hasta las 18h00 el trabaja solo, ya que su esposa también tiene otro negocio igual. Las frutas las traen desde una distribuidora mayorista en Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas  como: manzanas, uvas, peras, duraznos, entre otras frutas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es tener una gran tienda.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Los Andes' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo which has been known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 32 year-old Segundo.  He is married and has 4 children aged 16, 14, 12 and 6 who are studying in high school and elementary school.  Segundo was born in the city of Riobamba but he came to live in this beautiful city several years ago.  His wife is a saleswoman.

Segundo sells fruit, particularly fruit from the mountains such as apples, grapes, pears and peaches, as well as other delicious fruits from this part of the country.  He works every day from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  He works alone since his wife has another business the same.  He gets his fruit from a wholesale supplier in Guayaquil.

Segundo will use this loan to buy fruits such as apples, grapes, pears, peaches, etc.  He has been a member of his community bank from the beginning and he likes it because the interest rates are low.  His dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: To buy apples, grapes, pears, peaches, etc.

loans.name: Iris Agustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Iris Agustina; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza,ella vende lápiz labiales,perfumes,lápiz para ojos entre otros,ella vende en forma indepedniente llevando a diferentes instituciones. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Buena Esperanza” , located in Cusco district that is part of Cusco province, in Cusco department.
She is Iris Agustina, 47, married and she has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling beauty products.  She sells lipsticks, perfumes, eye liners, etc. on her own, and she takes them to different businesses.  Agustina is requesting a loan to buy the products wholesale.
The member is happy with the loan and she promises to make all the payments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy beauty products wholesale

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, who is from Bethlehem, owns a car engine repair workshop located in the the industrial area of Bethlehem, which attracts a good number of customers. George is one of FATEN's reliable clients. He took his second loan from FATEN to purchase an engine repair machine to replace his old one. George is the father of one daughter and two sons, who are all students.

loans.use: to purchase an engine repair machine

loans.name: Marvin Benigno

texts.es: El señor Marvin es casado tiene tres hijos y labora como conductor, en una Universidad, este crédito lo solicita para pago de gastos médicos de su hijo el cual lo tiene hospitalizado y va ser intervenido quirúrgicamente.
texts.en: Marvin is married and he has three children. He is a driver for a university. He requests a loan to pay the medical expenses for his son who is hospitalized and requires surgery.

loans.use: To pay for health care expenses for his young son.

loans.name: Nudjiratou

texts.fr: Madame Nudjiratou est âgée de 35 ans et  mère de 6 enfants.   Elle  est née à Sokodé  et habite Kégué.  Elle a reçu de WAGES un  crédit qu’elle a déjà remboursé. Elle fait le commerce d’igname en gros et en détail et Banane.  Elle  a  commencé en 1987 cette activité et revend  ces marchandises au marché de hedzranawoe.  Elle sollicite un prêt  pour acheter  10 tas d’igname.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nudjiratou is 35 years old and the mother of six children. She was born in Sokodé and now lives in Kégué. 

She received a previous loan from WAGES which she fully repaid. She sells yams (wholesale and retail) and bananas at the Hédzranawoé market.  She started this activity in 1987. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase 10 heaps of yams.

loans.use: Purchase of yams

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr. O., es una persona mayor de edad, casado convive con su Familia den la comarca la Palma San Lorenzo, Tecolostote, se dedica a la actividad de la Pezca artesanal de donde obtiene sus ingresos para el sustento diario de su adorada Familia, es una persona responsable.  

Solicita su primer credito con el apoyo de Kiva, para invertirlo en Mejora de su vivienda ya que pretende construir una parte de concreto, por lo que actualmente es de madera, y asi poco a poco ir mejorando la infraestructura de su casa; siendo esta el patrimonio que heredara a sus hijos. 
Su mauor sueño es llegar a realizar su casa con todas las mejoras y que no le falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Mr. O. is an adult who is married and lives with his family in the Palma San Lorenzo region near Tecolostote.  He works fishing in the traditional way which is where he gets the income he uses for the daily expenses of the family he loves.  He is a responsible person.

He is requesting his first loan with the support of Kiva to invest it in improving his home as he would like to build a part with concrete where now it is made from wood.  In this way he can improve the infrastructure of his house little by little as this is the inheritance that his children will receive.

His biggest dreams are to complete his house with all of the improvements and that they never lack for their daily bread.

loans.use: to repair a part of his house by changing it from wood to concrete.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela Maria tiene 55 años, vive en casa propia la cual está ubicada en un el barrio la concepción. Ella tiene un negocio que es la venta de medicamentos naturales pues también las distribuye en diferentes tiendas que le solicitan este producto.  Realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 15 años en su domicilio. Vende sus productos al contado y al crédito, ella está muy contenta por tener un medio de vida. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de vitaminas, hierbas y una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en: Ángela Maria is 55 and owns her own home in the district of la Concepción. She runs her own business selling natural medicines, and also distributes them in different stores that carry such products.  She has maintained this business over the past 15 years out of her home. She accept both cash and credit from her customers, and is pleased to have a stable income.  Angela Maria seeks a loan to increase her inventory of vitamins, herbs and a variety of other products to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy inventory of vitamins, herbs and other natural products

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar S. is from the village of Lintugop, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 47 years old. Edgar is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Edgar owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling bamboo mats & mattresses to tourists and local community members. Edgar has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Edgar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgar is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials like bamboo. This will be the first loan taken out by Edgar from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials like bamboo.

loans.name: Ork

texts.en:
Ork S. is married to a fisherman. They have seven children; five are married and live away from home and the other two are single; one works as a seamstress and the other, a fisherman.

Ork is skilled in weaving palm leaves by hand and has done so since she was a small girl. She has turned leaves into furniture and roofing material to sell from her home for years.

In addition to weaving, Ork annually plants rice. Dry weather is coming now, and it may affect Ork’s business. She faces a difficult season if she can’t irrigate her crops. Ork is taking out her first loan to purchase a pump to water her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to water her crops

loans.name: Mujeres Del Exito Group

texts.es:
Doña Maria Ines C. G., es casada, tiene 31 años de edad, cursó el tercer año de educación secundaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian primaria y secundaria, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a vender artículos de consumo diario en una tienda, lleva ya 8 años con el negocio de tienda, inició gracias al apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a la herrería y el comercio.

Quiere ampliar su negocio, por esa razón acude a ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar mas mercaderia y tener más productos en la tienda que tiene, tales como: flijoles en lata, gaseosas en lata y botella, golosinas, jugos, azucar, etc. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la venta de tortillas, venta de refacciones, helados, cosméticos, venta de calzado y a la confección de faldas y blusas. Desean ver su negocio grande y con  capital amplio.
texts.en:
Maria Ines C. G. is married and is 31 years old.  She has a middle school education, and has 4 children who are in elementary and middle school.  Maria takes care of the household chores and also has a store where she sells everyday consumer goods.  She has had this business for 8 years; she started it with the help of her husband, who works as a blacksmith and a merchant.

She wants to expand her business, and for this reason she came to ASDIR to request a loan that she will use to buy more merchandise and have more products in her store, such as: canned beans, soft drinks in cans and bottles, candy, juice, sugar, etc.  The other members of the group have businesses selling tortillas, vehicle parts, ice cream, cosmetics, and shoes, and some members work making skirts and blouses.  They want to see their businesses grow and have more capital.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en:
Rahimjon is a hardworking husband and the father of four children. He works in a small restaurant which serves all sorts of food. He likes his work and stands out in it due to his attention to detail, the cleanliness of his establishment, the quality of his work and his friendliness. Since 1974 he has been running this business and has a lot of experience. He started his business cooking the national dish of sambusa (meat in dough). Today he rents a place at the market of “Sakhovat” in the central park. He wants to cooperate with Imon International as he would like to extend around his house to be able to cook there and attract more clients. For this purpose, he has requested a loan. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To extend around his house to expand his business

loans.name: Gertrudis Patricia

texts.es:
Gertrudis, es originaria de León ,tiene 40 años de edad , es madre de 4 hijos  de 18,16,12 y 4 años de edad , ella es comerciante , se dedica a vender tortilla y frijoles .Ella inicio a los 35 años de edad pues con contaba con muchas opciones de trabajo y tenia 4 hijos a quienes mantener ,ya que no aprendió ninguna carrera solo llego hasta sexto grado de primaria pues sus padres no tenían como pagar sus estudios. En vista de la necesidad que había fue que se puso a hacer tortilla y coser frijoles para vender antes trabajaba como domestica pero ya después no siguió por la situación  económica, así ha venido luchando poco a poco por ganarse la vida y llevar el alimento diario a sus hijos. Su hija mayor después de la escuela la ayuda a elaborar tortillas.
Ella solicito el préstamo para  comprar materia prima para trabajar como maíz y leña. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir mas material de trabajo para producir mas, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Tiene como meta próxima hacerles mejoras de infraestructura a su negocio pues realmente las necesita.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is a native of León. She is 40 years old and the mother of four children (ages 18, 16, 12, and 4). Gertrudis is a merchant who sells tortillas and beans. She started this business when she was 35 since she had many options to work and four children to support. Gertrudis does not have a degree and only completed school through the sixth grade because her parents could not pay for her studies.

As a result of her family’s needs, Gertrudis began preparing tortillas and beans to sell. She previously worked as a housekeeper, but she was not able to continue because of her financial situation. Gertrudis gradually strives to earn a living and provide for the daily needs of her children. Her oldest daughter helps her with preparing tortillas when she comes home from school.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies for her work, such as corn and firewood. With this investment, she will be able to acquire more of the materials she uses in her work so that she can increase production. This will help improve her sales and generate more income.
