Her next goal is to make needed improvements to the infrastructure of her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood.

loans.name: Wilson Javier

texts.es:
Wilson de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en la casa de sus suegros, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Reque que se encuentra a unos minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona desarrolla  la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

El servicio que brinda Wilson es el alquiler de equipos de sonido, para todo tipo de eventos, en la zona donde vive. Cuenta con su propia clientela, por ser conocido y brindar un buen servicio, sus contratos para alquiler de música han aumentado, por eso a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de más equipos para implementar su negocio y seguir brindando un buen servicio. Con los ingresos adquiridos podrá cubrir su crédito y solventar  gastos familiares.

Wilson es una persona muy responsable, de confianza y trabajadora por eso su negocio ha crecido y su anhelo es que más adelante pueda tener un servicio más completo para organizar eventos, para seguir ayudando a su familia a progresar.
texts.en:
Wilson, 27, lives with his wife and children in his in-laws’ house, which has water and electricity, and is located in Reque District a few minutes from Chiclayo Province.  This is a farming and livestock raising area.

The service that Wilson offers is sound equipment rental for all sorts of events in the zone where he lives.  He has his own clientele because he’s known for offering good customer service.  His rental contracts for sound equipment have increased and this is why he’s thought it convenient to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more equipment to supplement his business and continue providing good service.  With the income he will earn he will be able to repay the loan and cover family expenses.

Wilson is a very responsible, trustworthy, hard working person; this is why his business has grown and his dream for later on is to have a more complete service available to organize events and continue helping his family to progress.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de cincuenta y un años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas mayores de edad y que la ayudan en el negocio que posee en su mismo lugar de residencia vendiendo refrescos, además de hacer tortillas que vende a la salida de un supermercado cercano a la periferia de su hogar, también hace reparto de las mismas a la hora del almuerzo a empleados de la zona comercial que rodean la colonia en la que vive. Ya son varios años  que Sonia lleva dedicada a ambas actividades y ha sido con esta fuerza laboral como ha sacado adelante a sus hijas. Todos los días muy temprano ella y sus hijas despiertan, Sonia hace las compras en el mercado cercano a la localidad comprando los materiales necesarios para hacer el refresco, sea de tamarindo, horchata, melón, cebada, entre otros, mientras tanto sus hijas quedan cociendo el maíz que luego llevan a moler para preparar las ricas tortillas. Ahora Sonia ha decidido comprar al por mayor el maíz y azúcar necesarios para preparar sus tortillas y refrescos respectivamente a fín de bajar el costo de sus materias primas y además poder hacer mayor cantidad de ambos productos que a la fecha ya no abastecen suficientemente a sus clientes que la prefieren por su higiene, responsabilidad y amabilidad. Son éstas razones por las que decidió solicitar a INTEGRAL crédito y confiada en que a través de ello obtendrá mayores ganancias y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.-
texts.en: Sonia, 51, lives in her own home with her two grown daughters.  They help Sonia with her business, which is located in the same place as her residence.  She sells drinks and she also makes tortillas that she sells outside of a supermarket that is close to her house.  She also delivers the tortillas at lunchtime to the employees who work in the commercial area that surrounds the neighborhood where she lives.  Sonia has had these businesses for a number of years, and it has been through this hard work that she has managed to provide for her daughters.  Every day Sonia and her daughters get up very early.  Sonia makes her purchases in the market close to her neighborhood, buying the supplies she needs to make the drinks, including ingredients for horchata (a drink made of rice, almonds and cinnamon), tamarind, melon, barley, and other items.  Meanwhile, her daughters stay in the kitchen cooking the corn that they will later take to grind to prepare the delicious tortillas.  Now Sonia has decided to buy the corn and sugar she needs to make her tortillas and drinks at wholesale.  This way she can lower the cost of her ingredients and also have a greater quantity of both products on hand, because at this point her she does not have enough of these products.  Sonia's customers prefer her business because of her hygiene, responsibility and friendliness.  For all of these reasons she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL; she is confident that through this loan she will be able to have greater earnings and  improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and sugar at wholesale.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es: El señor Carmelo es artesano costurero, tiene un taller en la ciudad de El Alto. Carmelo fabrica cortinas y también es especialista en el colocado de parket en los pisos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de tela en diversas texturas y colores para continuar su negocio de fabricación de cortinas. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona 21 de septiembre en  la ciudad de El Alto;  es casado y tiene dos hijos. Carmelo es cliente de Impro desde el año  2010.
texts.en:
Señor Carmelo is an artisanal tailor. He has a workshop in the city of El Alto. Carmelo makes curtains and also specializes in the installation of parquet floors. 

The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of cloth in a variety of textures and colors to continue his curtain making business. 

He lives in his own house located in the 21 de Septiembre neighborhood of the city of El Alto. He is married and has two children. Carmelo has be a client of Impro since 2010.

loans.use: to purchase cloth in a variety of textures and colors to make curtains.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is a married man, 28 years old and humbly lives at Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He has one school-aged child. 

Loreto is a motorcycle driver. That is his means of living. He has been doing this for one year. He earns PHP 8,000 a month by doing this job.

Loreto has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 from GDMPC to buy durable tires, long-lasting motor spare parts and pay for repainting and remodeling. 

Loreto has been a member of GDMPC for two years. He hopes to add a sidecar to his single motorcycle for additional income.

loans.use: to buy durable tires, long-lasting motor spare parts and pay for repainting and remodeling.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 27 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Flordeliza works very hard to provide for them.

Flordeliza runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Flordeliza has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits and snack food. 

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is from the village of Patardzeuli, Kakheri Region, East Georgia. She is 35 years old, married and lives with her big family: her husband, Manuchar, their 10 year old son, 3 year old daughter and her parents. Khatuna’s son goes to school. 

Khatuna and Manuchar lead the agricultural business of the family. They own a poultry farm with 1200 hens. She sells the poultry in Tbilisi (capital city of the country), at an open market, to the poultry retailers. The family also owns a 400 sq meter greenhouse, where cucumbers are grown. Harvested cucumbers are also sold at the same market, to the green grocery retailers. 

Khatuna has requested credit to purchase feed for hens. She will buy quality feed for the farm in order to get good poultry. In the near future, Khatuna plans to reinvest part of the received profit in the development of the poultry farm. This will help to increase the amount of hens in the farm and provide more profit for the well being of her children and the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for hens.

loans.name: Davit

texts.ru:
Давиту 24 года, он живет в городе Иджеване (Ijevan) с женой, родителями и двумя сестрами. Отец Давита работает инженером, а одна из сестер работает в аптеке. Вторая сестра, мать и жена Давита безработные и занимаются домашним хозяйством.
Давит автоэлектрик и в 2007 году он переоборудовал собственный гараж в автомастерскую, где он ремонтирует автомобили и, таким образом, помогает своему отцу содержать их большую семью. Также, благодаря своему бизнесу, Давит приобрел необходимую мебель для своей семьи. 
Давиту необходим кредит на сумму 400,000 драм для частичного ремонта своей автомастерской и для приобретения автозапчастей для своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Davit is 24 years old.  He lives in the city of Ijevan together with his wife, parents and two sisters.  Davit's father works as an engineer, and one of his sisters works at a pharmacy.  His other sister, mother and Davit's wife are unemployed and are involved in household work.  Davit is an auto electrician and converted his own garage into an auto repair shop in 2007, where he repairs cars and, thus, helps his father to support their large family.  Also, thanks to his business, Davit purchased necessary furniture for his family.  Davit needs a loan in the sum of 400,000 dram for a partial repair of his auto repair shop and purchase of auto parts for his business.

loans.use: to partially repair his auto repair shop and to buy auto parts for his business

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 38 years old and has been in farming for 10 years. His farm produces tea (which goes to Kenya Tea Development Authority), as well as milk, maize, and bananas, which he sells to the local market. He is married with three children between 2 and 13 years of age.

Ezekiel has requested a loan of 47,100 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will improve his farming business, the profits of which will help him in educating his children and improve their living standards. He is optimistic with his farming business and focuses on buying more land for farming.

He says fluctuation in rain is a challenge, causing flooding at times and drought at others.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Reyna  Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna, de 32 años de edad, es originaria de San Juan de Limay un pueblo cercano a la  ciudad de Estelí, es viuda, madre de tres hijos, de 13, 3 y 11 años respectivamente, ella es comerciante se  dedica  a la venta y elaboración de muebles. Ella empezó con capital propio cuando tenia 28 años de edad este ha sido su primer negocio del cuando depende ella y sus hijos, esta muy orgullosa pues ha sabido a salir adelante, ha sabido manejar su vida tanto en lo laboral como en lo familiar, pero lo hace por el bienestar de lo mas valioso para ella sus hijos.
Realizo el préstamo para compra materiales tales como pegamento, clavos, madera de uso renovable para elaborar muebles. Esta inversión le ayudara a conseguir, materia prima para trabajar y elaborar mas variedad de muebles, quiere darle mas publicidad a su mueblería, ampliarla mas. Su próxima meta es pagarle los estudios universitarios a sus ella desea que sean unos profesionales con éxito.
texts.en:
Reyna, aged 32, is originally from San Juan de Limay which is a village near to the city of Estelí.  She is widowed, and is the mother of three children aged 13, 3, and 11 years old respectively.  

She works making and selling furniture.  She began with her own capital when she was 28 years old, and it has become her main business on which she and her children depend financially.  She is very proud that she has been able to move ahead in life and has been able to manage both her work and her family life, but she does it all for the well-being of her children who are the most important thing in her life.

She is taking out this loan to purchase materials such as glue, nails, and wood from renewable sources so she can make furniture.  This investment will help her to continue in her business, using the raw materials to make a greater variety of furniture.  She would like to have more publicity for her furniture store, and to expand it further.  Her next goal is to pay for university education for her children, as she wants them to become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as glue, nails, and wood from renewable sources for making furniture.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children.  Alma has a food shop where she sells snacks, like rice & cheese cakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Alma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a simple mother yet hardworking. She is now 40 years old and widowed for almost five years. She did not finished her college education and was engaged into early marriage. Maria Fe was not able to seek for an employment; that is why she only runs a variety store and this what occupies her daily schedule. She had been doing this for almost two years and approximately earns an income of P5,000 each month. 

Maria Fe needs to earn more money to provide a good education for her two children despite being a widow. She has insufficient funds and that is why she is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy distilled water, soft drinks, canned goods, bread, eggs, milk and sugar to sell in her store. These additional items would help increase her sales thus boost her profits. 

In the future, she wants to provide a progressive life-style for her family.

loans.use: to buy distilled water, soft drinks, canned goods, bread, eggs, milk and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Alodoalome 1 Group

texts.fr: ALODOALOME 1 est un groupe composé de huit personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le représentant du groupe du nom de Codjo Alain est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Codjo Alain est âgé de 45 ans et est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Elisabeth. Le couple a sept enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Codjo Alain n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Codjo Alain vend des barres de fer, activité qu’il exerce depuis dix huit ans et qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges familiales et de répondre à ses besoins. Dans l’optique d'élargir leur activité par l'augmentation du stock de leurs produits, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle, Codjo Alain et les autres membres du groupe ALODOALOME 1 sollicitent un quatrième prêt auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit permettra certainement à l’ensemble du groupe d’accroître leur chiffre d’affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en: Alodoalome 1 group is a grouping of eight people who live in the same neighborhood. It is the fourth time that this group has requested a loan from Alidé, in order to increase their business volume and better respond to customer demand. The representative of the group, who is called Codjo Alain, is the one with his hand raised in the photo. Codjo Alain is 45 years old and married to a retailer by the name of Elisabeth. The couple has seven children, all at school and in their care. Codjo Alain did not go to school himself. He sells iron rods and has been doing this for the past eighteen years; this allows him to cover the various family expenses and provide for his own needs. With a view to expanding their business by increasing their stock, so that they can respond better to customer demand, Codjo Alain and the other members of the Alodoalome 1 group are requesting a fourth loan from Alidé. This loan will undoubtedly enable the whole group to increase their turnover and income.

loans.use: to buy iron rods

loans.name: Telma

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio y ella sigue trabajando vendiendo productos de belleza, la socia vende los productos de belleza como labiales, perfumes, cremas y otros por catalos y una ves que le hacen el pedido ella pasa a sus jefes y le envian al cabo de un par de semanas, luego ella los distribuye y espera a que los clientes le cancelen, la socia suele darles en dos partes; La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza en oferta para venderlos mas adelante en otras campañas y esa sera su ganancia.
texts.en: Telma continues administering her business selling beauty products. She sells cosmetics such as lipsticks, perfumes, creams and other items via catalog, and once she receives her orders, she passes them to her bosses, who send the products every couple weeks. She then distributes the products and waits for her customers to pay what they owe. Telma is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of beauty products to sell in future campaigns for profit.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products to later sell.

loans.name: Nuevo Sendero Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Nuevo Sendero” está conformado por 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran preparación de comida rápida, venta de verduras, ropa y artículos de bazar. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.

Marcela integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en segunda fila,ocupa el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, está sonrriendo, además viste una polera color lila y encima tiene puesto un chaleco color beige. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa usada desde hace un año y medio, comenta que desde sus comienzos ha tenido muy buena recepción por parte de sus clientes.
Trabaja de lunes a viernes ofreciendo sus productos puerta a puerta o sus clientes se dirigen a su domicilio.
Mientras que los fines de semana vende, sus productos en ferias libres. 
Con el crédito comprará fardos de ropa para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas, con plazo de dos años son instalarse en un local establecido, de esta manera ofrecer su mercadería de ropa en vitrinas. 
Marcela vive junto a su marido y su hija de 4 años de edad, uno de sus sueños a nivel personal son estudiar la carrera de obstetricia o podología. Para concretar este proyecto se inscribirá y matriculará a comienzos del año 2012. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además comenta del buen trato que ha recibido en la institución. Respecto al grupo del cual forma parte en el Banco comunal, comenta que es muy unido y responsable, por lo que se ha sentido muy cómoda. 
Por su parte las capacitaciones de emprendimiento, le han servido para distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos y también aprender a negociar. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Nuevo Sendero and is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different areas such as the preparation of fast food and the sale of vegetables, clothing and variety items. All are from the city of Chillán.

Marcela is the member of the communal bank who is seen in the photo in the second row, third from the right. She is smiling and wearing a lilac colored shirt with a beige jacket. She has been a merchant, specifically selling used clothing, for a year and a half and says that since she started she has been well received by customers. She works from Monday to Friday selling her wares door to door or her customers come to her home. On weekends she sells her goods at street markets.

With the loan she will buy bundles of clothes for her business. Her goal is to set herself up in an established shop within two years so that she can showcase her clothing in display cases.

Marecela lives with her husband and 4 year old daughter. One of her personal dreams is to study obstetrics or podiatry. In order to make this dream a reality, she will enroll at the beginning of 2012.

She is very pleased and grateful for the opportunity to invest in her business that Fondo Esperanza has provided. As well, she speaks of the good treatment she has received from the association.  With respect to her membership in the communal bank, she notes that the group is very united and responsible and because of this, she has felt very comfortable. The leadership training sessions have helped her to better apportion her income and learn how to do business.  

Chillán is a township in the south central area of Chile. Its name means “silla del sol” (“chair of the sun”) in Mapudungun, the language of our indigenous Mapuches. Chillán is known as “Cuna de la Patria” (“Cradle of the Homeland”) or “Tierra de Artristas” (“Land of Artists”), because many figures prominent in Chilean history were born here, such as for example, the well-known pianist, Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Marylin De Fatima

texts.es: Marylin De Fátima se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 3 años que tiene conocimiento de este negocio. Ella ha logrado obtener una gran experiencia la mayoría de sus clientes saben los diferentes productos que ofrece. El financiamiento que está solicitando recientemente es para la compra de calzado, sabanas, cremas, perfumes, ropa en general, prendas de oro y plata entre otros productos. Ella desea terminar de construir su vivienda, pues es muy necesario para proporcionarle a sus tres hijos un futuro.
texts.en: Marylin De Fátima has sold general merchandise for the more than three years that she has been in this business. She has managed to obtain a lot of experience; the majority of her clients know the different products that she offers. The financing that she has been requesting recently is to buy footwear, sheets, creams, perfumes, general clothing, gold and silver accessories and other products. She wants to finish constructing her home, since it is very important to provide her three children with a future.

loans.use: to buy footwear, sheets, creams, perfumes and clothing.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Мархамат женщина 48 лет, мать двоих детей, которая сама поставила детей на ноги и выдала замуж дочь. Сын работает на рынке охранником, его заработная ежемесячная плата составляет всего 300 сомони, что не хватает ему и матери на жизнь. Поэтому Мархамат работает техничкой в торговом офисе и её зарплата составляет 250 сомони. Но по ежемесячным доходам данной семьи видно, что они не в силах начать ремонт квартиры, поэтому на запрашиваемый кредит Мархамат хочет отремонтировать свою кухню, и каждый месяц со своих доходов своевременно погашать кредит. Она благодарна организации за такую возможность решения её семейных проблем.
texts.en: Marhamat is a 48 year-old woman and a mother of two children, whom she raised on her own and married off her daughter.  Marhamat's son works as a security guard at a market, and his monthly income is only 300 somoni, which is not enough to cover living expenses for himself and his mother.  This is why Marhamat works as a janitor at a sales office, and her income is 250 somoni.  But it is clear from this family's monthly income that the family is unable to start repairs of their apartment, and this is why Marhamat wants to use this loan to make repairs to her kitchen and use her income to gradually repay the loan on a monthly basis.  She is grateful to the organization for this opportunity to solve her family problems.

loans.use: to make repairs to her kitchen

loans.name: Ruby Flor

texts.en:
Ruby Flor is married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ruby Flor is 47 years old and has one child, who is in school.

Ruby Flor has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Ruby Flor has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Delfina has a junk shop that buys & sells recycled materials like plastic bottles, metals & cans. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy recycled materials like plastic bottles & metals.

Delfina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delfina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like plastic bottles & metals.

loans.name: Santos Emilio

texts.es: Don Emilio tiene 59 años de edad, es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene 11 hijos, de los cuales 4 dependen de el y el resto de sus hijos se dedica a la agricultura, el y su familia residen en la  comunidad de las cañitas, departamento de Olancho. Desde hace 38 años don Emilio se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles, actualmente sigue con el negocio y trabaja con sus hijos en la finca de café, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am hasta las 2:00 pm, cuando es temporada de cosecha trabaja durante todo el día ya que el trabajo es abundante. Una de las ventajas que tiene  es que obtiene buenos ingresos del cultivo de café y la desventaja es que en algunas ocasiones el café se le daña por la plaga y la falta de fertilizantes. Don Emilio esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes. Cabe mencionar que con las ganancias obtenidas del prestamo anterior le permitio realizar algunas mejoras  a su vivienda. La  meta de don Emilio es hacer crecer su finca, para así aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar la economía de su hogar. Este es su segundo préstamo en FAMA y ha cumplido puntualmente con el compromiso de sus pagos.
texts.en: Don Emilio is 59 years old. He is married. His wife is a homemaker and they have 11 children, of which 4 are dependent on him. The rest of the children are farmers. He and his family live in the Las Cañitas community in the department of Olancho. For 38 years, Emilio has grown coffee, corn, and beans. Currently he is continuing with the business, and he works with his children on the coffee farm. His work schedule is from 6:00 am until 2:00 pm. During harvest season he works all day, since there is plenty of work. One of the advantages he has is that he obtains good profits from growing coffee. The disadvantage is that sometimes the coffee is damaged by pests and lack of fertilizers. Emilio is asking for the loan in order to buy manure and fertilizers. He will also use the profits from his business to buy wood and improve his house, since he was able to get good earnings from selling the coffee. Emilio's goal is to make his farm grow in order to increase his earnings and improve the finances of his household. This is his second loan with FAMA, and he has been punctual with his loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Thôn 01 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Sen works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Sen is 44 years old and is married with two children.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Sen is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 Thôn 01 Quảng Lưu Group, which consists of four members. 

 This is Sen's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Sen faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Sen hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Latif

texts.en:
Latif is a refugee from the Aghdam region of Azerbaijan. He has three children and is the only person earning a living in the family. He started his business of selling food stuff in 2004 getting first loan in the amount of $400 from Normicro. His second loan was in the amount of $800.

Now Latif is applying for a $1200 loan. He has a good repayment history. He plans to open a counter for selling fruit along his shop, thus developing his business and improving his living condition.

loans.use: Purchasing digital scales, opening new fruit counter

loans.name: Mouga

texts.en: Mouga is a single mother with one child, residing in the village of Laulii where she produces goods for her flea market business. She sells handicrafts (earrings, lavalava printing, tie dye shirts, samoan bags). Mouga’s flea market is one of the best markets at Savalalo, and she works six days a week. She sells more than 20-30 items a day. She requests a loan to buy more fabric which will enable her to produce more handicrafts to sell.

loans.use: 10 rolls of fabric materials

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a married mom with two children. She runs a small business selling plastic dishware and other small items in the central city market. She has been in this business for 10 years. Currently her gross income is about $1,500 and her monthly net profit amounts to $300.

Valentina started as a market vendor selling tea and coffee. However, on her sister’s advice she later changed her business activity and introduced new products in her kiosk – plastic dishware, bags, paper towels, and other small necessities. Today, this business is the only source of income for her family.

Valentina would like to receive a loan of $500 to increase her inventory supply. Income generated from her business will allow her to invest more in her son’s education as well as provide a better living for her family. We believe that Valentina’s consistency and responsibility which have helped her repay 14 previous loans will guarantee the prompt repayment of this current loan.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo lives in a rented house in the zone of Alto San Pedro in the City of La Paz with his wife, Cecilia, and their 3-year-old child. Gonzalo is a member of the police at the lowest rank (public guard in the streets) and provides services in District 1 in the city of La Paz. His wife sells sweets at a kiosk in an elementary school.

When they got married, the Fernandezes left their parents' homes and currently rent a small home that just has one bedroom and a bath.

The credit they are requesting will be for them to acquire an anticretico (a special lease agreement used in Bolivia) which will allow them to improve their quality of life, and at the same time, to start a savings so they can consider the possibility of acquiring their own home in the future. This is their first loan, and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies them to be able to request the loan and honor their credit obligations.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Gonzalo vive en casa alquilada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa, Cecilia y su hijo de 3 años. Gonzalo es miembro de la policía en el grado mas bajo( guardia público en las calles) y presta sus servicios en el distrito 1 de la ciudad de La Paz, en tanto que su esposa vende dulces en un Kiosco de una escuela primaria. Al contraer matrimonio, los esposos Fernández salieron de la casa paterna y actualmente pagan alquileres por una pequeña vivienda que solo tiene una habitación y un baño. El crédito solicitado será para que puedan adquirir un anticretico que les permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida y al mismo tiempo podrán iniciar un ahorro para que en el futuro puedan considerar la posibilidad de adquirir una vivienda propia . Este es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico los califican para poder solicitar el préstamo y honrar sus obligaciones crediticias.

loans.use: To acquire a special lease agreement for housing

loans.name: Thi Kim

texts.vi:
Being an active business woman, D. thi Kim, 37 years old, always captures the need of people in her area. She invested the first loan of $200 in a fruit stand and sell to the people in her district. In 2005, when the local construction project expanded, she and her husband opened a metal company to manufacture conveying belt for sand. Thus, the manual workers can be freed to work in companies that produce construction materials such as pebbles, sand. Actually, her metal company located at Trung Gia state, Soc Son district, Ha Noi, has attracted many customers in the local and neighboring areas. The business has provided stable employment and high compensation for 6 workers each earning $95/month. She is requesting for a loan of $1200 to invest in the metal manufacturing company.

Translated by HienLam, Kiva volunteer.

Là một người phụ nữ năng động trong kinh doanh, chị Đỗ Thị Kim, 37 tuổi, luôn nắm bắt được nhu cầu của người dân trong vùng. Khi được vay số tiền 200 USD ở vòng vốn đầu tiên, chị đầu tư buôn nhiều loại hoa quả tươi để phục vụ cho mọi nhu cầu sinh hoạt của người dân trong thôn, xã. Năm 2005, khi việc xây dựng tại địa phương phát triển, chị đã bàn với chồng vay thêm vốn để mở xưởng cơ khí sản xuất băng chuyền vận tải cát, giải phóng sức lao động thủ công cho những lao động làm thuê cho các chủ kinh doanh cát, sỏi vật liệu xây dựng. Hiện tại xưởng cơ khí của gia đình chị tại xã Trung Giã huyện Sóc Sơn đã thu hút được nhiều khách hàng trong vùng và các địa phương lân cận. Xưởng luôn tạo việc làm ổn định và trả lương cao cho 6 lao động (95USD/tháng cho 1 lao động). Hiện tại chị muốn vay thêm 1200 USD để đầu tư cho xưởng cơ khí.

loans.use: to invest in the metal manufacturing company

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: Rashad (his father is pictured) is a single man who lives in Salyan region, in the Khaladj village. This man has 8 years of experience in farming. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy  vine props.

loans.use: To buy vine props

loans.name: Jameo's Group

texts.en: Jameo, the Group Leader, is married with three children. Her current business is catering. She makes and sells snacks. She wants to buy another refrigerator with the extra profits from the business and eventually diversify her business into a restaurant.

loans.use: To diversify her business into a restaurant

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Madri

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Madri, 64 year old, is a single woman, living without a husband. Ni Nyoman Madri enjoys her living alone and even she still has enthusiasms to enjoy her live. With the loan given, she lives her daily life with farming 2 piglets. This is the only activity and the only source of income for her. Ni Nyoman Madri only finished her primary school and up to now she's still living with her family as she's not married. These piglets will be sold in 5 months and she can get a net proceed of IDR 600 thousand (approx of USD 63). She already has the buyer who will buy her piglets. With the future loan, she wants to purchase another 2 piglets and to build a bamboo hut for her piglets.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Madri adalah seorang wanita yang hidup tanpa suami, hanya seorang diri sampai usianya yang sekarang ini, 64 tahun. Ni Nyoman Madri sangat menikmati kesendiriannya. Bahkan semangat dalam dirinya untuk berusaha tetap berkobar. Dengan pinjaman yang diberikan, Ni Nyoman Madri mengisi keseharian dengan memelihara 2 bibit babi penggemukan. Hanya usaha inilah yang bisa ditekuninya, karena Ni Nyoman Madri hanya tamat SD. Ni Nyoman Madri masih tinggal dengan keluarganya karena Ni Nyoman Madri belum menikah. Babi yang dipeliharanya ini dipanen dalam 5 bulan dan mendapat keuntungan Rp.600.000,- bersih. Ni Nyoman Mandri sudah mempunyai pelanggan yang datang untuk membeli babinya. Keuntungan ini sangat menunjang dan membantu keluarga yang sekarang bersamanya. Kedepannya, dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya Ni Nyoman Madri ingin menambah bibit babi lagi 2 ekor dan memperbaiki kandang bambunya.

loans.use: To buy piglets and to build pig hut (Membeli bibit babi dan membuat kandang)

loans.name: Chamroen

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamroen T. and her husband, Novary YAB, married in 1978. They have six children: three sons and three daughters. One of the daughters has married; their eldest son is a teacher, the second son is a blacksmith, and the other three children are in school.

Mrs. Chamroen has been selling meals for fifteen years. Her husband has been a teacher for twenty-eight years. Their house is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chamroen is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1200 to purchase blacksmith's materials for her son’s business.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith's materials

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon H. is 31 years of age and her husband, Son Eng, is 37. They live in Thmor Kor, a more remote district of Kampong Cham province, with their young six children. She makes 2.50 USD per day growing lotus and morning glory flowers to sell at the local market. He also farms vegetables and works part-time as a fisherman, earning 2.50 USD daily.

Ms. H.'s loan will be used to purchase a plot of farmland upon which she and her husband can plant more vegetables, and thereby increase their family income.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Consolatha's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Consolatha is 27 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 11 and 7 years old. Consolatha sells clothes and soap, and she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga, a cultural favorite) and soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Magreth, Rehema and Yusta, who have businesses dealing in general store, clothes & charcoal sales, and market materials sales.

loans.use: To buy clothes (khanga) and soap for her business.

loans.name: Khean

texts.en:
Khean C. sells vegetables in her village market in the Taing Kor Thmey Village, Battambang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Sorm Ty, is a motor-taxi driver with an average income of $4 per day. C. has one child who is young and attends school.

C. is seeking a loan to expand her growing vegetable business and to buy small pigs to breed. She said this loan can help to increase her family’s income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her growing vegetable business and to buy small pigs to breed

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzo L. was born June 2, 1985 in Lomé. She is married to Mr. Simone Yibo who is an auto electrician and who therefore has sporadic income. Mrs. L. has two children and contributes to her household’s expenses. She is a hairdresser and has opened a hair salon called “Coiffure Confidence” in the Lomé suburb of Adidogomé. This is her first loan and she is requesting it so she can buy 5 boxes of hair coloring caps, 8 hair weaves, and some hair relaxer.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Madame L. Adzo est née le 02 juin 1985 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur YIBO Simone qui est un électricien Auto donc a un revenu irrégulier. Elle a deux enfants et contribue aux dépenses de sa famille. Elle est coiffeuse et a ouvert un salon de coiffure « COIFFURE CONFIDENCE » dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Elle sollicite pour la première fois ce prêt pour acheter 5 cartons de mèches, 8 tissages et de défrisant.

loans.use: Purchase of hair coloring caps and hair weaves

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is 41 years old; some time ago she separated from her spouse and now bears the responsibility of her three children alone.

She is a farmer, dedicated to the growing of plantains, an activity that she has been accomplishing for more than 25 years, since she was very young. Her parents were farmers and they taught her the tools of the trade. This is the only way that she makes a living, therefore she spends most of her day on the fields, without neglecting her home. The growing of plantains is gratifying, for the profits that it brings and also for the contact with nature, which brings her a lot of joy. The most difficult part is to maintain her soil productive, due to the high prices of fertilizers. Her three children help her by giving her a reason for which to improve and grow day by day.

She needs to invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of fertilizer for her fields which will enable her to increase her production and sales in the next harvest. Little by little she can reach her goal of having a big store of fruit where she can buy and sell in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Paulina tiene 41 años, hace un tiempo atrás se separó de su pareja, y ahora lleva sola la responsabilidad de sus tres hijos.

Es agricultora, se dedica al cultivo de plátano, actividad que realiza por más de 25 años, desde que era muy joven, ya que sus padres eran agricultores y fueron ellos quienes enseñaron a Paulina los gajes de este oficio. Con esta actividad es la única forma con la que ella se gana la vida, por ello, se dedica a sus terrenos de cultivo la mayor parte del día, sin descuidar su hogar. El cultivo de plátano es gratificante no solo por las ganancias que pueda darle, sino también por el contacto con la naturaleza, eso la llena de alegría. Lo más difícil es mantener a sus terrenos productivos, debido a los costosos precios de los abonos. Son sus tres hijos el motivo que le ayuda a mejorar y crecer día con día.

Requiere invertir el dinero que solicita en préstamo, en la compra de abono para sus terrenos, y así incrementar su producción y sus ventas para la próxima cosecha para que poco a poco pueda tener una gran bodega de fruta donde compre y venda por cantidades mayores.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for the planting of plantains, which will increase production.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum T., 53, is a true entrepreneur who lives with two of her three children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. 

She owns a plot of land for growing rice and also sells fish at an open air market to earn approximately $2.50 of profit per day. Her husband, Chrang Theng, 64, has a business catching fish. He provides his catch to his wife and also sells in the market as well. On average, he makes around $1 of profit per day. 

Mrs. Sum would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of $800 to purchase more fishing tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools for her husband.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Su dedicación para dar una buena atención, es la actividad diaria D. Hermelinda, quien tiene una pequeña bodega, además también se dedica al alquiler D. habitaciones y al arte textil, estas actividades ayudan a sostener los gastos D. su familia. Es madre D. 4 hijos, los mismos que están estudiando carreras profesionales. En la actualidad, ella tiene el apoyo incondicional D. su esposo Manuel quien según sus posibilidades y tiempo la ayuda en su negocio. Hermelinda tiene el deseo D. mejorar los ambientes D. su negocio, ampliarlo e implementarlo y posteriormente mandar a refaccionar algunos pormenores D. las habitaciones que da en alquiler para brindar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Es por eso que ella necesariamente requiere D. un capital para cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Her dedication to good service is a part of the daily routine of Hermelinda, who runs a small general store, rents rooms, and does textile arts. These business activities help her cover the family expenses. She has 4 children, who are all pursuing degrees. She currently has the unconditional support of her husband, Manuel, who helps out with the business as much as possible. Hermelinda has the desire to improve her shop’s atmosphere, expand and strengthen the shop, and later have some things in her rented rooms repaired so that they can be more welcoming to her customers. Hence, she needs some capital to reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General store expansion

loans.name: Trabajadoras Sociales Group

texts.en:
"Trabajadoras Sociales" is a group that is trying to receive loans to start the process to a better life. Each member in this group is looking to try and expand their small businesses and start increasing their incomes. Andrea is the group representative and has a small business selling food. She took her first loan and bought food products and now makes empanadas and sells them in her area. With this next loan she wants to sell a bigger variety of food, and wants to start selling food in other neighborhoods as well. She has two very young children, and wants nothing more than a better life for her kids. She told me that she dreams of having enough money to send them to college and to allow them to have a better life. Her dream for her business is to have her own restaurant someday. This whole group is excited about the new possibilities that are arising, and are ready to take advantage of this loan and this opportunity to better their lives. 
On behalf of Andrea, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: These people would like to improve their small businesses.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio M. P. tiene 44 años de edad, es casado con 2 hijos, ambos son mayores de edad y se encuentran estudiando en la universidad. El microempresario M. tiene desde hace más de 20 años un taller de reparación de bicicletas y a la vez vende repuestos de las mismas.

Con esta actividad económica a podido sacar adelante a su familia y poder sufragar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.

Este señor es abastecido con los repuestos de la capital en parte compra en efectivo y parte es al crédito pero con plazos relativamente cortos de un mes, lo que lo hace estar  bastante presionando por los pagos que debe cumplir.

Por tal razón esta solicitando para comprar las siguientes piezas de repuestos:

2 Docenas de llantas de bicicleta No 26 a US$ 48 dólares cada docena, 2 docenas de llantas de bicicleta No 24 a US$ 48 dólares cada docena, 2 docenas de tubos para bicicletas No 26 a US$ 24 dólares cada docena, 2 docenas de tubos para bicicletas No 24 a US$ 24 dólares cada docena, 2 docenas de Rin para bicicleta No 26 a US$ 60 dólares cada docena, 2 docenas de Rin para bicicleta No 24 a US$ 60 dólares cada docena, 2 docenas de horquia para bicicleta No 26 a US$ 48 dólares cada docena, 2 docenas de horquia para bicicleta No 24  a US$ 48 dólares cada docena, y 1 docena de frenos de aluminio para bicicleta a US$ 80 dólares cada docena.
texts.en:
Señor José Antonio M. P. is 44 years old and married with two children, both of whom are grown up and studying at university. For more than 20 years, M. has had a business repairing bicycles as well as selling spare parts for bicycles. This business has enabled him and his family to get ahead, and he has been able to cover the costs of his children’s university education. He gets the spare parts from the capital—he buys them partly with cash and partly on credit but with the relative short repayment period of one month. This has put a lot of pressure on him. For this reason he is asking for a loan to buy the following items: two dozen bicycle tyres #26 at US$48 per dozen, two dozen bicycle tyres #24 at US$48 per dozen, two dozen bicycle inner tubes #26 at US$24 per dozen, two dozen bicycle inner tubes #24 at US$24 per dozen, two dozen wheel rims #26 at US$60 per dozen, two dozen wheel rims #24 at US$60 per dozen, two dozen bike forks #26 at US$48 per dozen, two dozen bike forks #24 at US$48 per dozen, and one dozen aluminium brakes at US$80 per dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es: Brígida tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Tiene un puesto de ventas en el mercado cercano a su localidad, donde vende  todo tipo de condimentos y especias que son utilizadas para sazonar las comidas, a Brígida le satisface que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad, además a logrado que este negocio sea sostenible y dure por más de 10 años. Con esta actividad Brígida es parte importante de la economía de su casa y sus hijos son para ella la mejor motivación para seguir trabajando, además considera que no tiene muchas dificultades, ya que solo requiere de atender su puesto por las mañanas y todas las tardes tiene disponibilidad para estar con sus hijos. Es la primera vez que Brígida esta solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a su banco comunal por ser una persona  responsable en sus pagos. Con cantidad de dinero comprará al por mayor los condimentos no procesados aun, como ají colorado, ají amarillo, entre otros.
texts.en:
Brígida is 36 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She has a sales shop on a market near her town, where she sells all kinds of spices and dressings. Brígida is very pleased by the quality of her products. She has been able to manage a sustainable business for more than 10 years which is a very important part of her home economy. Her children are the best encouragement to keep on working. She doesn’t have many difficulties, as she only works at the shop in the morning, so she has the rest of day to be with her children. This is her first loan request to MFP. She was invited to this community bank thanks to her good record on making responsible payments in the past. She will use the money to purchase more un-processed spices, such as pepper, chili, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more spices

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 27 years old. She is not married. Elena lives with her parents. They have a good and friendly family. She owns a retail business and sells women's clothing at the central market in Melitopol. Elena has been in this business for 6 years. Her relatives who also own small retail businesses helped Elena to start one of her own and choose the right type of inventory to sell. Elena is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase seasonal inventory. She hopes to sell more winter clothing and use the income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Livia

texts.es: Livia tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja desde hace 7 años, es madre de 3 hijos, en la actualidad esta viviendo en una casa alquilada. La agricultura es la actividad a la que se dedica, y la que también le da muchas alegrías; en esta oportunidad ha sembrado mayormente papa, seguida de arvejas. Las siembras que realiza son en chacras alquiladas. Esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, pero a él no le gusta tanto como a ella las labores del campo, en estos momentos están cosechando y transportando sus productos al mercado de su localidad logrando vender cada saco de papa a 55 soles. Las miras a futuro de Livia es incrementar su producción para que con el tiempo pueda adquirir su terreno y construir su casa propia. Livia es algo sumisa, y prefiere no recibir ningún cargo en su banco comunal, pero sí ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos, este es su 5to préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para que desarrolle el fruto y se comercialice como calidad A1 en los mercados.
texts.en:
Livia is 31 years old, and lives with her partner of 7 years and three children in a rented home. Agriculture is the field in which she works, and it is one which makes her very happy. This season she has planted mostly potatoes, followed by peas. Her planting is done on rented farmsteads. She works together with her husband, but he does not enjoy working in the fields as much as she does, so he focuses on harvesting and transporting their products to the local market, where they sell potatoes for 55 soles (about 17 cents US) a bag. Looking to the future, Livia wants to increase production so that in time she can buy land and construct her own home. Livia preferred not to be in charge of any department of her communal bank, but she has shown that she is punctual with her payments, this is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizers, in order to get her fruit up to A1 standards in the markets.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Don Juan Jose es un pequeño comerciante de productos perecederos de forma ambulante, diariamente muy temprano sale de su casa a realizar la venta de verduras frescas a los diferentes barrios de Juigalpa, su esposa Rosa Betancour tambien vende refrescos ambulante para ayudar a su marido en el sostenimiento del hogar, son padres de un hijo de 14 años que estudia secundaria, con esfuerzo ha logrado mantener su negocio y solicita financiamiento para fortalcer su inventario y brindarle mayor oferta a sus clientes, su seño es algun dia contar con un vehiculo que facilite su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Jose is a small business man who works by traveling and selling perishable products. He leaves his house very early each day to begin selling fresh vegetables to the different neighborhoods of Juigalpa. His wife, Rosa Betancour, also travels selling soft drinks to help her husband sustain the home. They are the parents of a 14 year old son who studies in the secondary school. With a lot of effort he has succeeded in maintaining his business and he asks for financing to fortify his inventory and provide his customers with lower prices. His dream is to someday have a vehicle to help his business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perishable product sales (vegetables, soft drinks, others)

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru: Юлдошев Мурод проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст 40 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает учителем в средней школе района. Кроме того имеет 15 летний стаж по разведению крупно рогатого скота. В данный момент решил получить кредит для того, чтобы купить молодого бычка, для откормки. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 5 месяцев.
texts.en:
Murod U. lives in the Vahsh region. He is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. He works as a middle school teacher. Besides his work as a teacher, he has 15 years worth of experience in breeding livestock. At this moment, he decided to obtain a loan so he could purchase a calf. He plans to pay off the loan within 5 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: A sewing machine is used by Mrs. Soeurn K. for sewing clothes to earn a living. She, at age fifty-three, is a widowed mother who has given birth to six children. Five of them are students who help her in her business when they are not studying, and the other one is married and lives independently. To help with the family's daily expenses, K.'s oldest child is employed as a boat driver for tourists. The family's living conditions are not comfortable because their house is old and breaks down frequently. Because of this problem, K. has decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house. The remainder of the loan will be used as business capital.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita K. is a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband, Mr. Bashu Dev K., two sons, and a daughter. Her older son is studying in BBS 3rd year and also works in a small office. Her younger son is studying in grade 9. Her daughter is studying in BAC 2nd year and is also a teacher. Both Mr. and Mrs. K. are engaged in poultry and agricultural farming. They opened their poultry farm more than ten years ago. They buy all the small chickens and food grain to feed the chickens from dealers.

They are successfully running their poultry farm and earn a good profit but a few months ago they faced huge losses. All their 1000 chickens died at once and so they are facing lots of problems in their business. To overcome this problem, Mrs. K. is requesting a loan for Rs 30000.00 to continue their poultry business. She will use the loan to buys small chickens and food.

loans.use: To buys chickens and feed.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es: Evaristo tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja, Miriam, quien se dedica a la venta de comida, y con sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de vacunos, y en algunos momentos libres trabaja como albañil en la construcción de viviendas, y otras veces en aserraderos. Con estas actividades obtiene las ganancias necesarias para sustentar los gastos de su hogar. Además le gusta mucho su trabajo porque lo mantienen ocupado. A Evaristo le gustaría construir un local para tener un restaurante propio y trabajar junto a su esposa en el negocio de la comida, que le parece mucho más rentable, ya que tiene la confianza que les irá muy bien, porque su conyugue tiene muy buena sazón. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque todos los integrantes son muy unidos y responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en el negocio de su esposa, quien requiere comprar bebidas, y la construcción de su kiosco.
texts.en:
Evaristo is a 38-year-old man who lives with his wife, Miriam, and their two children. His wife is in food sales, and he has been raising cattle for 4 years. In his spare time, he sometimes works building houses, while other times he works in the sawmills. With all these jobs, he earns the money needed to cover the household expenses. Furthermore, he likes his jobs because they keep him busy. Evaristo would like to build an office space so that he can establish his own restaurant and work alongside his wife in her food business, which he thinks is more profitable. He is certain that the business will be prosperous because his wife creates flavorful dishes. This is his 4th loan with MFP. He likes to work with his microfinance group because all of its members are united and responsible with their repayments. He will invest the money that he is requesting in his wife’s business because she needs to purchase drinks and build a kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk and purchase drinks

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Mrs. Cynthia is 25 years old and lives with Mr. Cándido, with whom she has two young children, and one more on the way. She lives in a neighborhood very close to the center of the city of Ita. She has had her own house for just a little time, while before, she was living with her mother.

Thanks to her work as a tobacco saleswoman, she was able to construct a two-level house with one bathroom. She inherited her business from her mother. She makes the tobacco at home, and then sells it in the Municipal Market in the mornings. The loan applied for is to buy more bundles of raw materials, due to her large number of orders.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of raw materials

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita F. makes a living primarily from making and selling meals and delicacies in the market. She is 53 years old, married and has four adult children. She is from the village of Labo, Ozamiz City. Leonita has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2005, Leonita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to cook meals. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business and to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to cook meals

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke is 56 years old and she is a widow with four children. She sells food and drinks. With the income from this business she has been able to pay the school fees for her eldest children, who are in the university. Joke hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more food items to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Paskazia

texts.en: Paskazia Victoria is a Tanzanian entrepreneur who runs a food shop at Yombo Buza Ward in Dar es Salaam.  She sells different types of food crop products. She purchases the products wholesale and retail, both directly from the producers and from the city markets. The goods Paskazia sells include wheat flour, maize flour, groundnuts, cashew nuts, cooking oil and sugar. The income from her business is used to meet her family's daily needs and for working capital. She needs a loan of 800,000 TZS to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: El Pauro Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “El Pauro” esta representado por la señora Gregoria  y conformado por  23  miembros D. las cuales16 son mujeres y 7 son varones,  emprendedoras y emprendedores, que trabajan para poder ayudar económicamente  al bienestar D. sus familias, por eso es que acuden a la institución D. Agrocapital para poder tener un financiamiento rápido, que les permita invertir en sus negocios, para obtener mayores  ganancias. Es un grupo muy compacto entre ellos, además que se conocen bastante bien entre sus integrantes a pesar D. ser su primer ciclo. La mayoría D. los miembros se dedican  a actividades D. venta D. productos como comida, fruta, electrodomésticos, tejidos, leche, tejas, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, pan y a actividades como la construcción D. viviendas, mototaxistas. La competencia es granD. pero saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. su familia.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "El Pauro" is represented here by Gregoria and 23 other members, of whom 16 are women and 7 are men. These workers strive towards the financial well-being of their family, and that is why they seek the support of Agrocapital (Kiva Field Partner), to have quick financing to have funds to invest in their business, and translate this into greater earnings. They are a very tight-knit group, knowing one another very well despite this being their first experience. Most of the members are in sales of products such as prepared foods, fruits, appliances, knitting crafts, milk, shingles, general groceries, and baked goods, as well as construction work and public transportation drivers. There is a great deal of competition but they all know how to pull through, especially because their families depend on them.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is married with 6 children. He has a workshop where he makes doors and furniture. There is good demand for his products since this is the only workshop in the area. This workshop is the only source of income for the family. 

Jameel needs the loan to purchase good quantity wood since if he pays cash he will get a much better price. 

Jameel appears in the picture at his workshop.

loans.use: purchase wood for cash

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea es casada, tiene dos hijas  mayores de edad, vive en la colonia Jerusalen de Nueva Guinea, trabaja en la Escuela Alejandro Vegas Matus desde hace 20 años como docente de primaria,  con el crédito anterior logro satisfactoriamente construir una  cocina, y ahora esta solicitando su 7mo crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para construir una  habitación  en su casa y seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia,    se ha caracterizado por ser una   profesional  con mucha experiencia, honesta y muy trabajadora,  cuentra con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como  agricultor en la finca que estos poseen. Andrea aspira tener una vivienda bonita y bien acondicionada, tener estabilidad laboral, seguir estudiando y salud para su familia.
texts.en:
Andrea is married, has two adult daughters, and lives in Colonia Jerusalen, Nueva Guinea. She has worked in the Alejandro Vegas Matus school for 20 years as a teacher in the primary school. With the previous loan she was able to successfully construct a kitchen. Now she is requesting her 7th loan from AFODENIC in order to add a room to her house, and to continue to improve the living conditions of her family. She is a hardworking professional who is experienced and honest, and has the support of her husband who works on a farm that they own. Andrea wishes to have a beautiful, well furnished house, to have job stability, to continue her studies, and to have a healthy family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to construct a room

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La señora Norma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37años y es madre de 01 hija, que aun dependen de ella.Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar y por la falta de trabajo, decidió emprender su pequeño  negocio de Venta de Abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su barrio.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. Norma, hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos.

loans.name: Rosa De La Fe 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Nicolasa is the group coordinator of her group Rosa de la Fe (Rose of the Faith) and her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) more generally. Her group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home with her husband and four children.

Nicolasa is excited to take her first loan with Esperanza and to start doing better business. She plans to use this loan to purchase purses and purse accessories to sell to her neighbors. She has identified a market for this product and she believes she will turn a profit. With these profits she plans to purchase some school supplies for her children and additionally to build up savings. Also, she would like to enroll in literacy classes with the goal of being able to read and write which will allow her to continue to grow her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Purses and fashion accesories

loans.name: Kayanga

texts.en:
Kayanga M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase maize flour and millet to sell.  Kayanga is 40 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family settlement. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour and millet to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly F. is from the village of Pagatpat, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 48 years old. Beverly is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Beverly operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the number of products she offers. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the number of products offered

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Joaniss

texts.pt:
Maria joaniss M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, tem 57 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos de 29, 30 e 31 anos de idade, cada um vivendo actualmente no seu lar. Fez somente 2ª classe, não continuou porque os pais obrigaram lhe trabalhar na machamba e pastagem de gado bovino. Vive numa casa alugada com um neto e não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Já esteve a viver na Província de Cabo delgado norte de Moçambique desde 1983 a 2003, quando o seu esposo esteve a trabalhar naquela parcela do pais. É comerciante e dona do seu negócio há mais de 7 anos. vende mais amendoim, óleo, feijão e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 800.00mt por dia que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito (CCP) mais tarde decidiu parar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amiga (Sra. Florinda Timane) que também é cliente desta instituição e este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (Feijão, farinha, amendoim e outros) para aumentar e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 5.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para iniciar com a construção da sua casa, uma vez que actualmente vive numa casa de aluguer.
texts.en:
Maria Joaniss M. was born in the Boane District, Maputo Province. She is 57 years old, single, and the mother of 3 children who are 29, 30, and 31 years old. They each live in their own home. She only studied through 2nd grade and did not continue because her parents made her work on a small farm and in a cattle pasture. She lives in a rented house with a grandson and does not support anyone else besides him. She lived in the Cabo Delgado province in northern Mozambique from 1983 to 2003 when her husband worked in that part of the country. She is a merchant and has owned her own business for more than 7 years. She sells peanuts, oleo, beans, and brings in about 800 MZN per day, which she puts toward family expenses. She even saves some through Xitique (a traditional system of revolving savings). She has had four loans with the Credit Cooperative (CCP) but later decided to stop. She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend (Mrs. Florinda Timane), who is a client of the institution. This is her 2nd loan, which has a value of 10,000 MZN. She would use this to buy products (beans, flour, peanuts, etc.) in order to expand and further diversify her merchandise. Her previous loan of 5,000 MZN was used for the same purpose. In the future, she would like to request a loan to build a house, since she actually lives in a rented one.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell products (beans, flour, peanuts, etc.)

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her children and her husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area, in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Beatrice trades in second hand clothes. 
She tells us that she buys from Accra and sells by hawking in her community. She also treks to sell in nearby communities. Beatrice has been in business for five years and wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en: Amarzaya is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Khovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two daughters, 8 and 10, both attend a local school and his wife helps with the family business. Amarzaya operates a clothing retail business in his town where he imports products from China and sells the items at the local market. He started his business in 2006 and established both reliable customers and suppliers. Besides his clothing trading business he manages a raw material trading business in order to supplement his earnings. For the future he is planning to expand his clothing trading business and have his own shop. He says, “I work hard in order to save money for my children’s education.” Amarzaya is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan in order to import more products from China.

loans.use: To import more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maguete

texts.fr: Maguette F. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans. Elle embouche des bœufs et des mouton, cette activité lui offre la possibilité de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maguette F. is a 53-year old woman who is married with six children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for five years. She fattens oxen and sheep, and this business gives her the possibility to boost her savings and to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her livestock selling business

loans.name: Marvin Santiago

texts.es:
El Señor Marvin M. Castellón, Labora como Técnico Docente en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 El tiene tres  hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante 12 mese, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra  para la  construcción de un muro en la parte trasera del patio de  su casa.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marvin works as a technical instructor at the university called Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.

He has three children who are of school age and his is married. He has had loans from CEPRODEL during the last twelve months, and in this period of time he has invested his loans in home improvements thanks to the financing offered by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client.

The loans he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, and stone for building a wall at the rear of the patio at his home.

His goal is to offer more security and a better standard of living to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and enlargement of his home

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is 42 years of age and married with 8 children aged between 8 and 23 years. All her children go to school. The family owns and resides in a 3-room house where she stays with 6 people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family has three meals a day.

Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for children, medication, feeding the family and rent for her business premises.

Rose operates a ladies salon in Kanyanya and works upon all types of hair doing weaving, plaiting, relaxing, and hair cutting. On average she receives 10 customers a day. She has done this business for over 5 years.

She incurs transport costs to and from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala city, where she buys cosmetics. Her main challenges are seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics. She sells on retail basis only.

Rose has been with MCDT for over 7 years servicing her 14th loan working all this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cosmetics and hair extensions. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and eventually to own a bridal salon.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and hair extensions.

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en: Chioma is a young hard working woman. She is 33 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband is a building contractor in Asaba, Delta State. Her children are excelling in their school. She sells groceries, juice and drinks at retail prices to her customers.
