She is doing well in her business but her greatest challenge is funds and she hopes to overcome the challenge. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries, juice and drinks to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Khan O., aged 28, is married and resides with her three children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business which produces fabric for cleaning cars, earning an income of USD 0.7 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is employed to transport dirt to fill out people’s land, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since O. has had this business.

She is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a new sewing machine to expand her current business and to produce more products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel de 45 años de edad, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casado con cuatro hijos que su esposa procreo, el trabaja desde hace varios años a la empresa el Minsa en mantenimiento y reparación de equipo del hospital. el cual ha logrado hacer su casa toda de concreto poco a poco la ha ido construyendo, lo que le falta por terminar es el porche que ya tiene un comienzo, el cual desea terminar: comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y tratar de cerrar el porche para tener mas espacio en donde descansar y respirar mas el aire. Todo esto es para dar a su familia una mejor vivienda, que a mucho esfuerzo ha logrado para obtener estos beneficios que junto con la institución ha alcanzado.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 45, lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. He is married and has four children. He has worked for several years in the maintenance and repair of hospital equipment for the Minsa Company. This has allowed him to build his house all from concrete. He has been slowly building it, but he has not finished the porch. He started it, and he wants to finish it. He will buy rocks, sand, cement, and iron. He will try to close the porch in order to have more space to rest and breathe more air. All of this is to give his family a better house. With great effort he has gotten these benefits, which were achieved together with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rocks, sand, cement and tools to start builing the porch

loans.name: Wijdan

texts.en:
Wijdan Y. who works with her husband, Iqab, in the fields wants to share in helping him improve their field which is their only source of income, so she took a US$ 2000 loan from FATEN. In their free time, Wijdan and her sons work with Iqab, taking care of the plants he grows.

The family consists of five sons who are between 22 and 2 years old. Wijdan and Iqab have a greenhouse and would like to purchase another one to increase the produce and be able to grow a larger variety of fruits and vegetables every season, therefore she came to FATEN.

The couple are known in the city of Jineen for their commitment to work and their ambition. Jineen is a city which is known for farming and agriculture and it supplies the Palestinian market with a huge amount of vegetables and fruits.

Iqab appears in the field in the picture above.

loans.use: Purchasing a greenhouse

loans.name: Sayeed Qoobad Shah Group

texts.en:
Bibi Maryam is the daughter of Faqir S. A. Askar and the leader of S. Shah Qoobad group. She is 22 years old and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has one son. 

Maryam wants to take a loan for her husband, Fawad Khan. He is a hard-working man and he always tries his best to support his family members better. He has a cart from which he sells dry fruits. He has been involved in this business for more than three years, and has gained a lot of experience in this business. He would like to progress in business and purchase more almonds and raisins for his cart; therefore, Maryam has requested to take a loan for her husband, Fawad Khan. 

Maryam is glad that there are useful providers like Kiva in Afghanistan for support of the poor.

loans.use: To purchase more almonds and raisins for her husband's cart

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: Mabinty is a hardworking and very determined businesswoman.  She lives at Isha Street Makeni and and has her business centre at Church Street Makeni.  She is married to a trader who is also an active partner in the business and they have seven dependents.  She was initially financed by her husband and began trading junk (used clothing) which she has now done for 14 years.  She is in need of a loan to increase her stock and also intends to use the proceeds of her loan to help their children acquire university education and construct a dwelling house for herself and their family.

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. K. sells fruit for an income of USD 3.5 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. K. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more fruit to expand the current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to expand the business.

loans.name: Ángel Horacio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Ángel Horacio O. le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe como empleado de una compañía de manteamiento y reparación de autos, como mecánico.
texts.en:
At Angel Horacio Ocha's home, the exterior needs finishing. He is requesting a loan since he does not currently have the money to make the improvements. He plans to repay the loan with the salary that he receives as a mechanic at a car maintenance and repair company.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: exterior finishes

loans.name: Gune

texts.en:
Gune C. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer in her bar and is requesting a loan to stock other alcoholic drinks like wines to sell.

Gune is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store to sell crates of beer wholesale.

loans.use: Stock other alcoholic drinks like wines to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia F. is from the village of South Cogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a multi-cab service business in the local community, with her husband acting as driver. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to invest in expanding the business. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide business services. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide multi-cab service

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es:
Rosa es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, vive en casa alquilada, la mayor estudia en el colegio y el ultimo tiene 6 meses de nacida, Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante hace 3 años.
Rosa tiene un salón de belleza en un local alquilado, hace 2 meses cambio de local y sus ventas están mejorando, también vende cosméticos por catalogo, además tiene una fuente de soda que inicio cuando cambio de local.
Rosa solicita un crédito de 600 soles para la compra de leche, frutas, panes.
Rosa sueña con tener una casa propia, un carro y brindar una buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Rosa is single and she has 2 children, one in school and the other is 6 months old. Rosa lives in a rented house and she has been a member of the communal bank Sol Radiante for 3 years. Rosa has a beauty salon in a rented space. 2 months ago she moved to a different location and her sales are improving. She also sell cosmetics through a catalog as well as having a soda fountain that she started when she moved. Rosa is requesting a loan of 600 sols to buy milk, fruit and bread. Rosa's dream in to have her own house, a car, and to be able to give her daughters a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, fruit and bread

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en: Munkhtsetseg is 51 years old and single with four children. She lives with one of her daughters, son-in-law and grandson in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is a cadet in the Military Academy and son-in-law is a student at the University of Technical Science. The rest of her children are all married and live in their own homes. All her kids were teenagers when her husband left her for another woman and she was left to raise her four children on her own. Even though she was a single mother, she managed to raise her children to be healthy and send them all through college, a dream of most Mongolian parents. Munkhtsetseg is a hardworking woman with a strong will and she believes that a college diploma is the best legacy parents can give to their children. In 1994, she started a retail butcher business in the meat market in Ulaanbaatar city. She has gained valuable experience in previous years and has a loyal customer base.  During these years, she managed to buy a small house and mini-truck for her business. Sometimes her youngest daughter and son-in-law help with the business after school. With the loan that she is asking for, she is planning to increase her meat storage capacity and buy a new freezer.

loans.use: To buy a new freezer

loans.name: Saivali

texts.en:
D. Saivali was born in 1965 and is married with five children. As an aspiring and hard-working man, he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. For the past five years, Saivali has been growing melon, watermelon and onion in his land. At the same time, he raises cattle. Saivali wants his children to get a good education, allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future. This is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile. Currently Saivali requests $2,000 USD in order to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and cattle. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Martha Águeda

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Águeda E. T.,  es comerciante activa su actividad económica  es venta refrescos, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado central, con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, además su esposo vende ambulante.

Este crédito lo utilizo para comprar Azúcar, cacao, semilla, payana, canela, leche y frutas, el cual le agradece a ceprodel ya que con los prestamos ha logrado construir su local de trabajo y de realizar las compras de productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha Águeda E. T. is an active merchant who sells soft drinks to earn a living. Her business is located at the central market. She has ten years of experience managing her business. In addition, her husband works as a street vendor.

This loan will be used to buy sugar, cocoa, seeds, sticky rice, cinnamon, milk, and fruit. She is grateful to CEPRODEL because the loans that have been provided have enabled her to build a shop from which she can work and purchase goods in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, cocoa, seeds, sticky rice, cinnamon, milk, and fruit

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen S. M., age 40, grows and sells mango trees. On average, she is able to earn about US $5 in revenue each day. Her husband (pictured here) is a technician who repairs televisions and radios, typically making US $5 per day as well. One of their children is a laborer and the other two are in school. The family lives in Kendal province.

Sen S. M. is asking for a loan of US $400 to help her pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To help pay for the children's education

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep S., 44 years old, works as internal staff for a local company in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She typically makes around $3.33 of profit each day to meet what her family needs. Tep S. is married to 48-year-old, Sok Chea, a furniture maker who makes items such as tables, beds, and chairs. This couple has been married for several years and has two children. One of them is a teenager attending school and one is married and works as policeman. Tep S. is concerned about walking to work as she doesn’t own a vehicle. Tep S. decided to seek a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for transportation  to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for riding to work.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth W. is 38 years old and married to Reuben Maina. They have four children. She has been farming for 10 years and earns an income of Kshs 9,000 per month. Beth has a good history with KADET, and is applying for her fourth loan after having repaid back her previous loans successfully. She intends to use the loan to buy another dairy cow to increase her milk production. She hopes to improve the living standard of her family and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy another cow.

loans.name: Irshad Muhammad Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Irshad lives in the small city of Okara, located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area of Allah daad colony. Irshad is a housewife who stays at home to carry out her household responsibilities. She has six children. Her four elder children left education after 8th class and started work to contribute to the family financially. Her eldest daughter does sewing work and her other three sons work in private organizations for monthly wages. Only one of her daughters is able to continue her education. She studies in 6th class.
Irshad's husband is M. A. and he runs a video games shop. He offers his customers different and interesting games to play. His customer base is mostly young children who spend their leisure time playing games. His business is doing well and he makes good earnings. Irshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to assist her husband financially. With the loan, he will buy more video games in order to offer a better variety of games to his customers and make more money. He has been in this business for the past nine years and Irshad is hopeful that the investment will bring a return of good outcomes for the business.
Irshad is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Irshad.

loans.use: To buy video games for video games shop

loans.name: Alexi Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Alexi, ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 23, 22 y 20 años, dos de ellos viven con ella. El marido es chofer. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal hace dos años y se desempeña como fiscal de reglamentos.

Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, vende desde arroz, azúcar, también vende carne, pescado camarón, queso, ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar como ropa zapatos y bisutería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00, trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo. La mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros de los productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, además de artículos de bazar, ya que esta cerca la navidad y en esta época se vende bastante lo que es ropa y zapatos.  Sus sueños son tener una casa más grande, mejor construida y un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The place known as Los Arenales can be found in the Crucita parish in the Portoviejo province.  That is where the members of the “Nueva Generación” (New Generation) Communal Bank meet every two weeks.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.

This is where we find Alexi, age 40.  She is married and has three children; ages 23, 22, and 20.  Two of the children live with her.  Her husband is a driver.  She has been a member of the communal bank for two years, and she oversees the regulations for the bank.

She has a grocery store in her house.  She sells things like rice, sugar, meat, fish, shrimp, cheese, and certain remedies.  She also sells bazaar items like clothes, shoes, and costume jewelry.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Her husband helps her work.  She buys the merchandise in the city of Portoviejo, and some other products are delivered to her place.

This loan is to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergent, and bazaar items.  It is close to Christmas, and lots of clothes and shoes are sold during this season.  Her dreams are to have a bigger house, which is built better, and to have a larger business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergent, and bazaar items like clothes and shoes

loans.name: Digna Fidela

texts.es:
Digna Fidela A. C. tiene 38 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.


Digna Fidela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul.. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, y fréjol gandul.. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa un terreno y tener un negocio propio.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en: Digna Fidela A. C. is 38 and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her partner and children in the Moncache Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 3 children. The members of the V. R. C. 27 de Octubre group are located in the Santa Sofia district. All of the members are short-cycle cultivators. They mainly sow corn, rice and gandul beans. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Digna Fidela works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and gandul beans. She purchases her products in the Briones Market and sells them in the Vaca Market. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice and gandul beans. The support of the loan will help her economically to supply her necessities. They have to confront challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to purchase a house and a plot of land and to have her own business. She likes sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Mernel

texts.en: Mernel is a widow who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and eatery businesses. She has five children who are between 5 to 19 years old, all of them are currently going to school. Mernel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mernel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to use to pay for more funds in business operation so that she could continue to save up for future family needs. Mernel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: Funds in business operations

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is separated from her husband, and lives in Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. She has two children who are 14 and 17 years old.  

Antonietta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Antonietta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000. 

For her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for the business so that she can continue to save up for their future and her children's education. 

Antonietta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the community's respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
Cecilia A. Z., 39 años D. edad, madre soltera, con 04 hijos.
Cecilia trabaja vendiendo por las tardes comida al paso (salchipapas, hamburguesas, cafe, etc.);esta actividad lo realiza en la puerta D. su casa.
Cecilia desD. muy joven mantiene su hogar, ya que con cuenta con la ayuda del padre D. sus hijos.
El mayor D. sus hijos trabaja en Chile, y el tercero trabaja en un restaurante y por las tardes ayuda a su mamà en el negocio.
El prèstamo otorgado lo invertirà en compra D. utensilios para mejorar su negocio.
(En la fotografìa, Cecilia esta sentada y se encuentra en el centro del grupo, ella esta vestida con una chompa D. color gris)
texts.en:
Cecilia A. Z. is 39 years old and a single mother of four children. She works in the afternoons selling fast food such as “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes), hamburgers, coffee, and other items. Cecilia operates her business from the doorstep of her house.

Ever since she was a young woman, Cecilia has maintained her household. She receives support from the father of her children. Her oldest child works in Chile, while her third child works at a restaurant and then helps her in the afternoons with running her business.

The loan that was provided will be invested in the purchase of utensils for improving her business. (In the photograph, Cecilia is seated in the middle of the group. She is wearing a gray sweater.)

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw material to produce gara (dyed fabric) clothing

loans.name: Romania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Romania;  La socia tiene 48 años de edad; La socia es conviviente;  La socia tiene 3 hijos de 28,25,20 años de edad, la socia tiene un pequeño restaurante en el poblado de Ollantaytambo, ella desea implementar su negocio y quiere comprar cervezas, ella dice que la venta de cervezas es la que le rinde más por eso desea invertir el crédito en la compra y venta de cervezas, el restaurante que la socia tiene, ella dice que dedica la venta de cervezas por las tardes y hasta las 10 de la noche, no vende más allá de 3 botellas chicas. La socia desea invertir en la compra y venta de cervezas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cervezas.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Romania is a member of the Communal Bank “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” which is located in the District of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 28, 25, and 20). Romania has a small restaurant in the village of Ollantaytambo. She wants to keep her business in operation and buy beer. Romania says that selling beer generates more revenue, so she wants to invest this loan in the purchase of these beverages for her restaurant. She says she starts selling beer in the afternoons until 10pm and has a three bottle limit per customer. Romania wants to invest in more beer, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Romania is satisfied with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase beer to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Ra'nogul

texts.ru: Рахимова Раъногул жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем, имеет 7 детей. Дети учатся в средней школе. Муж находится в России. Сама Раъногул занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает женские аксессуары, косметику и детские игрушки. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки парфюмерии и вещей для домашнего хозяйства.
texts.en: Ra'nogul R. lives in the town of Qurgan-tube. She is 39 years old. She is married and has seven children. Her children all go to secondary school now. Her husband is in Russia and Ra'nogul sells on the market. She rents out a vendor space where she sells accessories for women, cosmetics and children toys. She has been in this business for five years. She is taking out the loan to buy perfumes and household items.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and household items

loans.name: Loh

texts.en: Loh K. is a forty-nine-year-old clothing vendor residing in the Reussey Keo commune. He currently sells clothing for both men and women in the marketplace. He is single man who now lives with his niece who works in the factory. Loh K. never wastes time as he works to earn the money to support his ageing parents. He has managed his investment carefully and has attracted a large number of clients due to his communication skills. In order to better meet his customers' demands, he would like a $500 loan to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando P. C. tiene 49 tiene una familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 15, 16 y 19 años y es propietario de un negocio ubicado en el centro de Barranquilla,  donde vende artículos deportivos, como ropa y calzado, con el cual ha logrado generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, habiendo obtenido su experiencia comercial durante 5 años en un almacén de electrodomésticos, donde aprendió a manejar el mercado cultivando en sus relaciones sociales,  muchos clientes que aun continuaron  con él,  cuando emprendió su propio negocio, después de recibir la liquidación de sus prestaciones sociales al retirarse de esa empresa.  Armando en su negocio ofrece camisetas, sandalias, gorros, banderas alusivas a   equipos deportivos que despiertan la pasión de sus clientes,  especialmente al Junior de Barranquilla que es el equipo profesional de futbol de la ciudad de Barranquilla y cuenta con muchos seguidores y fanáticos que le compran a Armando. Este negocio ha sido muy importante en la vida de la familia, porque de aquí se desprende la actividad comercial que desarrolla la esposa de Armando, mediante la cual ofrece las mismas mercancías mediante créditos y tambien de contado a su propia clientela, lo que se constituye en un ingreso más que favorece el bienestar de todos en su hogar.
Su sueño es sacar adelante a su familia, por eso se esmera en lograr que su negocio se fortalezca cada día más, ahorrando y aumentando su capital de trabajo,  asì  como también sus clientes, quienes son los que  finalmente   con sus compras, generan las utilidades que recibe  y fortalecen su estabilidad.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará en mayor cantidad, camisetas, sandalias, suéteres, bolsos y accesorios deportivos, para actualizar su oferta.
texts.en:
Armando P. C., 49, has a family composed of his spouse and three children who are 15, 16 and 19 years old.  He owns a business located in downtown Barranquilla where he sells athletic items, like clothes and footwear, that produces income to support his household.  

He acquired his commercial experience while employed for five years in an appliance store.  There he learned to manage the market cultivating social relationships.  When he opened his own business with his severance package from that firm many of his customers followed him.

Armando stocks t-shirts, sandals, caps, sports team banners that awaken his customers’ passion, especially for the Barranquilla Junior team, which is Barranquilla’s football team and has lots of fans that buy from Armando.

This business has been very important in the life of the family because his wife’s commercial activity springs from it too.  She sells the same kinds of items on credit and for cash to her own clientele and this is an additional source of income that benefits everyone’s wellbeing in the home.

His dream is to move his family forward and this is why he strives to strengthen his business more each day, saving and increasing his working capital as well as the number of customers who ultimatelly are the ones who strengthen his stability through profits generated by their purchases.

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy larger amounts of t-shirts, sandals, sweaters, bags and sports accessories, to update his stock.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of clothes, sandals, bags and sports accessories.

loans.name: Vandan

texts.en: Mr. Vandan is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. Vandan is a monk and he serves in the local Buddhist temple. He has been serving as a monk since 1998. His duties include attending everyday prayer at the temple, executing rituals at funerals, weddings and so on. His two children attend a local secondary school. Last year, Vandan did an external face-lift on his old house and now he is planning to do some renovation to the interior of the house. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy plaster, gypsum boards, paint and wallpaper to do interior decoration to his family house.

loans.use: To buy building materials to redecorate the interior of his house.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un depósito de bebidas en una parte de su casa. Trabaja repartiendo bebidas a las tiendas y distribuyéndolas a los diferentes clientes que le solicitan. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am repartiendo las botellas hasta las 22h00pm que se las da a su último comprador. Las botellas las vende por docena y por unidad a un valor muy económico para el cliente. Vende colas, guitte, agua.  Quiere seguir con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo mas bebidas como botellas de colas, agua con gas etc. Su sueño es tener un carro para repartir con más agilidad las botellas a los clientes.
texts.en:
Mariana, 30, is a hard-working woman who warehouses soft drinks in part of her house.  She delivers them to stores and to different customers who request them.

She works from 6 am delivering the bottles until 10 pm when she sees her last customer.  She sells the bottles by the dozen and each unit is economical for her customers.  She sells colas, mineral water, (Guite brand) and water.  She would like to continue with her business and that’s why she is requesting the loan to purchase more drinks such as bottles of cola, mineral water, etc.  Her dream is to have a car so that it will be much easier to make the deliveries .

loans.use: To purchase bottled drinks to sell

loans.name: German

texts.es: El Sr. German Vive en la localidad de el torno,  es nacido en el departamento de Chuquisaca, tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, es de ocupación carpintero, hace unos 14 años se dedica a esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para la compra de madera con lo que  realizar su trabajo, su esposa se dedica a la   venta de comida en el mercado de la comunidad. Se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo económico que siempre se le ha brindado, en los tiempos buenos y malos de su negocio, el es una persona muy trabajadora y muy dinámico su deseo es el de poder tener una fabrica de muebles.
texts.en:
German lives in El Torno. He was born in the Chuquisaca department. He has three school-aged children and he works as a carpenter. He has been in this business for 14 years. He will use this loan to purchase wood so that he can continue his work.

His wife works selling food in the community market. German is grateful to the institution for the economic support that they have always given him, in both the good and difficult times for his business. He is a very hard-working and dynamic person. His dream is to open a furniture factory.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Analiza has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Analiza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Analiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos, cuyes y chanchos y luego los vende en las diferentes lugares como ferias en la ciudad de Cusco, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, ladrillos y yeso para construir su casa.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to “El Diamante de Urubamba” community bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district of the Urubamba province, within the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Elizabeth. She is 28 years old, is married and has 2 children. The member alternates her daily activities with her business of raising small livestock like chickens, guinea pigs and pigs. She then sells them to different places like the markets in the city of Cusco. Through this business she is able to help her children get ahead. The member wants to expand her house and finish the construction on it. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks and plaster to build her house.

The member is happy about the loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks and plaster to build her house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, age 40, runs a sari-sari (general) store in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She and her husband have three school-aged children who help her in managing the sari-sari store. This is the family's means of living. Evelyn has been doing this for two years now and is grateful to be earning a monthly total of PHP 10,000.00. 

Evelyn has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC in order to purchase more products to sell from her shop, basic commodity items such as laundry soap, checheria, cereals, noodles, canned goods, and generic medicines. 

Evelyn has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She hopes to expand the business so as to increase her income from it.

loans.use: to buy basic commodity items, such as such as laundry soap, checheria, cereals, and noodles, to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Yorm

texts.en: Yorm is a grocery seller. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $7 per day. She has four children. Three of her children are studying. Every month she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy grocery goods to sell. She has been doing this business for about 10 years. She started with only a few goods to sell. The income she gets from selling, she keeps to buy more goods to sell. Now her business is getting successful, so she wants to expand her career when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy haberdashery and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Junita

texts.en:
Junita is 35 years old and is married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, Junita has run a shop where she sells snacks, beverages, and canned goods. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. 

Junita is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy merchandise to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Vip Group

texts.en:
Justine, who is in his early 20s, is single and has a small child. He has had a retail shop since 2007. He works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his retail inventory. He has paid back his loans successfully. He wants a loan to again increase his retail shop inventory. His dream is to one day be able to become an international businessman with a very big retail shop. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "VIP" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase his retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is married and has four children. She is 25 years old and lives in Caluya, Sapang Dalaga.

Minda sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 to purchase fishing nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Minda has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Analie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Analie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Analie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 24, buys and sells milk to earn a living. This has been his business for a period of three years, earning him a monthly income of Kshs 10,000. He and his wife Elizabeth are the parents of a three-year-old child. Elizabeth works as a small-scale farmer and contributes her earnings to the monthly income for the family. 

Joseph has just recently joined KADET and is requesting a loan of Ksh 10,000 as his first term. He wishes to use the amount to pay the local farmers who supply him with the milk and to be able to capitalize on the increase by getting more returns. He hopes to us the profits to purchase a dairy cow and improve the welfare of his family.

He hopes to prosper in business and live a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more milk from local farmers to offer for resale

loans.name: Sebastiano

texts.en: Sebastiano is a 60-year-old married man with ten children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to construct a big permanent house on his plot of land for renting and to own a large tea plantation. He is currently practicing mixed farming and he got start-up capital from farming. He has been challenged by the change of seasons, but desires to become a model farmer. Sebastiano needs the loan to prepare land for the next season and also to improve on his projects.

loans.use: to prepare land for the next season and also to improve on his projects

loans.name: Edison Adrian

texts.es:
Edison inició esta actividad desde hace varios años y con esto a logrado sostener a su compañera y sus pequeños hijos, este negocio se encuentra en el parque principal del municipio de Santuario, allí Edison realiza a sus clientes cualquier tipo de servicio de peluquería.

El quiere tener inmobiliario nuevo y un local mas grande para poder atender mas clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida, además así le puede ofrecer a su familia un futuro estable y con la posibilidad de realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Edison started his business several years ago and it has allowed him to support his partner and small children.  His hairdressing salon is in the main park of the municipality of Santuario where he offers all types of salon services.  

He wants to buy new furniture and have a larger shop so he can attend to more customers.  This would improve his lifestyle and give his family a more stable future so they can carry out their dreams.

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Laura Matilde

texts.es:
Laura Matilde tiene 42 años de edad es casada tiene una hija, vive con el esposo la hija, nieta y madre en Guaranda sector cuatro esquinas Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central está formada por 12 socios que pertenecen al sector cuatro esquinas, los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como son agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y otros.
Laura se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio de quesos, siembra de papas, habas, alverja, tiene dos cabezas de ganado.
Las compras y ventas lo realiza en el mercado de Guaranda, Solicita el crédito para compra de animales (cerdos) compra de alimentos (balanceado9 para engorde.
Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudaría en mejorar el estilo de vida.
El sueño es tener un terreno y casa cerca de la ciudad, Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la baja de precios en los productos que se saca a la venta.
En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear, salir al pueblo para ir a la iglesia, fiestas de carnaval, San José y navidad.
texts.en:
Laura Matilde is 42 years old, married, and has one daughter.  She lives with her husband, daughter, granddaughter and mother in Cuatro Esquinas, in Guaranda, in Bolívar province.

The 'Cuatro Esquinas Central' community bank has 12 members who live in Cuatro Esquinas.  They work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising, commerce, etc.

Laura farms, raises livestock and sells cheese.  She grows potatoes, beans and peas, and has two cows.

Laura makes her purchases and sales in Guaranda market.  She is requesting a loan to buy animals (pigs) and nutritionally-balanced feed with which to feed them.

The support of this loan will help Laura to improve her lifestyle.

Laura's dream is to own a plot of land and a house near the city.  The challenge she faces is the decrease in price of the products that she sells.

In her free time, Laura enjoys going for walks, going to the village to attend church, and celebrating Carnaval, San José and Christmas.

loans.use: to buy animals (pigs) and nutritionally-balanced feed with which to fatten them

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.es:
La socia Yuliana se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de boletos turisticos,ella vende en el aeropuerto de Cusco y tambien la socia sigue trabajando en una empresa privada,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere mejorar en su trabajo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar boletos turisticos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Yuliana continues to work selling package tours at the Cusco airport. She also continues working at a private company. By so doing she manages to take care of her children. The member wants to improve in the work she does. The member is asking for a loan to buy package tours.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy package tours.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 
Thelma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Thelma has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase broiler hens, feeds and drugs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys owns a stand at a local market where she sells a wide variety of products. When she started selling she did not have a stand and she had to sell from a cart in downtown Guayaquil. With a $200 loan from a friend, she was able to set up a stand in a local market. She now sells clothing, make up products and many other items.

Through hard work and perseverance Gladys has been able to make her business a success. She needs this loan in order to continue investing in products to sell from her store. Specifically, she plans to buy new toys and clothing. Eventually Gladys wants to run the store from a part of her a home. She has children but they are no longer dependent on her.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in toys and clothing for her store

loans.name: Metin

texts.en: Metin H. is 33 years old. He is married and has two sons. His wife takes care of their younger son who is only 1 year old. Before founding his business Metin was a football player. Metin has had his business since 2000. Then he started a general store in his native village, near to the town of Djebel, Kardjali district. The population of this village is just about 100 people. Later he opened a big restaurant in Djebel and two years ago he opened another larger restaurant. Now he needs to upgrade the kitchen equipment of his restaurant and needs  a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To upgrade the kitchen equipment of the restaurant.

loans.name: Ehtibar

texts.en: Ehtibar N. supports three children and a husband disabled in the  war. She is 53 years old and lives in Imishli town. Ehtibar runs small shop in the center of town and needs additional working capital. She is asking for a loan of $1175 to buy a new consignment of perfume.

loans.use: To buy perfume

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: buy CAT tools

loans.use: buy software

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a poor mother of 32 years of age, married with 2 children. Her husband is not working and raising her children has always been a problem for her. She heard about SPBD through other village ladies so she thought this was a good opportunity to start something of her own. She used her first loan to buy what she needed for the business, and she is very pleased with the assistance she was given in terms of financial support. Eseta sells her German buns in the village and also in school. If everything goes well, she is planning to do something as a second business.

loans.use: To start her German Bun business

loans.name: Ayna

texts.en: Ayna is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aghdam region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  She and her family were relocated to the Yeni Surakhani settlement in the suburbs of Baku city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  She rents a booth in the local market and trades vegetables, dry fruits and spices.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years.  She now wants to increase her volume of sales as they are down, invest more in her business and increase her income.  She has had two previous loans from Normicro Baku branch.  Now she has applied again for $500 to invest in her business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, aged 36, is a professional driver engaged in a motorcycle transport business. He was formerly employed as a taxi driver for six years. James says, ‘Life was not easy’. He had to collect a fixed amount of money every week to pay the car owner. This created so much pressure that sometimes he couldn’t take anything at home for his family after failing to get customers. Therefore, James resorted to joining a motorcycle transport business three years back. Today, he owns an old motorcycle and he can realize some daily income and is assured of employment. He operates at Wandegeya, a suburb of Kampala, the capital city of Uganda. The street is very busy and it’s strategically located near the major university called Makerere, where students are his main customers.

James has a family of four children, two boys and two girls, aged between 16 to 3. All the children are at school. He wishes to work hard to ensure that they all go to college.

He wishes to borrow $600, which he is planning to supplement with his own savings to purchase a new motorcycle to cope up with customers' needs. (University students, who are his biggest customers, prefer nice new model motorcycles.) SAO MFI (u)Ltd will top up the loan as requested by the client. He says he will be able to pay back the loan in six monthly installments.

With time, he hopes to use the profits to set up a grocery for fresh fruit, greens and local food.

loans.use: Purchase of new motorcycle Bajaj CC 100

loans.name: Thi Tam

texts.vi:
Mr and Ms Tám are woodworkers for many years, they make furnitures. They have never had a loan before. Since they learned about Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) they applied for a loan of 2006000VND (150 USD) to expand their furniture business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Hai vợ chồng chị Tám đã làm nghề mộc từ nhiều năm nay, chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Biết được những tiện ích khi vay vốn Tài chính vi mô của Binh minh cdc, anh chị đã vay 2006000VND để muốn mở rộng sản xuất kinh doanh.

loans.use: To expand their furniture business

loans.name: Muborack

texts.en: Muborack O. lives in Asht, Tajikistan.  She is married and has 4 children. Mrs.O. is a new client of  MicroInvest but she is experienced in business (about 8 years). She has a trade outlet in the bazaar where she trades in material and self-sewed national dresses. She is a skilled dressmaker. Mrs.O. has a wide assortment with different colored material  and a variety of national dresses. Now Mrs.O. requests the loan of $650 for a new material lot purchase.

loans.use: a new material lot purchase

loans.name: Kyowamwino A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jesca N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more furniture. Jesca is 37 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant farmer. She has 5 children ranging from age 2 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Jesca makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business.

Jesca is joined in her small group by Mary N., Julian A., Zabina K., and Jesca A.. Mary N. has a business selling fish and wants to invest in her business. Julian A. is currently operating a business selling tomatoes and wants a loan to start a business selling fruit. Zabina K. operates a business selling maize and wants to add more stock. Jesca A. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more raw food.

loans.use: To add capital to restaurant business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 47 years old and has been with TYM Fund since 2003. She lives with her husband and their 3 children. The family's main business is making natural medicine with plants. The family also raises pigs and plants corn. Making medicine provides them with a main monthly income of about $500. In their free time, her children help with her work.

Mrs.T. has applied for a new loan of $825 to buy pigs, fish and plants (for making medicine).

loans.use: Invest in fish, pigs and medicinal plants

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43 year old man. He has 4 children. He lives in Borj Barajneh, in the suburbs of Beirut.

Ali is a mechanic. This is the fifth time he has applied for a loan with Al Majmoua. With the loan, he wants to buy material for his business.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik was born in 1975. He is married, has 2 children.  Malik started a cattle breeding business 5 years ago. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan,  Fuzuli town and has settled in the Finnish houses, which were built temporarily on the front line in the Fuzuli region. Now he requests a loan of $625 to buy a calf to raise and breed.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Albina's first loan.

Albina belongs to the Aleli Village Bank. She is a 44-year-old widow and has four children. She sells sweets, gelatines and lollipops which she makes. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm in the Fe y Alegría school’s door in her district and she is a mobile seller.

Albina needs a 1750 soles ($US625) loan to buy chocolate, biscuits, gelatine, toffees and fizzy drinks.

She would like to expand her business, have her own capital and she wants her children to be professionals.

loans.use: To buy chocolate, biscuits, gelatine, toffees and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Thi Man's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. Man Thi D., MS 11040006, 45 years of age is very focused and hard working. Besides working in the field (growing wheat and seasonal vegetables), she also raises livestock that include pigs and chickens. She was able to pay her last loan successfully. Her last business loan was also a success. Through good money management, she was able to purchased things for her family. Her accomplishment made her happy and even more motivated to continue doing business, seeking out more loans. This time she is asking for a loan of 3.828000vnd to invest into her family tradition of woodshop/construction work, stabilizing and increasing hers and her family income. The following are members of her group:

  • Ms. T. thi Thu, MS 11040011, is seeking a loan of 3.360000vnd to buy wood for her wood shop business.
  • Ms. N. Thi Lan, MS 11040027, is seeking a loan of 2.242000vnd to buy pigs for breeding.
  • Ms. N. Thi Thi, MS 11040007, is seeking a loan of 2.434000vnd to buy machinery for her family carpentry business.
  • Ms. N. thi Nhinh, MS 11040018, is seeking a loan of 2.242000vnd to buy livestock food supplies - ducks.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn N., Kiva volunteer.

    chị Mẫn thị Đố MS 11040006, chị Đố năm nay 45 tuổi là người rất chăm chỉ. Chị không chỉ làm ruộng ( trồng lúa, hoa màu theo mùa), chăn nuôi lợn, gà...Chu kỳ trước chị đã trả vốn rất tốt và đã hỗ trợ được Chị trong việc tích kiệm tiền để mua tài sản trong gia đình. Điều đó đã làm Chị rất vui và rất muốn tham gia vay tiếp, chu kỳ vốn này Chị đăng ký vay mức 3.808000 VND để thêm vốn phát triển nghề mộc của gia đình nhằm ổn định, phát triển kinh tế gia đình mình hơn nữa. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm chị :

  • chị Trương thị Thu MS 11040011 vay mức 3.360000 VND để mua gỗ phát triển nghề mộc
  • chị Ngô thị Làn MS 11040027 vay mức 2.242000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thi MS 11040007 vay mức 2.464000 VND mua máy làm mộc của gia đình
  • chị Nguyễn thị Nhinh MS 11040018 vay mức 2.242000 VND để mua cám vịt

loans.use: vay vốn chăn nuôi và làm nông nghệp

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao A., who is 30 years old, sells groceries and beef soup in her village; her husband, Mr. Poch Vut, who is 38 years old, sells fish door to door. Mao earns around US $4 per day, and her husband earns around US $3 per day. Lom lives with three children, all of whom are in school and live in the Danrun Commune in the Siem Reap Province. Because of increasing demand and competition, Lom would like to request a loan to purchase more groceries and to decorate her store.

loans.use: Purchasing more groceries and decorating her store

loans.name: Arminita

texts.es: Arminita vende ropa para niños y adultos de segunda mano, así como también zapatos y otras variedades, prendas que las deja a sus clientes al crédito o al contado. Ella trabaja muy duro con la sola intención de sacar adelante a sus hijos y desde luego crecer con su negocio para adquirir más adelante su propia tienda. Arminita tiene 52 años, es madre soltera, y el cargar esta responsabilidad tan grande no es razón de quedarse atrás, sino es un momento de reflexión y superación, nos menciona. Ella quiere salir adelante en su negocio de venta de ropa, incluso quiere mandar a construir un local en su propio domicilio. Pero requiere de un préstamo para lograr su meta. Apoyemos a esta madre que muestra sus ganas de superación.
texts.en:
Arminita sells second-hand clothes for children and adults, along with shoes and other clothing items, that her customs buy with cash or credit. She works very hard with the single goal of improving the lives of her children. She wants to grow her business by acquiring her own store someday. Arminita, 52, is a single mother, a great responsibility that hasn't held her back, she tells us, but overcome. She wants to grow her clothing business and even build a shop at her house for it, but she needs a loan to meet her goals. Let's support this woman who has demonstrated a strong drive to beat the odds.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a shop for clothing business.

loans.name: Laura Senith

texts.es:
La señora Laura pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Ucayali Nº 875, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor de Educación Secundaria. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene un año trabajando con el Banco Comunal.
 
En la actualidad Laura es profesora de Educación Primaria. Su negocio es vender productos de belleza (EBEL) y confeccionar toallitas de mano “Lencería”. En las mañanas labora como docente, por las tardes reparte sus productos y en sus tiempos libres trabaja en su lencería. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 15 metros de telas felpa, blondas, cintas, hilos y productos de bellezas.

Gracias a la ayuda del Banco Comunal y a su esfuerzo su negocio ha mejorado y por ende tendrá la oportunidad de seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Laura belongs to the "Vecinas Unidas" Communal Bank, located at Jr. Ucayali # 875, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of 3 minor children who still depende on her. Her husband works as a Secondary Education professor. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles-Peruvian currency), Laura decided to invest it on selling clothes. She has been working with the Communal Bank for one year.

Currently, Laura is a Primary Education professor. Her business sells beauty products (EBEL) and she also makes hand towels. In the mornings, she works as a teacher and in the afternoons, she delivers her products and on her free time Laura works in making the hand towels.

With this 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy 15 meters of terry cloth fabric, flaxen fabric, ribbons, threads, and beauty products. Thanks to the help from the Communal Bank and her effort, Lauras's business has improved and as a result she will have the opportunity to continue supporting her children.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy fabrics, threads, ribbons, beauty products etc.

loans.name: Leoncia Maria

texts.en:
Leoncia is a member of the Qory Qaytu Village Bank. Qory Qaytu means “thread of gold” in Quechua. She is 50 years old and widowed with six children, three of whom still live with her.

Leoncia sells dry goods (sugar, flour, rice) in bulk and individually in the Peruvian jungle. She buys the items in Ayacucho’s Nery Market and travels once a week to the jungle, where she buys pineapples and bananas to bring back to Ayacucho to sell. She has been in this line of work for the past ten years. It gets tiring sometimes, she says, since some weeks she makes as many as three trips back and forth.

Leoncia is requesting a loan of 900 soles to buy more dry goods to take to the jungle and sell. Her goal for the future is to save her money so that she can take care of herself as she gets older.

loans.use: Buy dry goods (flour, rice, sugar) to sell in the jungle

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es: Mabel tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo  y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 16 años vende comida en la principal calle de su localidad, sobre todo en las tardes, para ello arrendó un local comercial cerca de su casa y ofrece todo tipo de platos típicos, por lo que ha tenido la acogida de sus clientes que cada vez demandan más de ella. Mabel desea seguir creciendo, y no solo atender en las tardes, sino también durante todo el día  para incrementar sus ventas, su trabajo es su mejor satisfacción y sobre todo porque es para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, por lo que no descansara por seguir mejorando. Es la primera que Mabel solicita un préstamo con MFP, ella ha sido invitada por su banco comunal porque conocen que es responsable. Esta cantidad será invertida en la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza para su negocio y mejorar su cocina.
texts.en:
Mabel is 36 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. For 16 years, she has sold food on the main street in her town, mostly during the afternoons. She has rented a commercial location near her house and she offers many typical dishes to her clients, who enjoy these dishes and continue to ask for more from her. Mabel would like to continue to grow her business, and not just serve patrons during the afternoons but during the entire day as well, in order to increase her sales. Her work is a major source of satisfaction, above all because she is able to provide necessities to her family, for whom she will work to improve her business. This is the first loan Mabel has sought with MFP. She has been chosen by the communal bank because they know she is responsible. Mabel will use this loan to invest in more ingredients which will be used for her business and to improve her kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Arbob

texts.en:
Arbob G. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children. He has been breeding cattle for more than 5 years, and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, above all getting milk from his cows, which his wife sells in local markets.

Arbob keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, along with his wife who help him with caring for the animals. Now Arbob needs a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for purchasing more cattle to expand his business. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to expand his cattle business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila G. is an elderly person; she is 65 years old and she is living in Falesti district, Drujineni village. Her business is raising cattle for sale at the market. Ludmila has requested a loan to buy another cow to increase the number of cattle she is raising; also that will serve as her alternative source of income to develop her business. Her business greatly helped her in sending her children to school. Ludmila is very happy that there are people as lenders from Kiva that support small entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Glendy

texts.es: La señora Glendy de 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos quienes la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches en las afueras de su casa, así como también vende bebidas gaseosas durante todo el día y quien el ayuda en su negocio es su esposo. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y que estos se sientan satisfechos y gustosos de su buena sazón. Más adelante quiere poder implementar un restaurante de recreo donde solo atenderá los fines de semana con la venta de parrilladas y otros platos especiales. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita implementará un espacio más adecuado afuera de su casa, con un techo a base de ramas para estar más protegida tanto ella, como sus implementos y comida.
texts.en:
Glendy is 32 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children who support her a lot. She sells food in the evenings outside her home, and she sells soda pop during the day and it is her husband who helps her with the business. She has had this business for 8 years. What she likes about her work is providing good customer service so that her customers feel satisfied and pleased with the good service. In the future she hopes to be able to open a casual restaurant that will she will operate on the weekends selling grilled meals and other special dishes. This is her first loan with MFP and with the money she seeks she will implement a more adequate space outside her house, with a roof made of branches so her customers will be protected, as well as her, her utensils and food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Create an adequate spaces outside her home for her business

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
A. Dilorom is an enterprising, capable, and very hard-working woman. She lives in Isfara, Tajikistan and sells women’s clothes. She began her own business because her husband was unemployed for some time. Her work is allowing her two children go to school. It is very important to Dilorom that her children finish school and become honest, hard-working individuals.

You can help Dilorom provide for the education of her children. She needs $1200 USD to buy merchandise in order to increase sales. She wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. Support her!

 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new women's clothing for the spring season

loans.name: Thoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoem K., 43, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Hing, 55, who live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, were married in 1980 and have three sons. The eldest son is a car repairer and the other two are in school. 

Thoem has been selling Cambodian cakes for twenty years. She buys ingredients from the market in Phnom Penh to make the cakes for sale in her village. Her husband has been a construction worker for two years. She grinds rice into rice flour by hand. This is too hard for her so she is asking for a loan of $150 to purchase a machine to grind rice.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to grind rice into rice flour.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. is divorced with four children and has received an education through primary school. Since 2005 she has worked as a trader selling oranges at Tomo School near Shama Junction. Comfort uses her income to pay for the upkeep of the house because she is the sole provider for her family.

Comfort will use the loan to purchase more oranges to sell and with the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to open a bank account and start saving her money.

loans.use: To purchase more oranges to sell

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.ru: Нематова Хурматой-женщина 37-ми лет,  замужем,  имеет  3-х  детей.  Занимается продажей электроприборов на центральном рынке Спитаменского рынка.  Хурматой имеет 5-ти летний стаж в сфере торговли.  Она начинала  продажу с  маленького стола,  потому  что  у  неё  не  было  финансов.  Постепенно,  расширив  свой  товарооборот  и  накопив  немного  денег.  она  арендовала  маленький  магазинчик.  В  настоящее  время  её  товары  среди  покупателей  пользуются  хорошим  спросом,  так  как  она  всегда  привозит  хороший  и  качественный  товар. Хурматой  нравится  с  нами  работать,  так  как  полученный  кредит  помог  ей  расширить  свой  ассортимент.
texts.en:
Hurmatoy N. is a 37-year-old woman, who is married and has three children. She sells electric appliances in the Spitamen central market. Hurmatoy has five years of experience in sales. She began selling from a small table because she had no financing. After gradually expanding her inventory and saving money, she rented a small shop. At the present time, her goods are in demand with customers because she always brings in good quality merchandise. Hurmatoy likes working with MicroInvest as the loan she received helped her to expand the variety of goods she carries.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory for a store

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Elizabeth del Carmen M. Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 37 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es venta de ropa y de CD. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus propósitos con su negocio son ampliar su inventario para que la demanda solicitada por sus clientes sea satisfactoria. Con los financiamientos ha logrado crecer con su negocio. Es por eso que los financiamientos son destinados para capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería como ropa para damas, ropa para niños y ropa interior. El deseo de Elizabeth es adquirir un puesto en el mercado donde ofrecerá a sus productos a una variada clientela.
texts.en:
Elizabeth del Carmen M. Gutiérrez is 37 and married. She has four children who go to school. She sells clothes and CDs. She has been doing this for more than nine years. Her plan for the business is to increase her inventory so that her supply can meet demand, and her customers will be satisfied. With loans she has been able to expand her business. That is why the loans are for working capital to buy merchandise like women’s clothes, children’s clothes, and underwear. Elizabeth’s wish is to get a place in the market where she can sell her products to various customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sesawi A1 Group

texts.en:
Sesawi A1 is a group of eight people in Usapi Sonbai Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Usapi Sonbai Village is situated about 29 Km from Kupang City. The community in this area leans on the agricultural sector to support their family lives. The main income comes from selling agricultural products such as bananas, coconuts and corn. There is no local market in this area, so the community has to get into the Inpres Market in Kupang City.

Sesawi A1 is led by Sem T., 32 years old. He is a married man. His marriage has been blessed with three children. The children are: Reman, 8 years old, in the 2nd grade of elementary school; Rali, 6 years old and Alfin, 2 months and not at school yet. 

To meet his family's needs, Sem leans on the crops (coconut and cucumber). But usually, the income generated from selling the crops cannot cover all of their needs. He also has several goats that can be sold in an emergency.  Living as a farmer in a remote area really becomes a challenge for Sem. Lack of capital becomes the main issue for him to improve his living standard. This situation motivated Sem to join the TLM cattle-fattening program with a hope for a better future.
