His experience in raising goats for two years has given him the self confidence to join the program. Sem is requesting a loan of IDR 3,300,000 from TLM to buy young cattle to fatten in 12 months. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his living standard. The other group members also have the same dream as Sem – a dream to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: El señor Ismael R. Hernández , tiene la edad de 53 años , habita en el barrio Pilas Orientales , ubicado en Masaya , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como docente y le poya con los gastos del hogar ,ellos tiene tres hijos , los cuales estudian y le apoyan con las actividades del campo en sus tiempos libres ;  los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Ismael desde hace 36 años es agricultor la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , él inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos , los planes futuros a su cultivos es poder legalizar donde se encuentra la plantación .Con el financiamiento va a comprar semillas y fertilizantes y lograr una mejor producción para vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sr. Ismael R. H., 52, lives with his wife in the Pilas Orientales neighborhood of Masaya. His wife is a teacher and helps with household expenses. They have three children, all in school, who help Ismael with farming chores in their free time. His plan for his family is to improve their living conditions. Ismael has been a farmer for 36 years. The biggest problem he faces is a lack of financing. He grew his business from scratch and his future goal for the business is to be able to legalize the land where he plants his crops. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to improve his production so that he can sell his crop for a good price at market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to improve crop yields.

loans.name: Tahseen

texts.en:
Tahseen is 28 years old. He is a single man living with his parents and he helps them to pay for his four younger siblings' education.

After trying his luck with several different businesses, Tahseen decided to fully dedicate himself to selling shoes and slippers. This activity has helped him overcome economic obstacles and has helped his parents educate and feed his younger brothers and sisters.

Today, Tahseen needs a loan of 2,000 US Dollars to increase his inventory in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is single and has no child. She has received schooling through senior high school.

Josephine sells frozen meat and fish at Nkontrodo, Elmina, which she has done since 2006. She uses her income to pay bills.

Josephine will use the loan to expand her business by buying more frozen meat and fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more frozen meat and fish for resale

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou Sané, 52 ans, marié avec 10 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de ALWAR depuis 8 ans. Elle a contracté ce prêt pour réfectionner et renforcer  sa gargote où elle vend tous les matins le petit déjeuné. Parallèlement à cette activité elle vend des sacs à main et des chaussures pour dames. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent d'assurer la plus part des dépenses quotidiennes, et de prendre en charge la santé de la famille
texts.en:
Bintou Sané, age 52, is married and has ten children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de ALWAR for eight years.  She has taken on this loan to refurbish and reinforce her eatery, where she sells breakfast every morning.  Concurrently, she sells handbags and shoes for women.  The profits she earns enable her to cover the bulk of day-to-day expenses and to support the family's health.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her restaurant business

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn Z. is from the village of Del Carmen in Iligan City. She is 21 years old. Jovelyn is married and has one young child. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jovelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jovelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell

loans.name: Nai

texts.en: Mrs. Nai K. is a villager in Romeat village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living.  Aside from this, she is a cow breeder. Since the second business is going well she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Kong Seourn, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Nai K. has seven children two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
Llerme tiene 50 años, es madre soltera, vive con su madre, dos hermanas y su hijo de 25 años, quien trabaja y la apoya. Hace un año alquiló un local, juntamente con su hijo, al costado de su casa, donde implementó un negocio de venta de accesorios y útiles de oficina, y cabinas para el servicio de Internet. Llerme se decidió por este rubro porque en la zona donde vive hay varias oficinas legales y contables y las personas que trabajan allí son sus principales clientes. Pero ésta no es la única actividad a la que se dedica Llerme, ya que también trabaja en una heladería atendiendo al público desde hace 11 años. 

Lo que le gusta de sus labores es que se encuentra cerca de su casa, además de dar una buena atención a los clientes y mantener amenas conversaciones con ellos. Por otro lado, considera que le es muy rentable porque el primero es un negocio propio que le genera ingresos diarios, y en la heladería obtiene un pago mensual y seguro. Para un futuro, Llerme quisiera tener una tienda de ropa. 

Este es su 3er crédito con MFP y se siente a gusto en su banco comunal porque no tienen problemas, trabajan bien y son responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más útiles de oficina para incrementar el stock de su negocio.
texts.en:
Llerme, age 50, is a single mother. She lives with her mother, two sisters, and her 25 year old son who works and supports her. For a year, together with her son, she has rented a space next to her home where she has begun a business selling office supplies and operating an internet café. Llerme decided to go into this business because in the area where she lives there are several law and accounting offices, and the people who work there are her principal customers. This is not her only work, however. She also works in an ice cream parlor, serving the public for 11 years.

What she likes about her work is that it is located near her house. In addition, she likes giving good service to her customers and having pleasant conversations with them. Furthermore, she considers her activities profitable because the first is her own business that provides her with daily income, and in the ice cream parlor she obtains secure pay on a monthly basis. In the future, Llerme hopes to have a clothing shop.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she is pleased with her communal bank because they don’t have problems. They work well and are responsible with their payments. With the money that she is now applying for she will buy more office supplies in order to increase the stock of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man. He has owned a beauty salon called "Abelardo" since 2008 and has eight years of experience in this field. He decided to have his own business to earn a good income.

Today, Mahmoud is requesting $1,200 to buy more tools and merchandise in order to expand and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy more tools and merchandise

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 45-year-old married mother of nine children between the ages of 12 and 28. Five of her children go to school. She owns a three-room house where she lives with ten people. Joyce takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs transportation costs to and from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala city. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Joyce works six days a week, receiving an average of four customers a day. She works with all categories of people.

Joyce owns a ladies' beauty salon in Mengo Kisenyi. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of hair conditioners and hair extensions as well as the rainy season, which hinders her customers coming to her because she works from a muddy place. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, feeding the family and medication. She has been in this business for twenty years and with MCDT for four years, now servicing her 8th loan.

Joyce joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with the people. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of hair conditioners and extensions. She is hoping to see her business grow bigger and would like to start a bridal salon.

loans.use: To buy more hair condtioners and extensions

loans.name: Alaba

texts.en: Alaba is excited to take a Kiva loan. She is 30 years old and married with two children.  She sells tailoring materials and has been in the business for the past 13 years. She is requesting a loan of N50,000. She will use this loan to buy tailoring materials in bulk to get a better price. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is twenty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and their children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the local people. Nancy is a trader. Her business is local soap production. Nancy prepares the soap out of soda, palm oil, and other ingredients, supplying it to retailers. Nancy has been in this business for ten years and wants a loan to buy soda and other soap manufacturing ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for soap making.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothea D., 30, has been selling grocery for more than four years. She lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

She previously applied for a Kiva loan through Maxima. She is now requesting another loan in the mount of US$1,000 to add to her own savings to build a kitchen and restroom for use by her family.

loans.use: To add to her own savings to build a kitchen and restroom for use by her family.

loans.name: Seoun

texts.en:
Seoun P., 31, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is in business as a recycler, earning an income of US$3 per day. She collects recyclable materials and old batteries from her village and has been in this business since 2005. Her husband helps her in the business and does the same job, earning US$3 per day.

P. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well so as to provide for the necessary daily expenses. Therefore, P. is requesting a loan of US$800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Dory

texts.es:
La Sra. Dory, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 41 años y 02 hijos que ya son independientes. Dory presenta Estudios hasta segundo grado de primaria por motivos de salud no estudio.

Dory, es una mujer  Luchadora y con ganas de salir siempre adelante, se siente capaz de seguir trabajando esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vende en el Mercado Central de su Distrito y sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes.

Se inicio vendiendo verduras y poco a poco fue ahorrando, de esta manera es que decidió implementar su propio negocio. Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con lo que hace. En su puesto, sus clientes  encuentran lo necesario para preparar sus ensaladas y jugos  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa.

Con este crédito de S/ 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará sacos de yuca,  limones cidras y frutas en diferentes variedades propias de la región, plátanos y maduros en racimos para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Dory, expresa haber cumplido algunas de sus metas que tiene trazada en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y a desarrollarse como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Dory belongs to the "Honesty and Work" Community Bank in the Juanjui District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, San Martín Department of Peru. She is in a common-law marriage, 41 years old, and has two children grown children. Dory completed school up until second grade but went no further due to health problems. Dory is a determined woman with a will to always get ahead. She is very happy with the work she does selling fruits and vegetables at the Central Market of her district. Her sales do very well since she is well known by her customers. She started out selling vegetables and little by little saved up and eventually decided to start her own business. She currently runs the same business and is very happy with what she does. With this loan of 2,500 nuevos soles she will buy bags of yuca, lemons, other fruit varieties from the region, and bunches of bananas and plantains in order to better serve her customers and help them find what they need. Dory says she has accomplished some of the goals she has set for her life. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and develop as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to supply her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is from the village of Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. She is married and has 5 school-aged children.

To make a living Elsa operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily use products to the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elsa joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Elsa is requesting her second loan, of 8000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 56 years old and she is a widow with 6 children. Life as a widow has not been easy for her and the children. She is also a grand mother. Her youngest child is 16 years old. She sells drinks and sachet water to make a living in Lagos state. She loves her business because she is able to make profits. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase drinks and sachet water to sell. She has a good relationship with LAPO. (Lift above poverty organisation) is committed to improving lives in Ningeria and else where in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell
